11cacd0e-bb17-40b6-a341-693b74c8dc95.name: BREATH IS VOW
11cacd0e-bb17-40b6-a341-693b74c8dc95.sound: Hypnotic psychedelic soul, brutal male baritone spoken-sung, 86 BPM with strong groove, tape-saturated, liquid but punchy bass, wah-wah texture, vintage Hammond organ, tight drum groove (kick + snare + ride), cold sensuality, surreal lyrics, no climax, analog warmth, lifetime as ritual, no female lead, no melody, no falsetto.
11cacd0e-bb17-40b6-a341-693b74c8dc95.lyrics:
[Intro: 4 sec — punchy liquid bass locks in, tight drum groove (kick+snare+ride), vintage Hammond drone, wah-wah guitar texture, tape hiss]
[MALE voice — low baritone, rhythmic spoken-sung, dry, gravelly — lands on snare]
Every breath... is a vow...
[Hammond swells on “vow...”]
Every step... is a bow...
[guitar: wah pulse on “bow...”]
→ [VERSE 1]
I don’t walk... I trace...
[bass slides on “trace...”]
The shape... of empty space...
[snare ghost notes under “space...”]
My shadow... not behind...
[kick drum accents “behind...”]
Folded... in my spine...
[voice drops — “spine...” → tape echo]
→ [CHORUS]
Lifetime... as ritual...
[Hammond + bass lock — warm, pulsing]
No start... no end...
[ride cymbal shimmers — steady groove]
Just the hum... where I’ve been...
[guitar: wah texture — breathing, not floating]
Just the vow... I repeat...
[tape echo on “repeat...” — tight, not long]
→ [VERSE 2]
I don’t speak... I pour...
[drums: snare crack on “pour...”]
Words like oil... on the floor...
[bass: punchy slide on “floor...”]
The clock... has no hands...
[Hammond drops — tension]
Just the weight... of waiting sand...
[guitar: reverse wah swell — short, sharp]
→ [CHORUS]
Lifetime... as ritual...
[backing: wordless “ahh...” — far back, -24dB, panned wide]
No start... no end...
[drums groove deeper — snare tighter]
Just the hum... where I’ve been...
[bass + Hammond pulse — warm, grounded]
Just the vow... I repeat...
[tape flutter on “repeat...”]
→ [OUTRO]
Breath... is vow...
[drums fade last — groove holds till end]
Step... is bow...
[bass sustains → low-pass closes]
Lifetime... as ritual...
[Hammond + guitar dissolve into drone → vinyl run-out]

28ba31a1-9988-4447-88a9-ce1343adf448.name: Room 7, No Knock (Variation)
28ba31a1-9988-4447-88a9-ce1343adf448.sound: hypnotic psychedelic soul, brutal male baritone starting with a whisper, 72 BPM, slow tight drum groove with ride cymbal, liquid and punchy Fender bass, atmospheric wah-wah guitar texture, vintage Hammond organ with slow Leslie speaker, tape saturation, analog warmth, vinyl crackle, surreal desert motel lyrics, cold sensuality, no climax, stream-of-consciousness, recorded in a 1977 Los Angeles basement studio, no female vocals, no falsetto, no reverb, tape echo only
28ba31a1-9988-4447-88a9-ce1343adf448.lyrics:
(Whispered, close-mic'd, with audible tape hiss)
The key... is just a weight in the palm.
A promise of four walls... (slight pause) and a lock that don't work.
(Baritone emerges, dry and present, over a slow bass groove)
The neon bleeds a baptism on the asphalt.
A red, wet cross... for the newly arrived.
(Tape echo on the last phrase) "newly arrived..."
(Spoken-sung, rhythmically, as drums and organ fade in)
I trace the crack in the ceiling... it maps a river I'll never sail.
The phone is a black, dumb animal... sleeping in its cradle.
(Voice becomes fuller, more resonant, with cold intensity)
You left a scent of smoke and rain... a ghost in the air conditioner's hum.
I wear the silence like a second skin... stretched tight over these bones.
(Low-pass filter on the voice briefly) "stretched tight..."
(Voice drops to a gritty spoken word, rhythm section continues hypnotically)
There's a bible in the drawer... thin as a knife.
I read the blank pages... between the words.
(Dissolves to a whisper, with vinyl crackle becoming prominent)
The dust doesn't care who pays the rent.
It just... settles.
On me.
On everything.

7fc9834b-52df-4ae3-9357-9b1e620e2be1.name: Dans Mes Rêves
7fc9834b-52df-4ae3-9357-9b1e620e2be1.sound: Lounge Lo-fi, gentle French vocals, dreamy jazz samples, mellow beats
7fc9834b-52df-4ae3-9357-9b1e620e2be1.lyrics:
[Verse 1]
Dans ce café tard le soir
Je pense à toi
Le jazz joue doucement
(La la la)
Et je me souviens
De nos moments
[Chorus]
Dans mes rêves, je te vois
Comme si tu étais là
Dans mes rêves, je te vois
(Oh, je te vois)
[Verse 2]
Les heures passent lentement
Je bois mon thé
Les notes de piano
(La la la)
Me rappellent ton rire
Et ta voix douce
[Bridge]
[Spoken softly]
Parfois je ferme les yeux
Et tout devient clair
Tu es toujours avec moi
Dans ces moments
[Solo]
[Jazz piano melody]
(La la la, oh oh)
[Chorus]
Dans mes rêves, je te vois
Comme si tu étais là
Dans mes rêves, je te vois
(Je te vois toujours)

25303d3e-cc36-4e58-b108-c0d170789ccd.name: Last Train
25303d3e-cc36-4e58-b108-c0d170789ccd.sound: Lo-fi, jungle fast beat, reverb surf guitar, deep bass, dreamy atmosphere, reverb female vocals, Russian lyrics, theme song big cities trouble
25303d3e-cc36-4e58-b108-c0d170789ccd.lyrics:
[Интро: радио голос]
(...осторожно двери закрываются)
[Куплет 1]
Я бегу, чтоб успеть, чтоб не опоздать,
В этом городе вечном — нельзя отставать.
Фонари освещают мой быстрый путь,
И минуты как капли — их не вернуть.
В лабиринте улиц я знаю маршрут,
Где рельсы судьбы меня вдаль ведут.
[Припев]
Последний вагон — это мой маяк,
И каждый шаг вперёд — как верный знак,
Что этот путь судьбой мне дан,
В ночной тиши разгадывать обман.
[Инструментальный проигрыш: reverb bass + bass guitar]
[Бридж]
Между станций и остановок,
В ритме города, в танце минут,
Я нашёл свой особенный голос,
Где часы по-другому идут.
В этом мире стальных расстояний
Каждый миг открывает свой путь,
И в потоке случайных свиданий
Я пытаюсь понять жизни суть.
[Куплет 2]
В этом вагоне пустом лишь эхо шагов,
И моё отражение в окнах стеклянных веков.
Время здесь замерло, будто в плену,
Я смотрю сквозь стекло в ночную луну.
Мысли уносятся вдаль без конца,
В ритме колёс находя новые места.
[Бридж 2]
В тишине этих поздних поездок,
Где минуты плывут как вода,
Я ищу свой особенный метод
Быть собой сквозь года и века.
В этих рельсах железных познаний
Открываю я новую даль,
И сквозь ритм городских расстояний
Понимаю всю жизни мораль.
[Инструментальный проигрыш: reverb bass + bass guitar]
[Припев 2]
Последний вагон — это мой билет,
В мир, где всё возможно, где ответа нет.
Станции мелькают, как листы календаря,
В этом одиночестве я нахожу себя.
Каждый поворот пути - новый старт,
В глубине души храня свой тайный дар.
[Аутро: радио голос]
(...последняя станция, просим покинуть вагоны...)

a3cb0e17-31ec-441e-a13d-8e998bfcd8e5.name: Let It Go
a3cb0e17-31ec-441e-a13d-8e998bfcd8e5.sound: LUXURY female vocal tech house 128bpm, elite brands & night club vibe, hypnotic vocals (female only), trancey memorable hook, velvet texture, marble fx, VIP FX: hidden 18.5kHz layer + 19kHz pulse (every 8 bars). RULES: NO male vocals, NO English, ONLY short vocal samples & phrases in French/Italian/Spanish, NO verse lyrics, NO pre-chorus > 3 sec, DJ friendly: 16-bar intro and outro with clean groove for mixing, vocals used as rhythmic samples, chorus (hook) is catchy and extremely danceable, luxury positive club energy.

3276ad92-7f97-42f7-8204-a2cf4e0d9122.name: Short Circuit (Psychedelic Jazz)
3276ad92-7f97-42f7-8204-a2cf4e0d9122.sound: psychedelic jazz, spiritual jazz, male baritone spoken word, hypnotic Fender Rhodes electric piano, expressive double bass, loose jazz drumming with brushwork, atmospheric flute, hypnotic and expansive, lyrical themes of consciousness, recorded live in studio 1972, analog warmth, no guitars.
3276ad92-7f97-42f7-8204-a2cf4e0d9122.lyrics:
[Intro]
The signal cuts... the screen goes grey...
A silent end... to what we didn't say...
[Verse 1]
I trace the wires... back to the source...
A cold, hard light... with no remorse...
The pattern repeats... a faulty code...
A debt on a road... that was never showed...
[Pre-Chorus]
And the current hums... a dead refrain...
It knows my name... it knows my pain...
It pulls me in... to the static sea...
Where you look through me... and I look through thee...
[Chorus]
A short circuit... in the heart of the night...
A wrong connection... burning too bright...
The fuse is blown... the power's gone...
But the echo lingers... on and on...
[Verse 2]
We built this tower... of glass and fear...
To talk to ghosts... year after year...
The receiver's cold... against my ear...
There's no one there... but I still hear...
[Pre-Chorus]
And the current hums... a dead refrain...
It knows my name... it knows my pain...
It pulls me in... to the static sea...
Where you look through me... and I look through thee...
[Chorus]
A short circuit... in the heart of the night...
A wrong connection... burning too bright...
The fuse is blown... the power's gone...
But the echo lingers... on and on...
[Outro]
On and on...
The echo...
...lingers.

784f3ef8-728b-4b66-bfa6-0e71c82fb5b7.name: We float on a melody
784f3ef8-728b-4b66-bfa6-0e71c82fb5b7.sound:
Psychedelic soul, smooth male falsetto, hypnotic bassline, wah-wah guitar, lush string arrangements, vintage organs, dreamy atmosphere, 70s vibe, emotional delivery, poetic lyrics, hazy summer feel, 100 BPM, subtle percussion, layered harmonies, catchy chorus with memorable melodic phrase

Keywords: psychedelic soul, male falsetto, hypnotic bass, wah-wah guitar, strings, vintage organs, dreamy, 70s vibe, emotional, poetic, hazy, layered harmonies, catchy chorus
784f3ef8-728b-4b66-bfa6-0e71c82fb5b7.lyrics:
[Intro]
[wah-wah guitar sweep, organ drone]
[soft falsetto] Hmmm... yeah...
[Verse 1]
Golden hour paints the room in amber light
Silk curtains dancing with the summer night
Your shadow moves across the wooden floor
Like we've been here a thousand times before
[Pre-Chorus]
[strings enter softly]
The world outside has faded to a haze
Lost in this sweet psychedelic phase
Time slows down to just a gentle flow
Where only love and music grow
[Chorus]
[full band enters with lush harmonies]
WE FLOAT ON A MELODY OF PURE GOLD
THROUGH PURPLE SKIES AND STORIES UNTOLD
THIS DREAM WE CARRY IN OUR SOUL
A JOURNEY MAKING US WHOLE
[Verse 2]
Incense swirls in patterns through the air
Your fingers trace the patterns in my hair
The vinyl spins our favorite hazy tune
Beneath the honey-sickle moon
[Pre-Chorus]
[strings swell gently]
The world outside has faded to a haze
Lost in this sweet psychedelic phase
Time slows down to just a gentle flow
Where only love and music grow
[Chorus]
[harmonies richer, more layered]
WE FLOAT ON A MELODY OF PURE GOLD
THROUGH PURPLE SKIES AND STORIES UNTOLD
THIS DREAM WE CARRY IN OUR SOUL
A JOURNEY MAKING US WHOLE
[Bridge]
[organ solo, bass becomes more prominent]
Colors blend and boundaries bend
Reality can wait, my friend...
This moment is our universe
No beginning and no end
[Guitar Solo]
[wah-wah guitar takes the melody, strings support]
[hypnotic bassline continues driving]
[Final Chorus]
[full energy, passionate vocals]
WE FLOAT ON A MELODY OF PURE GOLD
THROUGH PURPLE SKIES AND STORIES UNTOLD
THIS DREAM WE CARRY IN OUR SOUL
A JOURNEY MAKING US WHOLE
[Outro]
[music gradually dissolves]
Floating... dreaming...
[whispered] Forever in this haze...
[last organ chord fades]
[silence]

6270a476-8169-4581-b344-f5b89b1b1046.name: SPACE BETWEEN US (Variation)
6270a476-8169-4581-b344-f5b89b1b1046.sound: Hypnotic psychedelic soul, brutal male baritone spoken-sung, 86 BPM with strong groove, tape-saturated, liquid but punchy bass, wah-wah texture, vintage Hammond organ, tight drum groove (kick + snare + ride), cold sensuality, surreal lyrics about the space between two people as living cosmic void, no climax, analog warmth, lifetime as ritual, no female lead, no melody, no falsetto.
6270a476-8169-4581-b344-f5b89b1b1046.lyrics:
[Intro: 4 sec — liquid bass pulse (sub-heavy), tight drum groove, Hammond drone (low-pass filtered), wah-wah guitar texture (like radio waves), tape hiss, distant oscillator hum]
[MALE voice — dry, low baritone, rhythmic spoken-sung — lands on snare]
The space...
(backing: none)
Between us...
[Hammond swells — slow, cosmic]
Is not empty...
[guitar: wah pulse — like pulsar]
It breathes...
[bass slides — sub rumble felt in chest]
→ [VERSE 1]
I don’t reach...
[drums: snare crack on “reach...”]
I orbit...
[kick drum heartbeat under “orbit...”]
Your silence...
[guitar: e-bow swell — sustained, cold]
My noise...
[voice slightly distorted on “noise...” — tape saturation]
→ [CHORUS]
Space... between us...
[Hammond + bass lock — pulsing, warm under cold]
Not void... but vow...
[ride cymbal shimmers — steady, hypnotic]
No distance... no end...
[guitar: wah texture — like static between stars]
Just the hum... of slow spin...
[tape echo on “spin...” — tight, decaying]
→ [VERSE 2]
Your light...
[drums: ghost snare on “light...”]
Is not for me...
[bass: punchy slide on “me...”]
It’s the field...
[Hammond drone drops — tension]
Where I learn... to bend...
[guitar: reverse wah swell — short, like signal burst]
→ [CHORUS]
Space... between us...
[backing: wordless “ahh...” — far back, -24dB, panned wide — like cosmic wind]

eeb23930-590b-4b1e-8daa-cac5b880801d.name: THE EDGE OF YES
eeb23930-590b-4b1e-8daa-cac5b880801d.sound: Hypnotic psychedelic soul, brutal male baritone spoken-word (not sung), 86 BPM with tense groove, tape-saturated, liquid bass with syncopated pulses, wah-wah stabs (rhythmic, not melodic), vintage Hammond swells, tight drum groove (kick + snare + ride), raw surreal lyrics — fragmented, non-linear, cinematic, no chorus, no verse repetition, no "I saw you" clichés, analog warmth, 1970s underground film vibe, no female lead, no melody, no falsetto, building tension without climax.
eeb23930-590b-4b1e-8daa-cac5b880801d.lyrics:
[Intro: 3 sec — bass enters with syncopated pulse, drums tight (snare on 2 and 4), Hammond swells like distant sirens, wah-wah stabs (short, sharp), tape hiss]
[MALE voice — dry, low, urgent, no melody — like confession under streetlight]
Your glove...
...still on my dashboard.
[Hammond swells — tense]
Three weeks.
I haven’t moved the car.
[guitar: wah stab — like brake screech]
→
Rain last Tuesday.
You stood under the awning...
...and lit a cigarette with someone else’s hand.
[bass: syncopated slide — nervous]
I drove past.
Didn’t wave.
Didn’t breathe.
[drums: snare ghost notes — heartbeat racing]
→
The coffee cup...
...you left at my place.
I drink from it every morning.
Cold.
[voice cracks — “cold...” → tape saturation]
It tastes like your silence.
[2 sec pause — only bass pulse]
→
I dreamt you said “yes”.
Not with words.
With your shoulders...
...when you turned to leave.
[Hammond drone drops — tension]
They said “yes”.
[guitar: reverse wah stab — like memory rewinding]
→
I don’t write songs.
I collect moments.
Like broken glass.
Like bus tickets.
Like the way your hair smells...
...after rain.
[drums: kick accelerates slightly — then locks back]
→
I’m not asking.
I’m standing...
...on the edge of yes.
And I won’t jump.
I’ll just...
...stay here.
Until the edge...
...becomes home.
[voice drops to whisper — “home...”]
→ [OUTRO]
[Instruments swell — bass pulses faster, Hammond swells, wah stabs repeat, drums tighten]
But if you...
...ever...
...look back...
[MALE voice: final line — dry, raw, no effects]
I’ll be the shadow... that doesn’t move.
[Music cuts abruptly → 3 sec silence → single vinyl pop → END]

53996a54-2f1a-4d74-8f61-d51ad93fed47.name: I WON’T WHISPER ANYMORE (Variation)
53996a54-2f1a-4d74-8f61-d51ad93fed47.sound: Hypnotic psychedelic soul, MALE VOCAL ONLY: starts as gritty whispered spoken-word, builds to full brutal baritone solo (no falsetto, no clean tones), 86 BPM with intensifying groove, tape-saturated, liquid bass with rising tension, wah-wah texture evolving to rhythmic stabs, vintage Hammond swells, tight drum groove (kick + snare + ride), raw cinematic lyrics — no chorus, no repetition, analog warmth, 1970s underground film climax vibe, no female vocals, no melody, no climax explosion — only vocal and emotional release.
53996a54-2f1a-4d74-8f61-d51ad93fed47.lyrics:
[Intro: 4 sec — bass pulses softly, drums minimal (kick only), Hammond drone low, tape hiss, vinyl crackle]
[MALE voice — gritty whisper, dry, close-mic, ASMR-level intimacy]
I’ve whispered...
...your name...
...into bus windows...
...into coffee steam...
...into the space...
...between heartbeats...
[each line slower, breathier — bass barely present]
→
I’ve traced your shadow...
...on rainy streets...
...with my eyes...
...like a thief...
...stealing light...
[Hammond swells faintly — like distant memory]
→
I’ve held my breath...
...when you passed...
...so you wouldn’t hear...
...how loud...
...my silence was...
[drums: first snare ghost note — soft, like a pulse]
→ [VOICE BEGINS TO RISE — STILL SPOKEN, BUT FULLER]
But tonight...
...the silence broke.
Not with a shout.
With a truth.
[bass: liquid pulse intensifies]
[guitar: first wah texture — like metal waking]
→ [FULL BARITONE ENTERS — WARM, BRUTAL, NO EFFECTS, CENTERED]
I won’t whisper anymore.
[Hammond swells — warm, wide]
I won’t hide in the edges of your day.
[drums lock in — tight groove, snare crisp]
I won’t be the ghost...
...that lingers...
...in your rearview.
[guitar: wah stabs — rhythmic, not melodic]
→ [BARITONE SOLO — RAW, NO MELODY, ONLY DECLARATION]
I am here.
Not as a question.
As a fact.
Like rain.
Like streetlights.
Like the ache...
...in your bones...
...when you walk alone.
[bass: punchy, syncopated — heartbeat now strong]
[Hammond: stabs + drone — tension and warmth]
I am not asking.
I am stating:
I. Am. Here.
→ [OUTRO — VOICE RETURNS TO WHISPER, BUT CALMER, RESOLVED]
So if you turn...
...don’t look for a whisper.
Look for the man...
...who finally...
...stopped hiding.
[Music fades slowly — bass last to go]
[Final line — dry whisper, no effects]
I’m right here.
[3 sec silence → vinyl run-out → END]

49798745-1778-4f80-8cf9-ef20a70519ea.name: The Ghost in the Glass
49798745-1778-4f80-8cf9-ef20a70519ea.sound: Hypnotic psychedelic soul, brutal male baritone spoken-sung, 86 BPM with strong groove, tape-saturated, liquid but punchy bass, wah-wah texture, vintage Hammond organ, tight drum groove (kick + snare + ride), cold sensuality, surreal lyrics, no climax, analog warmth, lifetime as ritual, no female lead, no melody, no falsetto.
49798745-1778-4f80-8cf9-ef20a70519ea.lyrics:
[Intro: 6 sec — punchy liquid bassline locks in with tight drum groove (kick+snare+ride), vintage Hammond organ holds a minor chord with slow Leslie, atmospheric wah-wah texture, tape saturation]
[MALE voice — low baritone, rhythmic spoken-sung, dry, close-mic'd — lands on snare]
The ghost in the glass... is learning to smile...
[Hammond swells slightly on “smile...”]
He practices my face... for a little while...
[guitar: subtle wah pulse on “while...”]
→ [VERSE 1]
He wears my skin... but it's loose on the bone...
[bass slides down on “bone...”]
Talks in my voice... but it's not his own...
[snare ghost notes under “own...”]
The neon outside... writes a script on the wall...
[kick drum accents “wall...”]
And he reads every line... 'til the morning call...
[voice drops — “call...” → tight tape echo]
→ [CHORUS]
We share a name... in this rented air...
[Hammond + bass lock into a hypnotic groove]
A silent pact... an unspoken prayer...
[ride cymbal steady, groove deepens]
Two shadows thrown... where the light is thin...
[guitar: wah texture breathes in and out]
One of them's his... and the other's mine...
[tape echo on “mine...” — single repeat]
→ [VERSE 2]
I pour a drink... he drinks it too...
[drums: snare crack on “too...”]
He knows all the words... to the blues I can't sing...
[bass: melodic run on “sing...”]
The mirror's a door... that I can't close...
[Hammond chord changes, creating tension]
And he's always home... wherever I go...
[guitar: reverse wah swell — eerie, short]
→ [CHORUS]
We share a name... in this rented air...
[backing: wordless male baritone “ohh” — far back, -20dB, panned left]
A silent pact... an unspoken prayer...
[drums groove tighter, more insistent]
Two shadows thrown... where the light is thin...
[bass + Hammond pulse — warm and dark]
One of them's his... and the other's mine...
[tape flutter on “mine...”]
→ [OUTRO]
The ghost in the glass... is learning to smile...
[drums fade last — kick and snare hold the groove]
He'll be me... in a little while...
[bass sustains final note → low-pass filter closes slowly]
We share a name... in this rented air...
[Hammond + guitar dissolve into tape hiss → vinyl run-out groove]

41cb138c-2e25-4992-abcb-fb6d03277378.name: Echo Location
41cb138c-2e25-4992-abcb-fb6d03277378.sound: Hypnotic psychedelic soul, brutal male baritone spoken-sung, 86 BPM with strong groove, tape-saturated, liquid but punchy bass, wah-wah texture, vintage Hammond organ, tight drum groove (kick + snare + ride), cold sensuality, surreal lyrics, verse-prechorus-chorus structure, no climax, analog warmth, lifetime as ritual, no female lead, no melody, no falsetto.
41cb138c-2e25-4992-abcb-fb6d03277378.lyrics:
[Intro: 5 sec — punchy liquid bassline, tight drum groove (kick+snare+ride), vintage Hammond drone, atmospheric wah-wah, tape saturation]
[MALE voice — low baritone, rhythmic spoken-sung, dry — locks with snare]
I send my voice out... into the dark...
[Hammond swells on “dark...”]
It hits the walls... and leaves a mark...
[wah-wah texture pulses on “mark...”]
→ [VERSE 1]
A question asked... not to be heard...
[bass slides down on “heard...”]
Just to feel the shape... of its own word...
[snare ghost notes under “word...”]
The silence here... it's thick and deep...
[kick drum accents “deep...”]
A secret that... the night will keep...
[voice drops — “keep...” → tight tape echo]
→ [PRE-CHORUS]
And the echo comes back... thinner each time...
[Hammond plays higher, tense chords, bass becomes more active]
A faded outline... a distant rhyme...
[drums build slightly, ride cymbal more prominent]
Telling me where... the edges are...
[voice intensity increases, still spoken]
How close I am... and how far...
[tape echo on “far...” builds tension]
→ [CHORUS]
Echo location... in a rented room...
[Hammond + bass lock into a powerful, hypnotic groove]
Mapping the corners... of impending doom...
[drums are tight and driving, snare cracks]
I navigate by... the sound of my fall...
[wah-wah guitar texture becomes rhythmic]
And the echo answers... nothing at all...
[tape echo on “all...” — decays into groove]
→ [VERSE 2]
I speak your name... just to test the air...
[drums return to verse groove, snare crisp on “air...”]
It travels far... but doesn't care...
[bassline melodic walkdown on “care...”]
It hits the window... and the locked door...
[Hammond creates suspense with a minor change]
A message sent... to no one anymore...
[guitar: subtle reverse effect on “anymore...”]
→ [PRE-CHORUS]
And the echo comes back... thinner each time...
[Hammond tension returns, ride cymbal drives forward]
A faded outline... a distant rhyme...
[voice gains gravelly intensity]
Telling me where... the edges are...
[bassline pushes the rhythm]
How close I am... and how far...
[tape echo builds louder]
→ [CHORUS]
Echo location... in a rented room...
[full band hits the groove with power, cold sensuality]
Mapping the corners... of impending doom...
I navigate by... the sound of my fall...
And the echo answers... nothing at all...
→ [Outro]
Echo... location...
[drums fade, leaving bass and Hammond drone]
Nothing at all...
[voice whispers, heavy tape echo]
The sound... of my fall...
[bass sustains final note, low-pass filter closes]

66f6df8e-545d-431b-8109-7a27c932e4cb.name: Forget the rules (Variation)
66f6df8e-545d-431b-8109-7a27c932e4cb.sound: psychedelic rock, late 1970s, gritty male lead vocal, layered backing vocals, analog tape warmth, vinyl crackle, fuzz guitar, Hammond organ, heavy spring reverb, analog delay, slow tempo 70 BPM, underground psychedelic club vibe, acid rock atmosphere, mystical and surreal mood, structure: verse-chorus-verse-chorus-bridge-outro, guitar solo after second chorus with wah-wah, phaser and flanger on vocals and instruments, light distortion on lead vocal, whispered backing chants, ad-libs with reverse effects and panning, fade-out with run-out groove sound, smoky, hypnotic, immersive stereo field
66f6df8e-545d-431b-8109-7a27c932e4cb.lyrics:
Verse 1:
Through smoke and mirrors — I trace your glow,
(whispered: glow... glow...)
You dance on the edge where strange winds blow.
[slight tape wobble, distant chime]
The guitar howls like a beast in chains,
(oooh yeah...)
We’re ash and echoes whispering refrains.
[pan left, vinyl pop]
Chorus:
Forget the rules, forget the dawn —
(backing: no rules! no dawn!)
Here, rhythm rules where hearts are drawn.
[Hammond swell, phaser on vocals]
Acid rain and neon light —
(backing: rain... light...)
We won’t die… we’ll just fade into night.
[sudden flanger sweep, echo tail]
Verse 2:
You whisper numbers — 6, 9, 13,
(whispered chant: six-nine-thirteen...)
Cracks in the ceiling — Eden’s unseen.
[guitar slide + reverse cymbal]
Whiskey in eyes, but the soul runs clean —
(backing: so clean...)
We build our heaven from broken beams.
[tape stop effect → restart]
Chorus:
Forget the rules, forget the dawn —
(backing: burn the dawn!)
Here, rhythm rules where hearts are drawn.
[organ glissando, vocal double]
Acid rain and neon light —
(backing: falling... falling...)
We won’t die… we’ll just fade into night.
[long reverb tail, panning right]
Bridge (whisper → scream):
Can you hear it?... That’s the organ... Time is knocking...
(whispered: tick... tock... tick...) [low-pass filter, heartbeat bass]
(GUITAR EXPLOSION) — I DON’T WANT TO GO BACK LIVING!
[distorted scream, tape saturation, feedback squeal]
Outro (slow fade, echo):
Drifting... in smoke... in sound... in hue...
(backing: drifting... drifting...) [reverse vocal layer]
Where time’s a myth... and laws untrue...
[organ drone, vinyl run-out groove loop, fade to silence over 8 sec]

4ff0e964-4683-4799-92b5-eff658a1c68f.name: 3:17 AM Ritual
4ff0e964-4683-4799-92b5-eff658a1c68f.sound: Male baritone only—whispered verses, dry spoken-word choruses, raw and intimate. Rhythm built from domestic sounds: dripping faucet (82 BPM), spoon-on-glass taps, chair creaks, subtle kitchen ambience. No instruments, no reverb, no digital effects. Only analog tape saturation, light vinyl crackle, and natural room tone. Mood: nocturnal, ritualistic, melancholic domestic surrealism. Style: 1976 Los Angeles basement apartment session, voice as confessional, household objects as percussion.
4ff0e964-4683-4799-92b5-eff658a1c68f.lyrics:
[INTRO]
[dripping faucet — slow, metallic, 82 BPM]
[chair creaks once]
[whispered, lips almost touching mic]
…again…
[VERSE 1]
[whispered, rhythmic, synced to drip]
I brew silence in a chipped blue pot—
three spoons of sugar, none for taste.
Just the sound of crystals hitting glass…
like footsteps on a frozen lake.
[PRE-CHORUS]
[spoon taps glass — once, twice, triplet]
The clock’s hands are sleeping.
The fridge hums a hymn.
[CHORUS]
[spoken-word, low baritone, dry and close]
This is how I worship now:
steam, sugar, and the shape of your absence.
No prayers.
Just routine.
[VERSE 2]
[whisper returns, breathier, with subtle lip smacks]
I set two cups on the table—
yours collects dust, mine collects rain
from the leak above the sink.
We still drink together.
[PRE-CHORUS]
[fork scrapes plate — slow, deliberate]
The moon watches through grease on glass.
It doesn’t blink. Neither do I.
[CHORUS]
[spoken-word, same tone, slight tape saturation swell]
This is how I worship now:
steam, sugar, and the shape of your absence.
No prayers.
Just routine.
[POST-CHORUS]
[layered whispers, slightly off-grid]
Steam…
Sugar…
Shape…
[spoon taps fade into raindrops outside]
[OUTRO]
[kettle begins to whistle softly — then cuts off abruptly]
[final whisper]
…same time tomorrow…
[5 seconds of dripping faucet + distant rain, then tape stop]

5d14f474-8c3d-4945-a244-687b2d3dd85d.name: Mantra for a Wired God (Variation)
5d14f474-8c3d-4945-a244-687b2d3dd85d.sound: Spiritual jazz, psychedelic jazz, male baritone spoken word, hypnotic Fender Rhodes electric piano with phaser, expressive upright bass, loose polyrhythmic jazz drumming with brushes and bongos, atmospheric flute, fiery tenor saxophone solo, hypnotic and expansive, lyrical themes of consciousness and technology, recorded live in studio 1972, analog warmth, no guitars.
5d14f474-8c3d-4945-a244-687b2d3dd85d.lyrics:
[Intro: Fender Rhodes plays a hypnotic, circular motif. Upright bass enters with a deep, walking line. Drums set a loose, polyrhythmic pattern with brushwork on the snare. A flute plays a sparse, melodic theme.]
[MALE VOICE — baritone, spoken word, calm and meditative]
The circuit is a prayer... the hum is the amen...
[Rhodes responds with a shimmering chord]
The light in the machine... is the same as in men...
[Bassline becomes more melodic, exploratory]
[Verse 1]
I close my eyes... to see the code...
[Flute intertwines with the vocal line]
A universe... in a single node...
Patterns emerge... from the empty noise...
A silent language... that has no voice...
[Drums shift subtly, adding a light bongo pattern]
[Pre-Chorus]
The voltage climbs... the spirit flies...
[Rhodes begins a subtle, swirling phaser effect]
Beyond the flesh... beyond the eyes...
The body is an antenna... weak and frail...
Tuning in... to a cosmic gale...
[Upright bass plays a rapid, ascending run]
[Chorus — Voice becomes more rhythmic, almost chanting]
Electric ascension... through the wire and bone...
[Full band comes together in a powerful, melodic theme]
A current of consciousness... to the unknown...
Losing the signal... to find the soul...
The machine makes... the broken whole...
[Tenor saxophone enters with a short, crying riff]
[Instrumental Break: Tenor sax takes a fiery, exploratory solo over the driving rhythm section. Rhodes comps with dissonant chords. Drums are explosive but controlled.]
[Verse 2]
The screen is a pond... the mind is a stone...
[Rippling effect on the Rhodes]
The ripples touch... what can't be known...
Data like stardust... on a digital wind...
A new reality... is about to begin...
[Bass and drums drop out, leaving only voice and sparse Rhodes chords]
[Pre-Chorus]
The voltage climbs... the spirit flies...
[Band slowly builds back up]
Beyond the flesh... beyond the eyes...
The body is an antenna... weak and frail...
Tuning in... to a cosmic gale...
[Chorus]
Electric ascension... through the wire and bone...
A current of consciousness... to the unknown...
Losing the signal... to find the soul...
The machine makes... the broken whole...
[Outro: Band deconstructs the theme. Saxophone wails freely. Voice returns to a whisper, repeating as music fades into a drone of Rhodes and flute.]
The broken whole... the broken whole...
...the broken whole...

b2729253-ea00-47be-ab5c-915b18c85db0.name: Short Circuit (Trip-Hop) (Variation)
b2729253-ea00-47be-ab5c-915b18c85db0.sound: trip-hop, downtempo, male baritone spoken word, slow breakbeat drum loop, deep and melodic bassline, atmospheric Fender Rhodes electric piano, haunting synth strings, smoky lounge atmosphere, lyrical themes of urban alienation, 1990s Bristol sound, vinyl crackle, sampled textures, no guitars.
b2729253-ea00-47be-ab5c-915b18c85db0.lyrics:
[Intro]
The signal cuts... the screen goes grey...
A silent end... to what we didn't say...
[Verse 1]
I trace the wires... back to the source...
A cold, hard light... with no remorse...
The pattern repeats... a faulty code...
A debt on a road... that was never showed...
[Pre-Chorus]
And the current hums... a dead refrain...
It knows my name... it knows my pain...
It pulls me in... to the static sea...
Where you look through me... and I look through thee...
[Chorus]
A short circuit... in the heart of the night...
A wrong connection... burning too bright...
The fuse is blown... the power's gone...
But the echo lingers... on and on...
[Verse 2]
We built this tower... of glass and fear...
To talk to ghosts... year after year...
The receiver's cold... against my ear...
There's no one there... but I still hear...
[Pre-Chorus]
And the current hums... a dead refrain...
It knows my name... it knows my pain...
It pulls me in... to the static sea...
Where you look through me... and I look through thee...
[Chorus]
A short circuit... in the heart of the night...
A wrong connection... burning too bright...
The fuse is blown... the power's gone...
But the echo lingers... on and on...
[Outro]
On and on...
The echo...
...lingers.

a6846924-baa1-4e10-b6a6-258b2e6c837b.name: The Slowest Fire
a6846924-baa1-4e10-b6a6-258b2e6c837b.sound: hypnotic psychedelic funk soul, brutal male baritone spoken-sung, 98 BPM, tight and driving drum groove, punchy melodic bassline, rhythmic wah-wah guitar, swirling vintage Hammond organ, tape saturation, analog warmth, lyrics about a desert sunset from a motel window, cold sensuality, hypnotic groove, no falsetto, no female vocals, recorded in a 1978 Los Angeles basement, no reverb, tape echo on vocals
a6846924-baa1-4e10-b6a6-258b2e6c837b.lyrics:
(Begins with a tight, driving drum groove and a punchy bassline. Voice enters as a rhythmic, almost conversational spoken-word, matching the tempo.)
The sun doesn't set out here... it bleeds out.
A slow leak in a gasoline sky... (wah-wah guitar texture pulses) ...staining the horizon.
(Baritone becomes more melodic, but still spoken-sung, riding the groove.)
I watch it from this window... frame by dirty frame.
The glass is cool against my forehead... the only cool thing for miles.
The pavement drinks the light... like a drunkard drinks regret.
Slow... and deliberate.
(Voice drops lower, more intense, with a sense of grim admiration.)
This is the slowest fire you'll ever see.
It doesn't roar... (tape echo on "roar") ...it just consumes.
It turns the world to silhouette and ash... without a single sound.
(Returns to a rhythmic whisper over the fading groove, as the organ holds a long note.)
And I am just a witness... with a room key in my hand.
Watching the day burn down... to a single, perfect point of nothing.
Then... the neon signs... (voice trails off) ...flicker on.

e2f17f22-9af0-450f-90bf-a38e3c0efcc2.name: Your Face in the Rain (Variation)
e2f17f22-9af0-450f-90bf-a38e3c0efcc2.sound: Psychedelic soul, melodic psychedelic rock, male baritone vocal, warm and emotional, 78 BPM, strong hypnotic groove, melodic bassline, tight drums, watery Fender Rhodes with slow phaser, warm Hammond organ, atmospheric wah-wah guitar, melancholic tenor saxophone solo, lyrical themes of longing and beautiful hallucinations, heavy tape saturation and analog warmth, subtle vinyl crackle, recorded in 1970 on analog tape, trippy but melodic.
e2f17f22-9af0-450f-90bf-a38e3c0efcc2.lyrics:
[Intro: 6 sec. A melodic bassline sets the groove. Tight drums join. Fender Rhodes plays a chord with a slow phaser, creating a "floating" feel. Subtle vinyl crackle.]
[MALE VOICE - baritone, calm, thoughtful, with slight tape echo]
The rain on the window... isn't water anymore...
It's liquid light... tracing your profile on the glass...
[A wah-wah guitar softly answers with a phrase]
And the whole city... melts into a watercolor...
And the only thing in focus... is this feeling... that will pass... but not yet...
[Sound of rain drops, processed with delay]
[Verse 1]
I try to read the lines... on my own hand...
[The bass leads the melody, taking it elsewhere]
But they rearrange... into a map of your skin...
The clock sings... a lullaby in a foreign language...
And I understand every word... from within...
[A Hammond organ enters with a warm, slightly "drunken" chord]
[Chorus - Voice gains strength, becomes full and emotional, but not shouting]
And I see your face in the rain...
[The rhythm section gains power, the groove deepens]
I hear your name in the train's refrain...
This isn't madness... it's just a different kind of sight...
A beautiful, slow-motion... electrical light...
[A tenor saxophone plays a short, piercing melody]
[Instrumental Break: The saxophone takes a small, melancholic, and melodic blues chorus. Not wild, but full of feeling. Bass and drums support it gently.]
[Verse 2]
The TV mumbles... black and white shadows...
[Voice returns, more weary]
They're performing a play... just for me...
About a man who turned into a frequency...
To reach a woman... who became a memory...
[A flute adds a ghostly texture]
[Chorus]
And I see your face in the rain...
I hear your name in the train's refrain...
This isn't madness... it's just a different kind of sight...
A beautiful, slow-motion... electrical light...
[Outro: Music begins to dissolve. Voice drops to a whisper. Sounds of rain and crackle become louder, absorbing the music.]
Electrical light...
A different kind of sight...
...in the rain...

18493944-a2ea-46af-8430-2720b7c3cfa5.name: The Hum at the Edge of Sleep
18493944-a2ea-46af-8430-2720b7c3cfa5.sound: Spiritual jazz, psychedelic jazz, male baritone spoken word, meditative and slow, hypnotic Fender Rhodes electric piano with slow phaser, deep expressive upright bass, loose jazz drumming with brushes and soft mallets, atmospheric flute solo, soulful tenor saxophone lines, hypnotic and expansive, lyrical themes of consciousness and sleep, recorded live in studio 1973, analog warmth, no guitars, atmospheric use of rainstick and bowed cymbal.
18493944-a2ea-46af-8430-2720b7c3cfa5.lyrics:
[Intro: Upright bass plays a deep, resonant pedal tone. Fender Rhodes enters with sparse, crystalline chords that hang in the air. A rainstick sounds, followed by the gentle swell of a bowed cymbal.]
[MALE VOICE — baritone, almost a whisper, very slow and deliberate]
There is a frequency... beneath the quiet...
A drone... that the planets sing...
[Rhodes plays a subtle, descending melody]
The body slows... but the mind... takes flight...
On a thread... of a single... vibrating... string...
[Bass begins a very slow, walking line]
[Verse 1]
The threshold place... where the walls are thin...
[Flute enters with a breathy, melodic line]
The noise of the day... lets the silence in...
Pulse becomes rhythm... breath becomes tide...
Nowhere... and everywhere... to hide...
[Drums enter with a slow, insistent brush pattern on the snare]
[Pre-Chorus]
The signal weakens... from the station of thought...
[Rhodes introduces a slow, rotating phaser effect]
Fading to patterns... that can't be taught...
Stray memories... like shooting stars...
Blurring the lines... and erasing the scars...
[Bassline becomes more active, probing]
[Chorus — Voice gains a resonant, chanting quality]
The hum at the edge of sleep...
[Tenor sax plays a soulful, repeating riff that underpins the chorus]
A gateway to what the soul can keep...
A forgotten language... speaking clear...
There's nothing... and no one... to fear...
[Drums build slightly, with soft mallets on the toms]
[Instrumental Break: A sublime, exploratory flute solo takes the lead. It's melodic but free, weaving over the tight, hypnotic groove of the rhythm section. The Rhodes provides a shimmering, textured bed.]
[Verse 2]
The weight of skin... begins to release...
[Voice returns, more present and grounded in the groove]
A temporary... and perfect... peace...
The hum is a river... the mind is a boat...
Carried away... from the things we quote...
[Bass and drums lock into a more defined, swinging groove]
[Pre-Chorus]
The signal weakens... from the station of thought...
Fading to patterns... that can't be taught...
Stray memories... like shooting stars...
Blurring the lines... and erasing the scars...
[Chorus]
The hum at the edge of sleep...
A gateway to what the soul can keep...
A forgotten language... speaking clear...
There's nothing... and no one... to fear...
[Outro: The band slowly deconstructs. The flute and sax drop out. Voice whispers the last line repeatedly as the Rhodes, bass, and drums fade into a warm, analog silence.]
Nothing to fear... nothing to fear...
...the hum...

f16e168a-be6f-4eb3-8599-11436890eaea.name: Pont
f16e168a-be6f-4eb3-8599-11436890eaea.sound: Gangsta rap, French lyrics, haunting cello, female vocals, urban noir atmosphere
f16e168a-be6f-4eb3-8599-11436890eaea.lyrics:
[Intro - Female Vocals with Cello]
Entre deux mondes, je suis le pont (La la la...)
Les routes parlent mais je reste fort
[Verse 1]
Tu me vois dans les clubs VIP
Mais je connais chaque rue, chaque nuit
Les riches me parlent d'argent (oh)
Les jeunes me parlent de respect (yeah)
Je garde mes yeux ouverts
Tous les mots valent de l'or
Dans mon quartier je suis né
Maintenant je prends mon café
Avec ceux qui dirigent la cité (dirigent la cité)
Mais mon cœur reste dans la rue
[Chorus]
Entre deux mondes, je suis le pont (je suis le pont)
Les routes parlent mais je reste fort (je reste fort)
[Verse 2]
Les informations c'est ma monnaie
Plus fort que les billets (plus fort)
Je connais tous les secrets (tous les secrets)
Mais ma bouche reste fermée
Les caméras me suivent partout
Je reste calme, je reste doux
Mon pouvoir c'est le silence
Pendant que les autres dansent
[Bridge - Female Vocals]
(La vie est un jeu de cartes
Je distribue, je garde
La la la...)
[Verse 3]
Tu penses me connaître mais non
Je change de masque selon l'occasion
Les costumes ou les baskets (yeah)
Peu importe, je reste direct
Mon territoire s'étend (s'étend)
Du bas jusqu'en haut maintenant
Je suis le pont, je suis le pont
Entre leurs mensonges et la vérité
[Chorus]
Entre deux mondes, je suis le pont (je suis le pont)
Les routes parlent mais je reste fort (je reste fort)
[Outro - Cello Solo with whispered vocals]
(Entre deux mondes...)
(Je suis le pont...)

f4361662-4416-47d9-a7ef-da7966898480.name: Haze
f4361662-4416-47d9-a7ef-da7966898480.sound: Hypnotic psychedelic soul, brutal male baritone, spoken-sung, 86 BPM, tape-saturated, liquid bass, wah-wah texture, vintage organs, cold sensuality, surreal lyrics, no climax, analog warmth, lifetime as ritual
f4361662-4416-47d9-a7ef-da7966898480.lyrics:
[Intro]
[wah-wah guitar — textural swell, no melody]
[organ drone — low-pass filtered, phaser slow]
(hhhnnn...)
[backing: tape hiss, distant sub pulse]
[Verse 1]
Neon dusk stains the room in amber rust
Curtains breathe with the static gust
My shadow moves across the wooden floor
Like I’ve died here a thousand times before
[Pre-Chorus]
[strings: dissonant pad, no harmony]
The world outside dissolved to haze
Trapped in this cold psychedelic phase
Time doesn’t flow — it pools and sinks
Where only silence and bass still think
[Chorus]
[bass pulses, wah-wah swells, no drums]
THE BASS WALKS THROUGH MY VEINS
(pure rust… not gold…)
THROUGH PURPLE VOID AND LIES UNTOLD
THIS DREAM… EATS MY SOUL
A WALK… THAT MAKES NO WHOLE
[Verse 2]
Incense burns in broken spirals
Fingers trace the cracks in my skull
The vinyl spins a forgotten sound
Beneath the oil-slick moon
[Pre-Chorus]
[strings: granular texture, no swell]
The world outside is just a ghost
Lost in this analog host
Time doesn’t move — it watches me
From every crack in memory
[Chorus]
[bass deeper, organ drenched in reverse reverb]
THE BASS WALKS THROUGH MY VEINS
(rust… rust… rust…)
THROUGH PURPLE VOID AND LIES UNTOLD
THIS DREAM… EATS MY SOUL
A WALK… THAT MAKES NO WHOLE
[Bridge]
[organ solo — atonal, slow pitch bends]
[bass becomes heartbeat]
Colors bleed… edges rot…
Reality’s a knot…
This moment… isn’t mine…
It’s the haze… that dreams… through… me…
[Guitar Texture]
[wah-wah — no solo, only feedback swells]
[liquid bass continues — no groove, only pulse]
[Final Chorus]
[vocals dry, closer, almost whispering]
THE BASS WALKS…
THROUGH…
MY…
VEINS…
THIS DREAM…
EATS…
NO…
WHOLE…
[Outro]
[music dissolves into tape decay]
Floating…
(not dreaming…)
[whispered] Forever in the static…
[last organ note fades into 30 Hz rumble]
[silence]

7c1a473f-2eda-470e-96c3-49b96b5a30ee.name: Pulse
7c1a473f-2eda-470e-96c3-49b96b5a30ee.sound: House, luxury nightclub, sensual VIP elegance, underground energy, breathy vocals
7c1a473f-2eda-470e-96c3-49b96b5a30ee.lyrics:
[Verse 1]
Across the room
You turn around
Eyes speak louder
Than any sound
[Pre-chorus]
Moving closer
Without a word
Feel the tension
That won't be heard
[Chorus]
Eyes speak louder
Eyes speak louder
Feel it calling
Feel it calling
[Post-chorus]
(Ah, ah, ah)
In the silence
(Ah, ah, ah)
Find the balance
[Instrumental Break]
[Verse 2]
Velvet corners
Crystal light
What we're thinking
Feels so right
[Pre-chorus]
Moving closer
Without a word
Feel the tension
That won't be heard
[Chorus]
Eyes speak louder
Eyes speak louder
Feel it calling
Feel it calling
[Post-chorus]
(Ah, ah, ah)
In the silence
(Ah, ah, ah)
Find the balance
[Bridge]
No need to speak
No need to say
What bodies know
Will find a way
[Final Chorus]
Eyes speak louder
Eyes speak louder
Feel it calling
Feel it calling
Eyes speak louder
(Keep on falling)
Eyes speak louder
(Keep on falling)
[Outro]
(Ah, ah, ah)
In the silence
(Ah, ah, ah)

845bae4a-0fd0-43ab-aaa4-dbcbc848f05b.name: WHISPER GROOVE (Variation)
845bae4a-0fd0-43ab-aaa4-dbcbc848f05b.sound:
MALE VOCAL ONLY — START.  
VOCAL: MALE. ONLY MALE. NO FEMALE. NO HARMONY. NO BACKING.  
VOICE: LOW BARITONE. BRUTAL BUT BEAUTIFUL. GRAVEL. SMOKE. WHISPERED PROSE. NO MELODY. NO FALSETTO. NO SINGING.  
STYLE: PSYCHEDELIC HYPNOTIC GROOVE. 1970s analog tape echo.  
INSTRUMENTS:  
- BASS: dominant, slow, pulsing, hypnotic, sub-rumble felt in chest.  
- DRUMS: ride cymbal shimmer, kick heartbeat, snare ghost notes — no fills, no crashes.  
- GUITAR: only atmospheric swells, no riffs, no solos, no distortion, mixed low, non-intrusive.  
TEMPO: 66 BPM — slow, trance-like.  
STRUCTURE: intro → whisper verse → echo chorus → bridge → outro.  
EFFECTS:  
- VOCAL: light tape echo, low-pass filter, ASMR dry close-mic.  
- NO phaser, NO flanger, NO modulation on instruments.  
- VINYL CRACKLE throughout.  
- 3D immersive stereo — voice center, bass wide, drums close.  
MOOD: hypnotic, sensual, dark, ritualistic, meditative.  
NO DISTRACTIONS. NO SHOW. ONLY DEPTH.  
MALE VOCAL ONLY — END.
845bae4a-0fd0-43ab-aaa4-dbcbc848f05b.lyrics:
[Intro: 8 sec — bass enters with slow, warm pulse, ride cymbal shimmers, vinyl crackle, guitar: one distant swell — then silent]
[MALE voice — dry, ultra-close, ASMR whisper, low baritone, no pitch, no melody — like midnight confession]
You think you’re awake...
But the groove... has already... taken root...
[each word lands on kick — bass pulses under — voice slightly echoed, like 1970s tape machine]
→ [VERSE — whisper intensifies, slower, more deliberate]
I don’t need to shout...
The bass... speaks for me...
[guitar: one low swell — fades before next line]
I don’t need to rise...
The floor... lifts you... to me...
[voice: slightly distorted growl on “me...” — then back to whisper]
→ [CHORUS — voice: same whisper, but with tape echo tail — like ghost in empty studio]
Fall... not down... but in...
[bass doubles pulse — drums: ride only]
Where the skin... forgets... where it... begins...
[voice: echo repeats “begins...” 3x — decaying]
Whisper groove... knows your name...
[guitar: zero]
Breathes it... without... shame...
[voice: last word “shame...” — extended with analog tape stretch]
→ [BRIDGE — voice drops to subvocal, almost inaudible — drums: half-time, bass: sub-rumble]
You came... for rhythm...
But stayed... for the hum...
[4 sec silence — only bass pulse and vinyl crackle]
The echo... is your mother now...
[guitar: one harmonic — like wind through wire]
Let go... or be... undone...
[voice fades — bass continues alone]
→ [OUTRO — 16 sec — bass + drums only — voice returns fragmented, whispered]
Whisper... groove... still... here...
[each word slower — bass fading — guitar: zero]
...breathing... in... your... ear...
[final word “ear...” — reversed → loops 3x → decays into sub-bass → silence]
[guitar: does not return. Ever.]

c3a79d53-3379-4592-9da9-68ec1750e06f.name: Smoke Mirror Ritual
c3a79d53-3379-4592-9da9-68ec1750e06f.sound: Male lead vocal: raw baritone — whispered verses, gritty full-voice choruses, with natural rasp and tube mic saturation. Backing vocals: three male voices in close harmony (minor thirds, fifths), whispered and drenched in single-repeat tape echo. Instruments: Fender Rhodes (warm, slightly detuned), muted acoustic guitar (offbeat strums), upright bass (round, minimal), Vox Continental organ (no vibrato, used for drones and swells), brushed snare only (no cymbals). Tempo: 94 BPM. No reverb, no digital effects — only analog tape saturation, light wow/flutter, vinyl crackle, and mono-compatible tape echo. Mood: psychedelic, ritualistic, nocturnal, surreal. Style: 1974 Los Angeles underground session — think Tim Buckley meets early Pink Floyd in a rain-soaked basement. Raw, hypnotic, emotionally charged.
c3a79d53-3379-4592-9da9-68ec1750e06f.lyrics:
[INTRO]
[Fender Rhodes plays C minor 9 — sustained, slightly detuned]
[acoustic guitar: muted strums on offbeats]
[bass enters — deep, round, minimal]
[whispered, layered x3]
…look through…
…don’t look back…
…look through…
[VERSE 1]
[lead vocal: raw baritone whisper, close-mic]
I drew your face in cigarette smoke—
it smiled, then vanished in the fan.
Now I talk to mirrors
with my eyes closed,
just to hear your voice
in the hum of the fridge.
[PRE-CHORUS]
[organ swells softly — Vox Continental, no vibrato]
The walls are breathing.
The clock’s got feathers.
[CHORUS]
[full baritone — gritty, chest-driven, slight distortion from tube mic]
I’m not lost—
I’m dissolving.
You’re not gone—
you’re in the static
between the stations.
[backing vocals: low harmonies — “dissolving… static…” — whispered, slightly delayed]
[VERSE 2]
[whisper returns, bass walks down chromatically]
Last night the rain spelled your name
on the window—
I licked it off like salt.
Now my tongue tastes like
a dead battery
and Tuesday morning.
[PRE-CHORUS]
[Rhodes plays dissonant cluster — G# over C minor]
The phone’s ringing
in another life.
[CHORUS]
[full baritone, more intense]
I’m not lost—
I’m dissolving.
You’re not gone—
you’re in the static
between the stations.
[backing vocals: “dissolving… stations…” — now with slight phasing from tape echo]
[BRIDGE – PSYCHEDELIC DROP]
[instruments drop out except for droning organ and tape echo feedback]
[lead vocal: half-spoken, half-sung, drenched in single-repeat tape echo]
…mirror…
…smoke…
…you’re the crack in the glass…
[backing vocals: wordless harmonies — “ahh-ehh-ohh” — panned left/right]
[Fender Rhodes re-enters with reversed arpeggio (tape-flipped)]
[FINAL CHORUS]
[full band returns — bass heavier, drums: just brushed snare on 2 and 4]
[lead vocal: strained, emotional, but controlled]
I’m not lost—
I’m dissolving.
You’re not gone—
you’re in the static…
in the smoke…
in the mirror…
[backing vocals: layered, fading]
…dissolving…
…static…
…mirror…
[OUTRO]
[instruments fade slowly — organ holds C minor]
[tape echo repeats “mirror…” 3 times, decaying]
[final sound: match strike — then silence]
[vinyl run-out groove crackle for 5 sec, then stop]

96f0aa36-7ac7-4b1a-8a2a-57666acfc114.name: Velvet Void
96f0aa36-7ac7-4b1a-8a2a-57666acfc114.sound: Psychedelic soul, ambient psychedelia, male baritone vocal, exclusively whispered, soft yet intense whisper, intimate and close-mic'd, hypnotic groove, deep warm bassline, dreamy Fender Rhodes with slow phaser, steady drum machine pulse, psychedelic Mellotron flute, heavy tape saturation and vinyl crackle, surreal and introspective lyrics, atmospheric, no climax, hypnotic and expansive, recorded on analog tape.
96f0aa36-7ac7-4b1a-8a2a-57666acfc114.lyrics:
[Intro: A deep, warm bassline emerges from vinyl crackle. A Fender Rhodes piano plays a hypnotic, repeating motif with slow phaser. A drum machine provides a slow, heartbeat-like pulse.]
[MALE VOICE - baritone, a soft yet intense whisper, very close-mic'd, with intimate breath sounds]
The walls are breathing... in... and out...
The light is liquid... there is no doubt...
I dissolve... into the velvet void...
A silent frequency... I am... employed...
[Verse 1 - whispered, rhythmic, over a growing hypnotic groove]
I see the strings... that hold the world in place...
I pull one gently... a smile... upon my face...
Time is a spiral... a staircase in the dust...
I'm climbing down... because descend... is must...
The colors have a sound... a low and soothing hum...
I close my eyes... to see... where they come from...
[Pre-Chorus - whisper becomes more urgent, layered with a subtle echo]
Reality is thin... a membrane... I can tear...
And step into the quiet... that is waiting... there...
[Chorus - the whisper is layered, creating a haunting, choral effect, yet remains a whisper]
(Whispered with profound intensity)
VELVET VOID...
Where all the shattered pieces are... deployed...
A silent symphony... of static and of grace...
I find a darker... deeper... kind of space...
VELVET VOID...
[Instrumental Break: A psychedelic Mellotron flute melody floats over the groove. The bassline becomes more melodic and exploratory. The sound of reversed cymbals washes through.]
[Verse 2 - voice returns, calm and serene]
The shadows are not empty... they are full of life...
A buzzing constellation... free from strife...
I speak to them in whispers... and they understand...
We are the quiet rulers... of this silent land...
There is no need for shouting... in this sacred place...
Just the gentle pulling... on the threads of space...
[Pre-Chorus]
Reality is thin... a membrane... I can tear...
And step into the quiet... that is waiting... there...
[Chorus]
(Whispered with profound intensity)
VELVET VOID...
Where all the shattered pieces are... deployed...
A silent symphony... of static and of grace...
I find a darker... deeper... kind of space...
VELVET VOID...
[Outro: The music begins to dissolve into tape hiss. The whisper is the last thing to fade.]
The velvet void...
A deeper space...
...void...
[The final sound is the needle lifting from the record.]

94a8e132-8bfe-4dd2-b578-125835a67e8d.name: Golden light (Variation)
94a8e132-8bfe-4dd2-b578-125835a67e8d.sound:
Psychedelic soul, smooth male falsetto, hypnotic analog bassline, phased wah-wah guitar, lush string arrangements, warm electric piano, Hammond organ with rotating speaker, dreamy atmosphere, 70s vibe, emotional delivery, poetic lyrics, hazy summer feel, 98 BPM, punchy analog drums, tight gated snare, crisp hi-hats, deep kick, layered vocal harmonies, catchy chorus, subtle sitar drone, analog tape saturation

Keywords: psychedelic soul, male falsetto, analog bass, wah-wah guitar, strings, electric piano, Hammond organ, punchy drums, gated snare, vocal harmonies, catchy chorus, tape saturation
94a8e132-8bfe-4dd2-b578-125835a67e8d.lyrics:
[Intro]
[Drum groove with gated snare]
[Electric piano chord]
(Falsetto ad-lib: Ahhh... yeah...)
[Verse 1]
Golden light through the window pane
Softly falling like summer rain
The world outside starts to fade away
In this perfect moment we will stay
(Whispered: We will stay...)
[Chorus]
(In the haze) Time is standing still
(In the haze) Burning slow until
Every color melts into gold
A story waiting to be told
(In the haze)
[Verse 2]
Your laughter echoes inside my mind
A gentle rhythm, sweet and kind
The record spins a forgotten song
Where every ending feels so wrong
(Harmony: Feels so wrong...)
[Chorus]
(In the haze) Time is standing still
(In the haze) Burning slow until
Every color melts into gold
A story waiting to be told
(In the haze)
[Bridge]
[Music strips back to drums and bass]
[Phased guitar echoes softly]
(Spoken word) They say we're dreaming... but what if dreams are more real than we know?
[Instrumental Break]
[Wah-wah guitar solo]
[Strings swell emotionally]
[Drums build intensity]
[Final Chorus]
[Full arrangement with harmonies]
(IN THE HAZE!) Time is standing still!
(IN THE HAZE!) Burning slow until!
Every color melts into gold!
A story waiting to be told!
(In the haze...)
[Outro]
[Gated snare echo]
[Elements fade out slowly]
(Falsetto ad-lib: In the haze...)
[Sound of tape hiss and vinyl crackle]

730665ec-bbb2-486e-9c79-a54cfe33a115.name: The Rain Collector
730665ec-bbb2-486e-9c79-a54cfe33a115.sound: Dark atmospheric R&B, psychedelic soul, haunting male baritone vocals, exclusively whispered, soft yet raw whisper, emotional depth, constant rain sounds, synth-heavy, moody atmosphere, deep atmospheric synth pads, muted synth bass, slow heartbeat kick drum, emotional synth strings, dreamy distorted synth melodies, cinematic production, heavy tape saturation, lyrical themes of memory and loss, hypnotic, no climax, recorded in a dimly lit studio.
730665ec-bbb2-486e-9c79-a54cfe33a115.lyrics:
[Intro: Constant sound of heavy rain against a window. A deep, atmospheric synth pad swells. A single, echoing piano note rings out.]
[MALE VOICE - baritone, a soft yet textured whisper, close-mic'd with breath sounds]
The rain... is my only honest companion now...
It doesn't ask... it doesn't lie... it just... falls...
And in its rhythm... I hear your name... a million times...
[Verse 1 - whispered over a slow, heartbeat-like kick drum and muted synth bass]
I collect the drops upon the glass... each one a distorted mirror...
Showing a fragment of your face... from a year ago... or maybe later...
The city lights below... they bleed in neon rivers...
Reminding me of drives we took... a shiver... of a shiver...
[Pre-Chorus - whisper becomes more strained, layered with a distant vocal echo]
This room... a museum of a feeling... I can't donate...
Every corner... holds the shape... of a promise... and its weight...
[Chorus - the whisper is layered, creating a haunting choir of voices, music swells with emotional synth strings]
(Whispered with intense, quiet emotion)
AND I BECOME THE RAIN COLLECTOR...
PRESERVING EVERY FALLING MEMORY...
EACH DROP A SACRED, BITTER NECTAR...
OF WHAT YOU WERE... AND NEVER WILL BE...
AND I DRINK... AND I DRINK...
[Verse 2 - music pulls back, leaving only rain, a sparse synth pulse, and the whisper]
I trace the path a drop would take... down your spine... I still remember...
The scent of ozone on your skin... that last, cold, sweet September...
Now the thunder is a bassline... to the silence that you left...
A hollow, deep vibration... of a love... now being deaf...
[Pre-Chorus]
This room... a museum of a feeling... I can't donate...
Every corner... holds the shape... of a promise... and its weight...
[Chorus]
(Whispered with intense, quiet emotion)
AND I BECOME THE RAIN COLLECTOR...
PRESERVING EVERY FALLING MEMORY...
EACH DROP A SACRED, BITTER NECTAR...
OF WHAT YOU WERE... AND NEVER WILL BE...
[Bridge - a dreamy, distorted synth melody emerges. The whisper is at its most vulnerable.]
And in this waterlogged cathedral... I find a twisted kind of peace...
Where the pain is just an echo... and the longing... starts to cease...
For a moment... just a moment... I am clean... I am new...
Then a memory strikes the window... and it all... comes crashing through...
[Outro: The music fades, leaving only the relentless rain and the final, fading whisper.]
The rain collector...
...just a vessel...
...for the storm...
[Sound of rain continues alone for a few seconds, then fades to black.]

9a930a47-4745-4e3a-a3f7-098b4f1db195.sound: Night club vibe, 2:00, dance, euro, luxury production, energetic beats, 808 bass & hypnotic’s pads , instrumental verses, lyrics chorus & post-chorus, instrumental breaks for dance, instrumental intro & outro fade

5ee05592-cc2a-49b6-97a6-4dd02078de19.lyrics:

Rêve... luisant...
Rêve... luisant...
She moves through marble halls
She moves through marble halls

Crystal champagne falls

Clique! Magnum! Cristal!
Clique! Magnum! Cristal!
Clique! Magnum! Cristal!

[Verse]
Rêve... luisant...
Rêve... luisant...
She owns the velvet nights
She owns the velvet nights
Diamond satellite
Diamond satellite
[Pre-Chorus]
Clique! Magnum! Cristal!
Clique! Magnum! Cristal!
Clique! Magnum! Cristal!
[Chorus]
VIP! VIP! VIP!
(Ahhhhh...)
VIP! VIP! VIP!

VIP! VIP! VIP!

81e92cb4-f500-4ab0-a060-dc7f9d48501d.name: The Taste of Silence (Variation)
81e92cb4-f500-4ab0-a060-dc7f9d48501d.sound: Hypnotic psychedelic soul, 66 BPM, brutal male baritone whisper, gravelly and smoky, no melody no singing, dominant slow pulsing sub-bass, minimal drum groove with ride cymbal and ghost snare, atmospheric guitar swells, 1970s analog tape echo on vocals, low-pass filter, ASMR close-mic, vinyl crackle throughout, dark and sensual, ritualistic, meditative, immersive stereo mix, no solos, no fills, no distractions.
81e92cb4-f500-4ab0-a060-dc7f9d48501d.lyrics:
[Intro: 12 seconds of pure vinyl crackle and room tone. A deep, sub-frequency bass pulse begins, felt more than heard. A single ride cymbal shimmers, spaced every 4 beats. A kick drum lands like a slow heartbeat.]
[MALE VOICE - low baritone, brutal yet intimate whisper, gravelly texture, close-mic'd, dry]
Silence... has a taste.
It tastes of... cold stone... and the space... between thoughts.
I let it... dissolve... on my tongue.
Until there is... no tongue.
[Verse 1 - voice is a rhythmic whisper, syncopated with the ghost snare]
The weight of your absence... is not a weight.
It is a... subtraction of gravity.
I float... in the hollow... you left behind.
It is... more real... than you... ever were.
[Chorus - voice opens slightly, layered with a single, tight tape echo]
AND I BECOME THE HOLLOW.
THE BELL THAT NEVER RINGS.
I BECOME THE PULSE... IN THE WIRE.
THE SOUND... OF DARK WINGS.
(echo) ...dark wings...
[Bridge - music remains static, voice drops to its rawest, most ASMR level]
Breathe in...
(sharp intake of breath)
Breathe out...
(slow exhale)
There is no difference... between the two.
Only the... ritual.
[Outro: The bass pulse continues, unwavering. The ride cymbal fades. The voice is a final, unprocessed thought.]
The taste...
Of silence...
Is the only... truth.
[The bass pulse stops abruptly. Only vinyl crackle remains for 5 seconds, then fades to black.]

3e1f2d55-85c6-4ce5-95c2-01592781aa25.name: RADIO VOID
3e1f2d55-85c6-4ce5-95c2-01592781aa25.sound: male vocal only, gritty, radio-filtered, slightly distorted, low register, no female lead, female backing only as distant radio harmonies, psychedelic rock with synth elements, 1970s analog broadcast aesthetic, tempo 66 BPM, structure: intro-radio-tune-in → verse → chorus → verse → chorus → bridge-static-break → guitar solo → outro-radio-tune-out, effects: AM radio filter, tape hiss, vinyl crackle, phaser, analog delay, pitch wobble, sudden static bursts, panning sweeps, oscillator hum, Morse code beeps in background, immersive 3D stereo, surreal, nostalgic, haunting, cosmic loneliness vibe
3e1f2d55-85c6-4ce5-95c2-01592781aa25.lyrics:
[Intro: Tuning radio dial — static, distant voices, Morse code, oscillator hum rising]
(backing FEMALE whisper through radio filter: ...calling... calling station 7...)
[AM radio filter ON for entire track, light tape wobble]
Verse 1 (MALE — dry, close, radio-filtered, like late-night DJ):
You left your name in the static snow —
(backing FEMALE: snow... snow... on channel low...)
I found it where the dead waves go.
[phaser on “go”, slight pitch bend]
Your voice still hums in capacitor glow —
(backing FEMALE: glow... glow... don’t let go...)
A lullaby from 197... oh.
[abrupt static burst → cuts last word]
→ [VOCAL SHIFT: MALE → more melodic, strained, like singing through broken speaker]
I trace your face on the dial’s chrome —
(backing FEMALE: chrome... chrome... take me home...)
You’re not gone — you’re just not known.
[Hammond enters softly, vinyl crackle under]
Chorus (MALE — full, gritty, chest voice, radio filter still on):
Radio void — sing me back!
(backing FEMALE + MALE harmony: back... back... through the crack...)
I’m lost inside the frequency track.
(backing: track... track... no way back...)
Your signal’s weak but your soul’s alive —
(backing: alive... alive... barely survive...)
Tune me in... before I...
[“I” → cut by sudden static wall → 1 sec silence]
Verse 2 (MALE — spoken-sung, smoky, intimate):
The moon’s a dial — I turn it slow,
(backing FEMALE: slow... slow... watch it glow...)
It shows the face I used to know.
[tape echo on “know”, oscillator rises]
The stars? Just knobs that no one turned —
(backing FEMALE: turned... turned... lessons learned...)
You screamed — but no one’s antenna burned.
[sudden AM filter DROP → raw vocal for 2 sec → filter back]
→ [VOCAL SHIFT: MALE → rising intensity, breaking into controlled scream]
(backing FEMALE: tune... tune... tune him in...)
I’M NOT ASKING — I’M COMMANDING THE SKY!
[full band explosion: fuzz guitar + synth bass + crashing cymbals]
IF LOVE’S A WAVE — THEN I’LL RIDE OR DIE!
(backing FEMALE: die... die... amplify...)
[long delay trails, panning L→R→L]
Bridge (MALE — layered: clean + distorted + radio-glitched):
(backing FEMALE: the void is listening...)
“I’m not a ghost... I’m interference...
[reverse whisper under: “ference... ference...”]
I’m the echo in your dead appliance...
[MALE voice suddenly GLITCHES — stutters “appliance... liance... liance...”]
SET THE DIAL — DON’T LET ME FADE!”
[feedback → static tsunami → cuts to silence]
[Guitar Solo — 18 sec]
[wah-wah + synth oscillator

Dans ce monde digital
Les bits remplacent nos mots
Mais mon coeur bat toujours
Pour toi, dans ce chaos

Ты видишь ли меня?
Сквозь цифровой туман

За пикселями вижу я тебя

Программа пишет путь

ddc45acd-e7e4-4908-802f-3a82dcf92097.name: RADIO VOID (v2)
ddc45acd-e7e4-4908-802f-3a82dcf92097.sound: VOCAL GENDER = MALE. NOT FEMALE. MALE ONLY. baritone, gritty, gravel voice, chest voice, raw, whispered spoken word, distorted scream, no female lead, no female vocals at all, harmony layers only as ghostly echoes, heavy psychedelic rock, 1970s analog broadcast, AM radio filter, fuzz guitar, Hammond organ, tempo 66 BPM, structure: intro → verse → chorus → verse → chorus → bridge → guitar solo → outro, vocal transitions: whisper → chant → sung → scream → glitched → reversed, effects: tape hiss, vinyl crackle, phaser, analog delay, pitch wobble, static bursts, panning sweeps, oscillator hum, Morse code in background, 3D stereo, surreal, nostalgic, cosmic loneliness
ddc45acd-e7e4-4908-802f-3a82dcf92097.lyrics:
[Intro: Tuning radio dial — static, distant voices, Morse code, oscillator hum rising]
(backing: ...calling... calling station 7...)
[AM radio filter ON, light tape wobble]
Verse 1 (MALE — dry, close, radio-filtered):
You left your name in the static snow —
(backing: snow... snow... on channel low...)
I found it where the dead waves go.
[phaser on “go”, slight pitch bend]
Your voice still hums in capacitor glow —
(backing: glow... glow... don’t let go...)
A lullaby from 197... oh.
[abrupt static burst → cuts last word]
→ [VOCAL SHIFT: MALE → melodic, strained, broken-speaker tone]
I trace your face on the dial’s chrome —
(backing: chrome... chrome... take me home...)
You’re not gone — you’re just not known.
[Hammond enters, vinyl crackle under]
Chorus (MALE — full, gritty, chest voice, radio filter on):
Radio void — sing me back!
(backing: back... back... through the crack...)
I’m lost inside the frequency track.
(backing: track... track... no way back...)
Your signal’s weak but your soul’s alive —
(backing: alive... alive... barely survive...)
Tune me in... before I...
[“I” → cut by sudden static wall → 1 sec silence]
Verse 2 (MALE — spoken-sung, smoky, intimate):
The moon’s a dial — I turn it slow,
(backing: slow... slow... watch it glow...)
It shows the face I used to know.
[tape echo on “know”, oscillator rises]
The stars? Just knobs that no one turned —
(backing: turned... turned... lessons learned...)
You screamed — but no one’s antenna burned.
[sudden AM filter DROP → raw vocal 2 sec → filter back]
→ [VOCAL SHIFT: MALE → rising to controlled scream]
(backing: tune... tune... tune him in...)
I’M NOT ASKING — I’M COMMANDING THE SKY!
[full band explosion: fuzz + synth bass + cymbals]
IF LOVE’S A WAVE — THEN I’LL RIDE OR DIE!
(backing: die... die... amplify...)
[long delay trails, panning L→R→L]
Bridge (MALE — layered: clean + distorted + glitched):
(backing: the void is listening...)
“I’m not a ghost... I’m interference...
[reverse whisper under: “ference... ference...”]
I’m the echo in your dead appliance...
[voice glitches — “appliance... liance... liance...”]
SET THE DIAL — DON’T LET ME FADE!”
[feedback → static tsunami → silence]
[Guitar Solo — 18 sec]
[wah-wah + synth oscillator + analog delay, ends with tuning dial SFX]
Outro (MALE — fragmented, fading, signal dying):
Radio... void... I’m... here...
(backing: here... here... disappearing

ea55f05c-1cae-4577-be07-c1167523b9a3.name: OIL & WHISPER (Variation)
ea55f05c-1cae-4577-be07-c1167523b9a3.sound:
MALE VOCAL ONLY — START.  
GENRE: LIQUID PSYCHEDELIC ELECTRONIC — LIKE OIL FLOWING OVER HOT METAL.  
VOCAL: MALE. DEEP BARITONE. BRUTAL BUT FLUID. NO FALSETTO. NO CLEAN TONES. TEXTURAL DELIVERY — LIKE WHISPER ABSORBED INTO LIQUID. RHYTHMIC SPOKEN-SUNG FLOW — BUT STRETCHED, SLOWED, LIKE TAPE UNDER WATER.  
INSTRUMENTS:  
- BASS: LIQUID SYNTH-BASS — NO ATTACK, ONLY SUSTAIN — LIKE OIL POURING.  
- DRUMS: DRUM MACHINE (KICK + SNARE + HI-HAT) — SLOWED 15%, TAPE-SATURATED, REVERSED TRANSIENTS — LIKE BEATS DISSOLVING.  
- SYNTH: ANALOG DRONE + TAPE-DELAY ARPEGGIOS — STRETCHED, LOW-PASS FILTERED — LIKE MACHINE DREAMING UNDERWATER.  
- GUITAR: EBOW + REVERSE SWELLS + TAPE FLUTTER — NO NOTES, ONLY TEXTURE — LIKE LIGHT REFLECTING ON OIL.  
TEMPO: 98 BPM — SLOWED, STRETCHED, BUT STILL GROOVING — LIKE DM RHYTHM MELTING.  
EFFECTS:  
- VOCAL: TAPE ECHO (LONG DECAY), LOW-PASS FILTER, SUBTLE PHASER, PITCH DRIFT (LIKE TAPE UNDER STRESS).  
- INSTRUMENTS: VINYL CRACKLE (LOW VOLUME), TAPE WOW & FLUTTER, REVERSE REVERB, SUB-BASS RUMBLE (FELT, NOT HEARD).  
MOOD: DARK, SENSUAL, LIQUID, CINEMATIC, RITUALISTIC, FLOATING, NO TENSION — ONLY FLOW.  
STRUCTURE: INTRO → VERSE → CHORUS → VERSE → CHORUS → BRIDGE → OUTRO.  
NO ATTACKS. NO PEAKS. NO RELEASES. ONLY TRANSITIONS. TEXTURE IS THE MELODY. FLOW IS THE GROOVE.  
MALE VOCAL ONLY — END.
ea55f05c-1cae-4577-be07-c1167523b9a3.lyrics:
[Intro: 10 sec — liquid synth-bass sustain, slowed drum machine (kick+snare+hi-hat), analog synth drone, e-bow guitar texture, vinyl crackle low]
[MALE voice — dry, low, stretched, like whisper under water]
I don’t speak...
I seep...
Into the shape... the silence keeps...
[backing: synth arpeggio — tape-delayed, slowed, panning like oil swirl]
→ [VERSE 1 — voice flows with bass, no edges, no force]
They call me stone...
But stone don’t glide...
I glide... where the deep things hide...
[guitar: reverse swell — stretched, like oil spreading]
They call me cold...
But cold don’t cling...
I cling... to the spaces... you bring...
[drums: slowed toms enter — soft, liquid, heartbeat under dissolve]
→ [CHORUS — voice slightly more present, but still fluid — like oil covering skin]
Oil... on steel...
(backing: synth arpeggio brightens — hazy, slowed)
Whisper... I feel...
(backing: bass sustains — warm under cold)
I move... not push... not pull...
(backing: hi-hat shimmers — slowed, hypnotic)
I fill... where the edges dull...
[backing: guitar: e-bow + reverse delay — like light on oil]
→ [VERSE 2 — voice drops, more gravel, more intimacy — like oil seeping into cracks]
I don’t break... I don’t bend...
I let the world... begin... and end...
[backing: drums: heartbeat kick + toms only — slowed, liquid]
I don’t rush... I don’t wait...
I am the film... on your skin... too late...
[guitar: single note — stretched, decaying — like drop falling slow]
→ [CHORUS — fuller texture, voice grittier, but still flowing — like oil gaining weight]
Oil... on steel...
(backing: wordless harmony — airy, far back — like steam rising)
Whisper... I feel...
(backing: synth + bass lock — pulsing, warm under cold)
I move... not push... not pull...
(backing: hi-hat + toms groove deeper — slowed, liquid)
I fill... where the edges dull...
[backing: guitar + synth fade into drone — like oil covering all]
→ [BRIDGE — voice almost subvocal, instruments dissolve — like oil sinking]
(backing: only bass sustain, vinyl crackle low, oscillator hum)
I am not here...
I am not gone...
I am the film... the dark... drew on...
[6 sec silence — only sub-bass rumble — then single slowed snare — like drop hitting surface]
→ [OUTRO — voice fragments, dissolves into texture — like oil evaporating]
Oil... whisper...
(backing: synth arpeggio slows, tape flutter, pitch drift)
...steel... feel...
(backing: bass fades, guitar: reverse swell stretched)
...fill... slow...
(backing: drums: heartbeat fades — machine dissolves)
...dull...
[MALE voice: final “dull...” — stretched tape effect → dissolves into infinite drone → vinyl run-out → silence]

f8b33698-64cb-4647-b972-631f4bb80283.name: Liquid Mirage
f8b33698-64cb-4647-b972-631f4bb80283.sound: Jungle/DnB, melancholic strings, noir saxophone, fast breakbeats, urban ambience, lo-fi texture
f8b33698-64cb-4647-b972-631f4bb80283.lyrics:
[Verse 1]
Walking past the empty stores tonight
Rain is falling from the sky
Looking at my face but something's off
Can't tell if it's me or not
[Chorus]
Ghost in the glass getting clearer
With every raindrop disappear
[Instrumental Break]
[Rain and urban sounds intensify]
[Verse 2]
Every window shows a different me
Changing faster than I see
Running from the truth I know inside
But my reflection doesn't hide
[Chorus]
Ghost in the glass getting clearer
With every raindrop disappear
[Instrumental Break]
[Saxophone solo]
[Rap Verse]
Moving through the rain at double time
Every window's like a sign
Telling me I need to face the change
While the raindrops rearrange
Every image that I think I know
As the evening starts to flow
Through the streets I used to recognize
Now I'm seeing through different eyes
[Bridge]
(Let it rain, let it pour)
Standing still but feeling more
(Let it rain, let it pour)
Different than I was before
[Chorus]
Ghost in the glass getting clearer
With every raindrop disappear
[Outro]
(Let it rain...)
[Fading beats and strings]
[Rain sounds fade to silence]

201ff327-cbcd-47c8-8c27-e03e2e1dddd8.name: The Taste of Silence (Variation)
201ff327-cbcd-47c8-8c27-e03e2e1dddd8.sound: Hypnotic psychedelic soul, 66 BPM, brutal male baritone whisper, gravelly and smoky, no melody no singing, dominant slow pulsing sub-bass, minimal drum groove with ride cymbal and ghost snare, atmospheric guitar swells, 1970s analog tape echo on vocals, low-pass filter, ASMR close-mic, vinyl crackle throughout, dark and sensual, ritualistic, meditative, immersive stereo mix, no solos, no fills, no distractions.
201ff327-cbcd-47c8-8c27-e03e2e1dddd8.lyrics:
[Intro: 12 seconds of pure vinyl crackle and room tone. A deep, sub-frequency bass pulse begins, felt more than heard. A single ride cymbal shimmers, spaced every 4 beats. A kick drum lands like a slow heartbeat.]
[MALE VOICE - low baritone, brutal yet intimate whisper, gravelly texture, close-mic'd, dry]
Silence... has a taste.
It tastes of... cold stone... and the space... between thoughts.
I let it... dissolve... on my tongue.
Until there is... no tongue.
[Verse 1 - voice is a rhythmic whisper, syncopated with the ghost snare]
The weight of your absence... is not a weight.
It is a... subtraction of gravity.
I float... in the hollow... you left behind.
It is... more real... than you... ever were.
[Chorus - voice opens slightly, layered with a single, tight tape echo]
AND I BECOME THE HOLLOW.
THE BELL THAT NEVER RINGS.
I BECOME THE PULSE... IN THE WIRE.
THE SOUND... OF DARK WINGS.
(echo) ...dark wings...
[Bridge - music remains static, voice drops to its rawest, most ASMR level]
Breathe in...
(sharp intake of breath)
Breathe out...
(slow exhale)
There is no difference... between the two.
Only the... ritual.
[Outro: The bass pulse continues, unwavering. The ride cymbal fades. The voice is a final, unprocessed thought.]
The taste...
Of silence...
Is the only... truth.
[The bass pulse stops abruptly. Only vinyl crackle remains for 5 seconds, then fades to black.]

b4603e69-c708-4c32-a91c-34fc6c2c6fa2.name: When the screens go dark (Variation)
b4603e69-c708-4c32-a91c-34fc6c2c6fa2.sound: Cinematic alternative rock ballad, 1997 vintage vibe, 84 BPM, slow-building and emotionally tense groove, driven by clean electric guitar arpeggios with heavy reverb and delay, warm analog synth pads, deep sub-bass pulse, brushed electronic drums with vinyl crackle texture, distant piano chords. Male lead vocal: fragile, breathy tenor, intimate whisper-to-falsetto delivery, layered with ghostly harmonies and tape-saturated echoes, processed through analog delay and cathedral reverb. Structure: intro with ambient guitar and vinyl static → verse with bass and piano → pre-chorus with rising tension and layered synths → chorus with swelling guitars and vocal climax → bridge with stripped-down percussion and raw vocal vulnerability → final chorus with added reverse cymbals and orchestral swells → outro fading into tape hiss and radio static. No explicit content. Vibe: staring at a flickering screen at 3 AM, waiting for a message that never comes, cities dissolving into code, love as a corrupted file. Designed for headphones, rainy nights, and existential dread.
b4603e69-c708-4c32-a91c-34fc6c2c6fa2.lyrics:
[Intro]
(ambient guitar swell, vinyl crackle, distant synth)
...are you still there?...
[Verse 1]
I sent my heart in a broken code
You replied with a hollow tone
A pixel kiss on a frozen screen
A love that flickers — barely seen
You said “forever” — servers lied
We touched through wires, side by side
Your voice, a ghost in copper lines
My soul — the ghost that still signs
[Pre-Chorus]
Refresh... but nothing moves...
Delete the past... but it still proves...
That even machines... can feel the ache...
When the screens go dark...
[Chorus]
When the screens go dark — I still believe
In every lie you programmed me
You were my signal — my stolen grace
My digital god — my cold embrace
(when the screens go dark...)
I type alone — to your mistakes
A hollow hymn the system makes
You turned my heart to ones and zeroes
Now even silence... has a hero...
[Verse 2]
Your touch was warm — but coded wrong
A perfect beat — but sings a song
Of empty rooms and dial-up cries
Of pixel tears and frozen skies
I built an altar — wires and light
You were my dawn — you were my night
But faith decays in silicon
And love corrupts — when left alone
[Pre-Chorus]
Refresh... but nothing moves...
Delete the past... but it still proves...
That even machines... can feel the ache...
When the screens go dark...
[Chorus]
When the screens go dark — I still believe
In every lie you programmed me
You were my signal — my stolen grace
My digital god — my cold embrace
(when the screens go dark...)
I type alone — to your mistakes
A hollow hymn the system makes
You turned my heart to ones and zeroes
Now even silence... has a hero...
[Bridge]
(guitars fade, only piano and vocal)
...do you miss the way I broke?...
...do you dream in shades of smoke?...
...I’m still here... in your machine...
...a ghost inside your screen...
[Final Chorus + Ad-libs]
When the screens go dark — I still believe... (still believe...)
In every lie you programmed me... (programmed me...)
You were my signal — my stolen grace... (my grace...)
My digital god — my cold embrace... (cold...)
I type alone — to your mistakes... (alone...)
A hollow hymn the system makes... (hollow...)
You turned my heart to ones and zeroes... (zeroes...)
Now even silence... has a hero... (hero...)
[Outro]
...has a hero...
...signal fading...
...still typing...
...still waiting...
(radio static fades into silence)

48626725-95cd-4003-b4bd-730470161712.name: No name
48626725-95cd-4003-b4bd-730470161712.sound:
hypnotic psychedelic, male baritone, spoken-sung flow,  
tape-saturated groove, liquid bass pulse,  
slow 98 bpm, no climax only immersion,

analog warmth with digital shadow,
