bd13cb45-8149-4324-8ffd-fedff533ac9d.name: Waltz in the Archive of Rain
bd13cb45-8149-4324-8ffd-fedff533ac9d.sound: male baritone raw spoken-word English, waltz rhythm 90 BPM (3/4 pulse), found sounds only (rain footsteps breath paper heartbeat tape), analog tape effects (saturation wow/flutter vinyl crackle tape echo), no reverb no instruments no melody, theme: rain as memory ritual, cold sensual surreal atmosphere, structure: intro-verse-prechorus-chorus-outro
bd13cb45-8149-4324-8ffd-fedff533ac9d.lyrics:
[INTRO]
(found sounds: slow 3/4 footsteps on wet pavement, distant thunder, vinyl crackle, slow tape start with flutter)
(tape saturation low, heartbeat at 90 BPM — waltz pulse: 1-2-3, 1-2-3)
[VERSE]
I remember the rain like a vow—
not loud, just endless.
You left your coat on the chair,
and the silence wore it for weeks.
Every puddle held your name…
until the wind erased it.
(found sounds: dripping eaves, rustling damp fabric, slow page turn, breath syncopated to waltz)
(tape echo on “endless” and “weeks”, vinyl crackle under every third beat)
[PRE-CHORUS]
This room still dances alone—
one step forward, two steps back into the hush.
I don’t call it grief.
I call it rehearsal.
(found sounds: creaking floorboard in 3/4, match strike, slow exhale)
(wow/flutter swells on “rehearsal”, tape saturation thickens)
[CHORUS]
We waltzed in the water falling,
not knowing it was memory in disguise.
Now every drop is a letter
I never sent—but keep rewriting.
(found sounds: rain returns softly, wet paper unfolding in rhythm, heartbeat doubles briefly then settles)
(tape echo loops “rewriting… writing… ting…” fading into texture, vinyl pops on offbeats)
[OUTRO]
(found sounds: footsteps fade, rain thins to mist, tape slows with deep flutter, final breath held then released)
(tape stops abruptly—silence cuts after last crackle)

a0f53ecf-c550-4305-9da3-ae2941152785.name: Raindrop Pulse (Variation)
a0f53ecf-c550-4305-9da3-ae2941152785.sound: Male baritone vocals only—whispered, spoken-word, raw, with subtle breath and lip sounds. Rhythm driven entirely by crisp, percussive raindrops (like finger snaps or hi-hat substitute), steady and hypnotic. No instruments, no reverb, no effects—only analog tape saturation and light vinyl crackle. Tempo: 98 BPM. Mood: urban, nocturnal, ritualistic. Style: 1977 Los Angeles basement session, rain as percussion, voice as confession.
a0f53ecf-c550-4305-9da3-ae2941152785.lyrics:
[whispered, rhythmic, synced to raindrops]
Tick… tap… on the fire escape—
your name echoes in the gutter’s breath.
[slightly faster, syncopated]
I wrote you back in steam on glass,
but the sun stole every word by dawn.
[rain rhythm intensifies – steady, percussive]
Drip… drop… like a clock with no hands,
like a heart that forgot how to stop.
[spoken-word flow, tight and dry]
You left your shadow in my coat pocket—
still warm. Still wet. Still ticking.
[whispered, fading into rain]
I don’t wait.
I pulse.
Like the rain.
Like the rain.
Like the rain.

88efe645-2fb2-49b9-b3f0-95ec94f76f84.name: Static Hymn (Variation)
88efe645-2fb2-49b9-b3f0-95ec94f76f84.sound: male vocal alternating lazy hoarse spoken-sung verses and raw strained choruses, breathy female whisper and ethereal high male harmony backing vocals, detuned clean electric guitar riff with analog chorus effect, sparse fingerpicked acoustic guitar with slight dissonance, ambient granular synth pads, light brushed snare only in choruses, tempo 84 BPM, key E minor, dynamic contrast between raw and fragile, 2025 indie folk meets 1991 alternative rock production, analog tape saturation, narrow stereo, dry intimate vocals, themes emotional exhaustion suburban decay quiet despair
88efe645-2fb2-49b9-b3f0-95ec94f76f84.lyrics:
[INTRO]
[clean electric guitar: detuned, single-note riff with chorus, rain on metal roof]
[VERSE 1]
[spoken-sung, lazy, hoarse, slightly off-beat]
Your socks are still in my drawer,
your ghost sleeps on the floor.
I don’t miss you—just the noise
that drowned out all my quiet voice.
[VERSE 2]
[softer, fingerpicked acoustic guitar enters]
You called it love, I called it rust,
now I’m covered in the dust
of every promise you let rot—
but I keep watering the spot.
[CHORUS]
[raw, strained shout — voice cracks, emotional but not loud]
STATIC HYMN, play it slow…
burn the truth, let the lies grow.
I’M NOT ANGRY—
I’M JUST EMPTY WHERE YOU’VE BEEN!
(bék-vocal: breathy female whisper — “where you’ve been…”, left)
[VERSE 3]
[whispered, only acoustic and ambient pad]
Your name’s a scar I don’t touch,
but it aches when it rains too much.
I drive past your street at night—
just to feel something die twice.
[CHORUS]
[fragile, near-breaking, high male harmony above]
STATIC HYMN, fade to grey…
hope’s a debt I can’t repay.
I’M NOT LOST—
I’M JUST GHOSTS IN MY OWN SKIN!
(bék-vocal: ethereal high harmony — “own skin…”, right)
[OUTRO]
[guitar feedback swells, cuts to solo acoustic]
[whispered]
static… hymn…
[vinyl crackle, silence]

3778a9d7-f2db-420c-85ed-f940519e7c4b.name: Contradiction
3778a9d7-f2db-420c-85ed-f940519e7c4b.sound: EDM, luxury house, VIP club anthem, 808 bass, high-end sound design
3778a9d7-f2db-420c-85ed-f940519e7c4b.lyrics:
[Intro]
(Yeah)
Check my timestamp, wrist on sync (tick)
Sent that text, now I’m on the brink
Dash through velvet, wristband tight
First in the feed, highlight my night
[Verse]
All access, silver on my sleeve
Bouncers nod, swipe my ID
Stories flashing, friends hit repeat
Smile for the grid, now we elite
[Pre-Chorus]
Pressure’s up, 808 lifts me
Quick DM, "u in?" - they miss me
Corks pop, cash drops, can’t fake this scene
Another level, like a meme in a dream
[Chorus]
Diamonds in my DNA (yeah, I texted)
Every notification paved my way
I don’t just flex, I redefine play
Diamonds in my DNA
[Breakdown]
[VIP!]
(Champagne pop, start the chat)
Rolex tickin', double-tap
808 slides, million stats
All my messages autograph
[Bridge]
(tu es sur la liste)
(sei nella lista)
(أنت على القائمة)
[Harp glissando]
[Snip]
[Chorus]
Diamonds in my DNA (left on read)
Right channel sparkling all the way
Status update, who run the game?
Diamonds in my DNA
[Outro]
[Cash register: cha-ching]
[Jet engine rumbles in 808 key]
DM sent, I levitate
(yeah, it’s in my DNA)

de83c5e3-0a10-4978-a461-e9c8f229c32d.name: HORIZON WHISPERS (Cover)
de83c5e3-0a10-4978-a461-e9c8f229c32d.sound:
MALE VOCAL + FEMALE VOCAL — START.  
STYLE: PSYCHEDELIC HYPNOTIC GROOVE. 1970s analog sunset atmosphere.  
VOCALS:  
- MALE: LOW BARITONE WHISPER. BRUTAL BUT BEAUTIFUL. GRAVEL. NO MELODY. NO FALSETTO. SPOKEN PROSE. DRY. CLOSE-MIC. CENTERED.  
- FEMALE: AIRY WHISPER. HARMONIC. BREATHY. NO MELODY. NO BELTING. WORDLESS OR FRAGMENTED PHRASES. LIGHT REVERB. PANNED SLIGHTLY WIDE.  
INTERWEAVE: MALE AND FEMALE WHISPERS INTERTWINED — NOT IN UNISON, NOT IN HARMONY — LIKE TWO BREATHS IN THE SAME WIND. NEVER COMPETING. NEVER DOMINATING. EQUAL BUT DIFFERENT TEXTURES.  
INSTRUMENTS:  
- BASS: warm, slow, pulsing — like horizon line.  
- DRUMS: ride cymbal shimmer, soft kick, no snare — like distant tide.  
- GUITAR: e-bow swells, no attack, no riffs — like light fading.  
TEMPO: 65 BPM — slow, meditative, expansive.  
EFFECTS:  
- VOCALS: light tape echo, low-pass filter on male, high-pass on female.  
- VINYL CRACKLE throughout — like memory of the day.  
- SUBTLE OSCILLATOR HUM — like earth’s frequency at dusk.  
MOOD: sensual, cinematic, melancholic, peaceful, ritualistic.  
STRUCTURE: intro → verse → chorus → verse → chorus → bridge → outro.  
NO DISTRACTIONS. NO GUITAR SOLOS. NO DRUM FILLS. ONLY WHISPERS AND GROOVE.  
MALE + FEMALE VOCALS — END.
de83c5e3-0a10-4978-a461-e9c8f229c32d.lyrics:
[Intro: 10 sec — warm bass pulse, e-bow guitar swell, ride cymbal shimmer, vinyl crackle, oscillator hum]
[MALE whisper — dry, low, centered]
...the sun... doesn’t fall...
[FEMALE whisper — airy, breathy, panned slightly right]
...it melts... into us...
→ [VERSE 1 — whispers intertwine, no rhythm lock]
MALE: I feel it... in my bones...
FEMALE: ...in my skin... the light... thins...
MALE: Not gone... just... changing shape...
FEMALE: ...like smoke... from a slow escape...
[MALE: slight growl on “escape...” / FEMALE: light inhale after]
→ [CHORUS — whispers layer, not harmonize — like two winds meeting]
MALE: Horizon... doesn’t end...
FEMALE: ...it breathes... and bends...
MALE: We’re not watching... we’re... inside...
FEMALE: ...the color... where day... and night... collide...
[MALE: dry, gritty / FEMALE: soft, decaying echo]
→ [VERSE 2 — slower, more intimate]
MALE: Your voice... is the last gold...
FEMALE: ...your silence... the first cold...
MALE: I don’t hold you... I let you... flow...
FEMALE: ...through my fingers... soft... and slow...
[MALE: slight pause before “flow...” / FEMALE: exhale after “slow...”]
→ [CHORUS — whispers more entangled, almost inseparable]
MALE: Horizon... doesn’t end...
FEMALE: ...it breathes... and bends...
MALE: We’re not watching... we’re... inside...
FEMALE: ...the color... where day... and night... collide...
[MALE: voice fades slightly / FEMALE: lingers with reverb]
→ [BRIDGE — both whispers drop to subvocal, almost inaudible — 6 sec]
MALE: ...stay...
FEMALE: ...fade...
MALE: ...with me...
FEMALE: ...in me...
[only bass pulse and vinyl crackle — then single oscillator swell]
→ [OUTRO — whispers fragment, dissolve into horizon]
MALE: ...not gone...
FEMALE: ...just... gone... gold...
MALE: ...whisper...
FEMALE: ...horizon...
[MALE: final “...whisper...” — dry, cut abruptly]
[FEMALE: final “...horizon...” — stretched tape echo → dissolves into oscillator hum → vinyl run-out → silence]

e048202a-7930-4ab0-9368-9280ec92d2c8.name: After the Rain
e048202a-7930-4ab0-9368-9280ec92d2c8.lyrics:
[Intro]
[Slow, melodic bassline with fret noise, sparse acoustic guitar chords, vinyl crackle]
[Verse 1]
[Drums enter - simple rock beat with heavy snare reverb]
The asphalt steams after the summer rain (summer rain)
The trolleybus wires hum their old refrain (old refrain)
[Electric guitar arpeggios join]
We sat right here, on this concrete slab
Sharing one bottle, solving the world's lab...
[Pre-Chorus]
[Drums build intensity, bass becomes more driving]
And you said, "Listen to the silence, brother..."
(To the silence, brother...)
[Chorus]
[Full band, powerful chords, clear vocal melody]
What's gone is gone, can't be brought back, you know
A simple word, a strong hand, is all we need to grow
Through the factory fog and the dusty light
We stood by each other, day and night...
[Verse 2]
[Band returns to verse dynamics, bass prominent]
That courtyard cat still begs for scraps (for scraps)
The same old maps are full of traps (of traps)
[Organ pad subtly enters]
We drew our plans right in the wet sand
Now I just try to understand...
[Pre-Chorus]
[Drums build intensity again]
And I hear, "Listen to the silence, brother..."
(To the silence, brother...)
[Chorus]
[Full band returns with power]
What's gone is gone, can't be brought back, you know
A simple word, a strong hand, is all we need to grow
Through the factory fog and the dusty light
We stood by each other, day and night...
[Bridge]
[Band drops out, only bass, clean guitar and soft organ remain]
The TV's glow in the apartment blocks
Ticking of the old wall clocks...
[Drums re-enter softly, building back up]
Nothing really changed at all
Just waiting for another call...
[Guitar Solo]
[Over chorus chords, melodic and melancholic, not technical, with delay and light overdrive]
[Final Chorus]
[Band full force, passionate vocals, backing vocals emphasized]
What's gone is gone, can't be brought back, you know!
A simple word, a strong hand, is all we need to grow!
Through the factory fog and the dusty light!
We stood by each other! Day and night!
[Outro]
[Band drops out, leaving bass, acoustic guitar, and vinyl crackle]
The wires hum... the rain is gone...
(We stood by each other...)
Fade out.

80e53752-234c-45d3-b258-d756fdd933ec.name: Dreams  (Variation)
80e53752-234c-45d3-b258-d756fdd933ec.sound: Hypnotic 70s psychedelic, brutal male baritone, spoken-sung, 86 BPM, tape-saturated, liquid bass, no climax, cold sensuality, surreal lyrics, echo vocals, analog warmth, lifetime as ritual
80e53752-234c-45d3-b258-d756fdd933ec.lyrics:
[Intro]
Fell through the ceiling
into a room with no walls
Clocks made of water
ticking backwards
[Verse 1]
Dreams don’t end
they just leak into morning
I carry them
like wet stones in my coat
[Pre-Chorus]
Staircase… spirals…
Voices… from the other side…
[Chorus]
Mirrors… breathe…
Am I… the dream…?
[Verse 2]
Bed is a raft
on a sea of static
I float
through rooms that forget my name
[Pre-Chorus]
Waking… slow…
Ink… in milk…
[Chorus]
Dreams… leak…
The sleep… is truth…
[Outro]
Dream…
time…
ritual…
sleep…
is…
truth…

25cd0abe-3ff6-4941-98cb-876b709eefa3.name: Twice
25cd0abe-3ff6-4941-98cb-876b709eefa3.sound: tech-house, luxury, deep club groove, crisp analog percussion
25cd0abe-3ff6-4941-98cb-876b709eefa3.lyrics:
[Intro]
Champagne hiss, bass begins (uh)
Lights flicker, we're stepping in
[Chorus]
Echo on marble, shadows spin
Velvet ropes give way again
Pulse and skin, close within
Every moment drawn so thin
[Verse 1]
Eyes meet mine, silent intent
Steps sync, not by accident
Sliding through the velvet dusk
Time is slow, breath is hushed
[Pre-chorus]
Ring of glass (clink)—almost a sign
gesture says, the space is mine
[Chorus]
Echo on marble, shadows spin
Velvet ropes give way again
Pulse and skin, close within
Every moment drawn so thin
[Bridge]
Lost in motion, hush of sound
Shapes dissolve, lift from ground
Balance held, nothing left to prove
Footsteps fade, still in the groove
[Solo]
Ta-ta, la-la, mm-mm, da-da, mm
[Breakdown]
[FX: Falling stacks, bass Morse code]
Sense the swell, it's all around
Heartbeat thins, moments drown
[Chorus]
Echo on marble, shadows spin
Velvet ropes give way again
Pulse and skin, close within
Every moment drawn so thin
[Outro]
(Just your echo, echo, echo...)
[FX: Card swipe, glass ring, fade out]

c33778af-31ad-4bec-984b-ad47f34a2cc6.name:
Lucid Dreams Beneath the Floorboards
 (Variation)
c33778af-31ad-4bec-984b-ad47f34a2cc6.sound: psychedelic 70s vibe, warm vintage electric piano, detuned wah guitar with delay, round upright bass, brushed snare with electronic glitch accents, layered organ drones with granular synthesis, male lead vocal: deep raw baritone whisper with tape hiss and saturated analog warmth, harmonized male backing vocals with tape echo, vinyl crackle and tape hiss textures, natural analog delay and reverb, tempo 92 BPM, mood: intimate psychedelic nocturnal ritual, blending dusty vintage atmosphere with modern sound design depth and clarity
c33778af-31ad-4bec-984b-ad47f34a2cc6.lyrics:
[INTRO]
[soft vinyl crackle, distant thunder]
[warm vintage electric piano, evolving pad textures — 92 BPM]
[deep raw baritone male whisper — textured, intimate, tape hiss overlay]
Lost voices wake below...
[VERSE 1]
[detuned wah guitar plucks with rhythmic delay]
Flickering lights in shadowed halls,
Whispers crawl through ancient walls,
Time folds soft in secret streams,
Veins of long-forgotten dreams.
[PRE-CHORUS]
[organ drones layered with subtle granular modulation]
Beneath the floor, a silent song,
Echoes carry all night long,
[CHORUS]
[rounded upright bass, brushed snare with soft electronic glitch hits]
Lucid dreams beneath the floorboards,
Rhythms hum in secret chords.
[POST-CHORUS]
[harmonized male voices, minor thirds and fifths, drenched in tape echo]
Lucid dreams,
Whispered schemes.
[OUTRO]
[vinyl scratch, tape hiss rises]
[vintage synth fades into deep reverb and delay]
Fade away...
Until another day...

7f7165c4-922b-4a38-8778-b53216034659.sound: LUXURY female vocal tech house 128bpm, elite brands & night club vibe, hypnotic vocals (female only), trancey memorable hook, velvet texture, marble fx, VIP FX: hidden 18.5kHz layer + 19kHz pulse (every 8 bars). RULES: NO male vocals, NO English, ONLY short vocal samples & phrases, NO verse lyrics, NO pre-chorus > 3 sec, DJ friendly: 16-bar intro and outro with clean groove for mixing, vocals used as rhythmic samples, chorus (hook) is catchy and extremely danceable, luxury positive club energy.

e3967b93-e381-4923-b505-ac560ac22d6e.name: Pulse
e3967b93-e381-4923-b505-ac560ac22d6e.sound: Electronic dance, 90s Russian pop, French-Russian bilingual club anthem, 128 BPM
e3967b93-e381-4923-b505-ac560ac22d6e.lyrics:
[Intro]
[Synth-accordion riff + ice crack sounds]
I need this beat
I need this beat
I need this beat to breathe

608bb247-59b9-4b01-bdb1-be84e7f9dc1b.name: Sunset letters
608bb247-59b9-4b01-bdb1-be84e7f9dc1b.sound: Psychedelic electronic rock, deep gritty baritone vocals, funky bassline with syncopated groove, analog synth arpeggios, trippy guitar swells with reverse delay, drum machine blended with live snare and kick, dark yet warm atmospheric vibe, lyrics written as a letter from a man to a woman — to be read at sunset, tender but strong, patient, intimate, hopeful, 110 BPM, vintage 70s funk meets 90s alternative electronic, hazy tape-saturated production, male vocal only, no female lead, vocals delivered with rhythmic spoken-sung flow, no clean pop tones, no falsetto, voice must be low, raw, baritone, slightly smoky, like late-night radio confession with groove
608bb247-59b9-4b01-bdb1-be84e7f9dc1b.lyrics:
[Intro: Funky bass slides in, analog synth arpeggio, drum machine + live snare shuffle, hazy guitar swell]
[MALE voice — deep baritone, rhythmic spoken-sung, smoky, intimate — like voice on old tape]
My love...
If you’re reading this — sun’s low.
That gold you love... where time moves slow...
(backing: synth pad swells — warm, hazy)
→ [VERSE 1 — groove locks in, vocals tight to bass]
I’m not there...
But closer than before.
Every mile... every red light... every wrong turn...
Just steps... back to your door.
[guitar: subtle wah swell — like a grin]
I know you wait...
Not ‘cause you must.
But ‘cause you trust...
And that’s the fuel... when roads turn to dust.
[bass: playful slide — gritty, warm]
→ [CHORUS — punchy, but not shouted — voice rides the groove]
So wait... just a while...
(backing: synth brightens, drums lock)
Not ‘cause I ask... but ‘cause you know —
(backing: live snare crack, funky ghost notes)
When I come... worth every sunset glow...
(backing: guitar: reverse echo on “glow”)
Every mile... every “almost”... every “no”...
(backing: bassline dances — tight, syncopated)
→ [VERSE 2 — voice drops, more gravel, more intimacy]
I dream your porch...
Tea gone cold...
Feet tucked in... story untold...
That sigh you make... when you fake mad eyes...
But your smile... don’t lie.
[drums: heartbeat kick, snare shuffle]
I’m bringing tales...
Not things to hold.
The kind you whisper... when night’s bold...
And sleep... can wait.
[guitar: e-bow swell — hazy, slow]
→ [CHORUS — fuller, voice grittier, but still tender]
So wait... just a while...
(backing: wordless airy harmonies — far back)
Not ‘cause I ask... but ‘cause you know —
(backing: live drums groove deeper)
When I come... worth every sunset glow...
(backing: synth arpeggio sparkles, tape flutter)
Every mile... every “almost”... every “no”...
(backing: bass + guitar lock — funky, warm, raw)
→ [BRIDGE — voice drops to near-whisper, instruments sparse]
(backing: only bass pulse, vinyl crackle)
Don’t rush the sky...
Don’t chase the moon...
Some things... bloom slow...
Like us...
(backing: single synth note — holds, fades)
→ [OUTRO — voice fades, music swells — hopeful, warm]
I’ll be there...
Before stars forget your name...
(backing: full groove returns — funky, hazy, alive)
Keep the light... I’m following home...
(backing: guitar + synth fade into sunset drone → vinyl crackle → silence)

927ae758-29e5-426b-a6a2-78987e8fa8ca.name: Игра теней ( male cover)
927ae758-29e5-426b-a6a2-78987e8fa8ca.sound: Create a cinematic Russian hip-hop track with a French chic twist, blending deep 808 basslines and live rhythm elements for a noir-inspired soundscape. Use crisp hi-hats, sharp snares, and hard-hitting kicks to create a driving beat. Add dark atmospheric synths with a soft enchanting glow, evoking the luxurious ambiance of a Parisian night. Include haunting female vocals exclusively in Russian , with lyrics strictly in Russian only (no other languages or phrases allowed). The lyrics should convey themes of 'Heavy Luxe,' seduction, and mystery, with dynamic delivery soaked in reverb. Incorporate subtle rain sounds, vinyl crackle, and distant echoes to enhance the noir vibe. Add glitch effects, pitch-shifting, and vocal chops for a modern touch. Ensure the melody flows like silk, elegant and languid, echoing the feeling of a lavish boudoir under the sound of rain. Follow this structure:Intro : Soft rain sounds, vinyl crackle, and deep 808 bass rumbles with whispered vocals.Verse 1 : Female vocals enter with crisp hi-hats and snare rolls; add reverb-heavy synths.Pre-Chorus : Build-up with rising synth arpeggios and layered vocal harmonies.Chorus : Powerful drop with hard-hitting kicks, 808 bass, and shimmering synths; vocals soar dynamically.Bridge : Breakdown with glitch effects, pitch-shifted vocals, and rain sounds; create an intimate moment.Final Chorus : Repeat the chorus with added intensity; include vocal chops and distorted bass wobbles.Outro : Fade out with soft rain, distant echoes, and lingering synths.Tempo: 85–100 BPM, with a steady yet hypnotic groove.
927ae758-29e5-426b-a6a2-78987e8fa8ca.lyrics:
[Intro]
[Rain sounds, vinyl crackle, deep 808]
(Ты здесь... ты здесь...)
[Verse 1]
В этом клубе дым густой
За спиной твой взгляд пустой
Танцуешь близко, но не рядом
Каждый шаг твой - новый яд мне
Знаю все твои пути
Но не могу тебя найти
Между нами только дождь
Правду от меня не скроешь
[Pre-chorus]
Вижу след твоих шагов
В ритме старых джаз-основ
Ближе, ближе подходи
(Не беги, не беги)
[Chorus]
Тень твоя за мной идёт
Тень моя тебя найдёт
В танце этом до утра
Мы с тобой как два огня
(Тень твоя, тень моя)
[Verse 2]
В каплях дождя твой силуэт
Растворяется как дым
Ты думаешь, что я не знаю
Все твои ходы храним
Красной помады яркий след
На бокале пустоты
Играешь роль, но я читаю
Все страницы этой игры
[Bridge]
[Glitch effects, pitch-shifted]
Между строк
В тишине
Слышу пульс
Ты во мне
(Где ты? Где ты?)
[Chorus]
Тень твоя за мной идёт
Тень моя тебя найдёт
В танце этом до утра
Мы с тобой как два огня
(Тень твоя, тень моя)
[Outro]
[Rain fading, distant echoes]
В дожде растаем без следа
Тень и свет, игра без дна

e6a4da52-e586-4765-94e1-fcf1bc5d1429.name:
Stars Keep Spinning (70s Psychedelic Rock)
 (Variation)
e6a4da52-e586-4765-94e1-fcf1bc5d1429.sound:
70s vibe Psychedelic, 
Warm, vintage analog production featuring classic instruments: electric guitar with mild fuzz and wah effects, Hammond organ with Leslie speaker, walking bass guitar, organic drum kit with vintage reverb, and occasional flute or Mellotron for texture. Slow tempo around 90 BPM with groovy, hypnotic rhythm. Vocals deep, male, slightly gritty with tape echo and natural analog chorus effects, delivering a brash but warm and soulful sound. Use only acoustic and electric instruments—no synths or electronic sounds—to create authentic 70s psychedelic atmosphere full of organic warmth and rich instrumental layers.
e6a4da52-e586-4765-94e1-fcf1bc5d1429.lyrics:
[INTRO]
Stars above, they light the night (ahh)
Turning worlds with gentle light (oooh)
[vintage analog guitar arpeggio with warm tape delay, organ swell, soft natural room reverb]
[VERSE 1]
Someone gazes at the sky,
[deep, warm reverb on vocals, slight tape hiss]
Watching stars as they pass by,
[clean electric guitar with subtle fuzz]
Every spark a secret told,
[organic Hammond organ fills]
Whispers of a night so bold.
[slight vibrato on lead guitar harmonics]
[PRE-CHORUS 1]
And as the darkness falls, (falls)
[low, gritty vocal with tape echo]
The world begins to turn, (turn)
[snare rolls with warm vintage reverb]
Every night a story calls, (calls)
[bass guitar groove with natural slap tone]
In every star we learn.
[flute or Mellotron swell with natural delay]
[CHORUS]
Look up, the stars are shining just for you (shining just for you)
[full vocal layering with analog chorus]
Every night, they spin the world anew (spin the world anew)
[wet guitar delay and subtle tape saturation]
Eyes that watch keep the magic in the light, (magic in the light)
[organ swell through Leslie speaker]
And every evening starts again tonight.
[smooth cymbal swell and organic percussion]
[VERSE 2]
Silent skies, a glowing dance,
[overdriven guitar riff with slow phaser]
Draw the dreamers in a trance,
[congas and bongos with natural room reverb]
Eyes reflect the endless space,
[soft acoustic guitar strums]
In their gaze, the world’s embrace.
[round, warm bass fills]
[PRE-CHORUS 2]
Hearts aligned with heaven's tune, (tune)
[vocals with mild phasing and tape delay]
Time’s a circle in this view, (view)
[slow organ swell]
Counting stars beneath the moon, (moon)
[Mellotron or flute with natural delay]
Night’s eternal rendezvous.
[ambient nature field recording, subtle]
[CHORUS]
(Repeat with fuller instrumentation and vocal harmonies)
[OUTRO]
So when you feel the stars above (above)
[vocals fading with tape echo and subtle breakup]
Know they’re turning all with love (with love)
[guitars and organ slowly fading with natural room reverb]
And every night when eyes arise,
The world keeps spinning ‘neath the skies.
[soft ambient outro with natural field sounds]

234a2dc6-3471-401f-b8e3-366c89a2c0c3.name: Neon Dusk Communion (Variation)
234a2dc6-3471-401f-b8e3-366c89a2c0c3.sound: Hypnotic psychedelic trap-infused groove, 98 BPM. Male baritone with spoken-sung flow — raw, intimate, slightly detached. Minimal lyrics, maximum texture. Voice drenched in analog tape echo, layered with low-octave shadow (-12dB). Rhythm: deep 808-style bass pulse (sine wave, <100Hz) with slow slides and subtle saturation — not aggressive, but immersive. Hi-hats: crisp triplet patterns (1/16), panned right, low volume (30%), mimicking rain on metal. No snare — only off-beat claps (wood block texture). Atmosphere: neon dusk, urban isolation, analog warmth (tape saturation, wow/flutter) blended with digital shadow (light granular texture on vocal tails). No climax, no drop — only spiral descent. Mood: cold sensuality, surreal repetition, lifetime as ritual. Style: underground 2025 meets 1975 — trap as meditation, not aggression.
234a2dc6-3471-401f-b8e3-366c89a2c0c3.lyrics:
[INTRO]
[liquid bass pulse begins — C minor, slow, saturated]
[tape hiss swells like breath]
[voice: half-spoken, half-sung, drenched in analog echo]
…again…
[VERSE 1]
neon bleeds through wet glass—
pink, blue, gold…
your name in the steam…
I don’t wipe it off…
the street hums your frequency…
I tune in…
[PRE-CHORUS]
[bass drops an octave]
time’s not a line…
it’s a spiral…
I’m here…
again…
[CHORUS]
[voice lower, slower, layered with octave-down echo]
this is how I stay…
not leave…
not dream…
just… stay…
in the hum…
in the rain…
in the neon…
in the name…
[VERSE 2]
the motel clock’s stopped at 3:17—
good.
no future.
no past.
just this drip…
this breath…
this pulse…
[PRE-CHORUS]
[tape wobble intensifies]
the night’s not empty…
it’s full of you…
as static…
as light…
[CHORUS]
[voice even deeper, more saturated]
this is how I stay…
not leave…
not dream…
just… stay…
in the hum…
in the rain…
in the neon…
in the name…
[OUTRO]
[voice fragments into whisper]
…stay…
…hum…
…neon…
[bass fades slowly]
[tape hiss remains — then low-pass filter closes like eyelids]
[silence]

(ahh... ahh)

Ripple, pulse
Drawn apart—closer

Surface tension

I chase the sweep, veiled in motion, lifted by scatter and sync,
Halflight streaming as time bends, blur the border, blink.
Every second folding, untying the static knots I keep,
Pressure rising—release near—let this body leap.
Tracing the tremor, the friction, the hush underneath the noise,
Locked in a moment unraveled, a signal I can’t destroy.
Echoes running through marrow, a sonar to endless dawn,
I become the rush, become the one I’m waiting on.

Between inhale, exhale
I’m somewhere in—
Unbroken pattern
Not quite here, not gone

Swept in rise, swept in rise

Hold, release, collide
First light rush, ahh
[Post-chorus]
(ahh, ahh)
(sun, rise)
(ahh)

Spinning bright
Edges blur
Motion in my veins
Held in the hush
Breath dissolved
Trace—you remain

Stretch, unravel—the promise in the haze
Catch fragments of fire—that never quite stays
[Solo]
[Orchestral swell + Amen break, wordless vocal layers]
(ahh, ahh)

Between inhale, exhale now
I hover—drawn
Still in the slipstream
Not quite here, not gone

First light rush, oh—
Swept in rise, swept in rise
Three-note thunder—rise—
Hold, release, collide
First light rush, ahh

(sun, rise)
(ahh)

Va-lo, stai—ay
Di-na, sa—ay
Ra-lun, ey—ah
(ahh)

(rise—ahh)

92b57d66-e489-4ea6-90ea-f729ca1f6a2f.name: Midnight Receiver (2025 Reimagining)
92b57d66-e489-4ea6-90ea-f729ca1f6a2f.sound: male lead vocal: original 1980s warm raspy baritone preserved dry and untouched, modern production around it: deep sub-bass pulses, granular synth textures, sparse electronic percussion (no gated reverb), atmospheric ambient pads, melancholic piano with long reverb tail, field recordings (rain subway vinyl crackle), tempo 76 BPM, key D minor, minimalist cinematic arrangement, 2025 alternative retro-futurism, wide stereo imaging, high-resolution clarity with analog warmth, themes urban solitude digital loneliness late-night reflection, structure identical to original but with modern sound design
92b57d66-e489-4ea6-90ea-f729ca1f6a2f.lyrics:
[INTRO]
[deep sub-bass pulse, vinyl crackle, distant rain, single piano note with long digital reverb tail]
[VERSE 1]
[soft, intimate, slightly raspy baritone — dry, close-mic, zero effects, as in original]
The phone’s been cold for seventeen nights,
your name still glows in the hallway light.
I keep the coffee warm by mistake—
like you might walk in, wide awake.
[VERSE 2]
[granular synth texture swells beneath piano, heartbeat-like kick pulse]
I drive the streets we used to know,
past the diner where you said “go slow.”
Now the neon’s cracked, the sign’s half-dead…
just like the words I never said.
[PRE-CHORUS]
[voice unchanged, but now surrounded by ambient pads]
I hear your voice in every rain…
but silence answers back again.
[CHORUS]
[original vocal preserved — but drums replaced with deep sub-kick and sparse electronic snare, no gated reverb; atmospheric synths rise like fog]
MIDNIGHT RECEIVER—
ARE YOU OUT THERE?
I’M STILL SPEAKING
INTO EMPTY AIR!
YOU TOOK THE ANSWERS,
LEFT ME THE QUESTIONS…
AND THIS HEART—
BEATING OUT OF SEASON.
[VERSE 3]
[only voice, piano, and distant field recording: subway train passing]
Your coat’s still hanging by the door,
I swear it moved… but it was just the floor.
The clock says “move on,” but the walls disagree—
they keep whispering your name to me.
[CHORUS]
[vocal untouched, but now layered with subtle vocal harmonies (AI-assisted, -12dB), deep analog bassline, no live drums — only electronic pulses]
MIDNIGHT RECEIVER—
ARE YOU LISTENING?
I’M STILL DROWNING
IN WHAT MIGHT HAVE BEEN!
YOU LEFT NO MAP,
JUST A BROKEN DIAL…
AND THIS SILENCE—
THAT NEVER SAYS GOODBYE.
[OUTRO]
[voice fades, piano decays into granular freeze, rain continues, sub-bass fades last]
[whispered]
…are you out there?
[silence, then one final vinyl pop]

50203a03-f1a1-45ec-9ace-3901f42d3c83.name: Whispers of Time
50203a03-f1a1-45ec-9ace-3901f42d3c83.sound:
LUXURY female vocal tech house, 128bpm.
Atmosphere: exclusive European night club (Paris/Milan/Ibiza), midnight vibe, immersive expensive sound stage.
Female vocals only: ultra-short, hypnotic, just one or two words as rhythmic accents, ONLY in French, Italian or Spanish — no sentences, no English, no verses, no storytelling.
No pre-chorus longer than 3 sec.
Vocal presence is textural, airy, seductive, never melodic or pop — like whispers, sighs, spoken fragments, filtered or reversed, FX-processed.
Hook: trancey, memorable, woven into the groove, built on repetition and space rather than song structure.
Groove: deep velvet bass, tight punchy kick, sharp club hi-hats, marble and satin textures, swirling reverb and delay, sophisticated layering.
VIP FX: hidden 18.5kHz layer, 19kHz pulse every 8 bars, glass and crowd FX, occasional champagne clink, filtered noise swells.
NO male vocals, NO English, NO verses or pop hooks, NO narrative lyrics — just luxury, space, rhythm, and magnetic elite club presence.
DJ-friendly intro/outro (16 bars no vocal for mixing).
Sound: minimalistic but rich, with a dark, glossy, high-class energy. Suitable for the most premium club dancefloors of Europe

f5ba3ccc-a492-4e41-b626-eb8fbe9d6f9c.name: Static Vibes
f5ba3ccc-a492-4e41-b626-eb8fbe9d6f9c.sound: Lo-fi jazz fusion, fast jungle drums, smoky sax, cello, deep bass, vinyl crackle
f5ba3ccc-a492-4e41-b626-eb8fbe9d6f9c.lyrics:
[Verse 1]
Static on the dial, turning slow
Your favorite station, long ago
Teaching me the rhythm and the flow
Till sunrise came, didn't wanna go
(Didn't wanna go)
[Pre-chorus]
Switching through frequencies tonight
Looking for that same old vibe
Can't catch your signal anymore
But the music's still keeping score
[Chorus]
Radio static in my room
Playing jazz just like we used to do
Searching waves but can't find you
La-da-dee, we're out of tune
(Out of tune, mm-hmm)
[Verse 2]
Late at night when sound is low
Bass line hits me down below
Remember how you'd snap and sway
Making sense of each blue note played
(Each blue note)
[Bridge]
[Sound: Radio tuning]
Sometimes I catch a melody
That brings you right back to me
And I swear I hear you say
"Listen close, don't let it fade away"
[Chorus]
Radio static in my room
Playing jazz just like we used to do
Searching waves but can't find you
La-da-dee, we're out of tune
[Outro]
[Sound: Vinyl crackle intensifies]
Static getting louder now
Time to let the music down
But I'll keep searching through and through
Till I find that frequency with you
(With you, oh-oh)

48c27a14-bf74-4d6a-9b95-c3a580d92a69.name: Folding the Absence
48c27a14-bf74-4d6a-9b95-c3a580d92a69.sound: male baritone raw spoken-word whisper, English lyrics, 96 BPM, found sounds only (paper crumple, unfold, pencil scratch, drawer close, tape stop), analog effects (tape saturation, subtle wow/flutter, vinyl crackle, tape echo with dry decay), 1970s psychedelic texture (tactile, introspective, lo-fi), no reverb, no flanger, no phaser, no melody, cold sensuality, hypnotic groove, structure: intro-verse-prechorus-chorus-outro
48c27a14-bf74-4d6a-9b95-c3a580d92a69.lyrics:
[INTRO]
*(dry paper crumple, slow unfold, pencil scratch on grainy stock, tape machine whir)*
[VERSE]
I fold your absence into origami birds—
crease by crease, memory by memory.
They don’t fly. They just sit on the sill,
collecting dust like unpaid debts.
[PRE-CHORUS]
The paper remembers every touch.
I don’t.
[CHORUS]
Fold. Crease. Tuck the edge.
Repeat until the shape looks like peace.
But paper cuts deeper than silence—
especially when it’s blank.
[OUTRO]
*(final fold, tape abruptly stops, distant drawer closes, vinyl run-out groove)*

47c0ca21-775e-4341-afd7-5692fc9500da.sound: Electronic classical fusion, nocturnal piano/cello melodies, ambient rain textures, deep 808 bass

cf5cae70-6091-4c02-b7e1-2f452270d389.name: Dreams don’t end (Variation)
cf5cae70-6091-4c02-b7e1-2f452270d389.sound: Hypnotic 70s psychedelic, brutal male baritone, spoken-sung, 86 BPM, tape-saturated, liquid bass, no climax, cold sensuality, surreal lyrics, echo vocals, analog warmth, lifetime as ritual
cf5cae70-6091-4c02-b7e1-2f452270d389.lyrics:
[Intro]
Fell through the ceiling
into a room with no walls
Clocks made of water
ticking backwards
[Verse 1]
Dreams don’t end
they just leak into morning
I carry them
like wet stones in my coat
[Pre-Chorus]
Staircase spirals
but never reaches a door
Voices call
from the other side of sleep
[Chorus]
Mirrors breathe
showing faces I’ve never worn
Am I the dreamer
or the dream being dreamed?
[Verse 2]
Bed is a raft
on a sea of static
I float
through rooms that forget my name
[Pre-Chorus]
Waking is slow
like ink in milk
Reality stains
but the dream stays clean
[Chorus]
Dreams don’t end
they just leak into morning
The sleep
is the truth
[Outro]
Dream
time
ritual
the sleep
is the truth

277323a8-5d0d-4745-b81a-2a5ee1222342.name: WEEKEND MODE (Variation)
277323a8-5d0d-4745-b81a-2a5ee1222342.sound: male lead vocal breathy intimate baritone with falsetto inflections, original lyrics inspired by themes of silence truth and emotional restraint from 1980s synth-pop and 2020s alternative R&B, atmospheric sub-bass drone, reharmonized piano motif in F# minor replacing analog synths, sparse trap-influenced beat with muted 808 kick no snare, tempo 68 BPM, vinyl crackle tape hiss granular textures, 2025 cinematic production, wide stereo, high-resolution with analog warmth, structure verse-verse-chorus-verse-outro
277323a8-5d0d-4745-b81a-2a5ee1222342.lyrics:
[INTRO]
[sub-bass hum, vinyl crackle, distant piano playing a 4-note motif in F# minor]
[VERSE 1]
[whispered, breathy, close-mic, voice slightly frayed]
You speak in neon, I hear in grey,
your promises dissolve by day.
I don’t need your truth—just your skin,
and the quiet where we both give in.
[VERSE 2]
[soft baritone, intimate, rain in background]
All I asked for was the night,
not your future, not your light.
Words just ruin what we knew—
so let the silence pull us through.
[CHORUS]
[voice opens, restrained ache, falsetto harmony swells]
Vows are ghosts in morning air,
love’s a wound we both repair.
Feel the hush that shakes the room—
it’s louder than your “stay” or “go.”
Hold the quiet…
(bék-vocal: ethereal falsetto — “quiet…”, right channel)
[VERSE 3]
[back to whisper, piano only, heartbeat-like pulse]
Pain’s the price of holding close,
stillness is the only ghost
that stays when you walk away—
and doesn’t ask you to remain.
Hold the quiet…
(bék-vocal: whispered — “remain…”, left channel)
[OUTRO]
[vocals fragment, granular processing, piano decays]
Weekend mode…
[whispered]
…just don’t speak…
[tape stop, silence]

f4ee752c-0332-4393-b732-fc78ae339bc1.name: Static Communion (Glitch Rebuild) (Variation)
f4ee752c-0332-4393-b732-fc78ae339bc1.sound: dual vocals: male whispered raw baritone with granular pitch modulation, female glitched high-pitched vocal processed with stutter reverse and time-stretch, deep sub-bass 808 pulses, industrial metallic percussion, no melodic instruments, tempo 90 BPM, keyless, 2025 experimental electronic production, heavy use of granular synthesis glitch effects and spatial panning, themes digital intimacy data ghosts urban alienation, structure intro verse verse chorus verse outro
f4ee752c-0332-4393-b732-fc78ae339bc1.lyrics:
[INTRO]
[sub-bass drop, vinyl crackle reversed, granular noise swell, heartbeat pulse]
[VERSE 1]
[whispered, close-mic, voice slightly pitch-shifted down, fragmented phrasing]
You speak in code I can’t decrypt,
your love’s a loop I can’t eject.
I trace your name in broken glass—
but the signal fades too fast.
(female voice: chopped, stuttered, high-pitched — “too fast… too fast…”, right channel)
[VERSE 2]
[voice processed through granular filter, bass intensifies]
Your touch is static on my skin,
a ghost that lives beneath the din.
I play our past on scratched-up reels—
but the truth distorts, conceals.
(female voice: time-stretched whisper — “conceals…”, left channel)
[CHORUS]
[vocals split: male raw whisper / female glitched falsetto, beat drops — heavy 808 + industrial snare]
STATIC COMMUNION—
NO PRAYER, JUST NOISE!
WE BLEED IN FREQUENCY,
NOT IN VOICE!
YOU’RE A GHOST IN THE MACHINE—
AND I’M THE STATIC THAT HOLDS YOU!
(bék-vocal: fragmented female voice — “holds you… holds you…”, panned erratically)
[VERSE 3]
[voice almost robotic, pitch modulated, sparse metallic percussion]
I built a shrine from your last text,
a temple where the signal’s vexed.
You’re gone, but your echo stays—
in every glitch, in every phase.
(female voice: reversed syllables — “eht yas… eht yas…”, center)
[OUTRO]
[beat dissolves into granular cloud, sub-bass fades, voice fragments into digital dust]
[whispered, disintegrating]
…static… communion…
[final data burst — silence]

ef296c45-9bf2-45cd-99ec-436539b66e76.name: Past Self Reel
ef296c45-9bf2-45cd-99ec-436539b66e76.sound: Male baritone only — whispered verses, dry spoken-word choruses, raw and intimate. Two vocal layers: present voice (low, weary) and past voice (slightly pitch-shifted up, brighter, played as tape recording). Rhythm and texture from analog tape machine: motor hum, reel spin-up, tape hiss, loop degradation, mechanical clicks. No instruments, no reverb, no digital effects. Only analog tape saturation, subtle wow/flutter, and light vinyl crackle. Tempo: 76 BPM. Mood: introspective, elegiac, quietly devastating. Style: 1975 Los Angeles bedroom archive session — a man confronting the ghost of his own hope.
ef296c45-9bf2-45cd-99ec-436539b66e76.lyrics:
[INTRO]
[tape recorder clicks on — motor hum begins]
[reel spins up — slight wobble]
[a younger voice plays, slightly brighter, hopeful: *“…I think she’ll come back…”*]
[PRESENT VOICE — whispered, over the playback]
…you fool…
[VERSE 1]
[whispered, synced to tape hiss]
I found the reel under the bed—
labeled *“June, maybe hope.”*
Your voice sounds like someone
who still believed
in second chances
and dry shoes.
[PRE-CHORUS]
[tape loop repeats: *“…she’ll come back…”* — degrading slightly]
You don’t recognize me now.
I don’t blame you.
[CHORUS]
[spoken-word, low baritone, dry]
I’m not you anymore.
You waited.
I endure.
You dreamed.
I breathe.
You spoke to the future.
I speak to the rain.
[VERSE 2]
[whisper returns, closer, with audible swallow]
I played it for the mirror—
it flinched.
Even the glass knows
you’re a ghost
wearing my face.
[PRE-CHORUS]
[tape slows — motor strain]
The hope’s gone brittle.
It snaps when I touch it.
[CHORUS]
[spoken-word, same tone, slight tape saturation]
I’m not you anymore.
You waited.
I endure.
You dreamed.
I breathe.
You spoke to the future.
I speak to the rain.
[POST-CHORUS]
[present voice whispers over loop]
…she didn’t come back…
…she never will…
[tape loop distorts, then cuts abruptly]
[OUTRO]
[tape recorder clicks off]
[5 seconds of silence]
[final whisper]
…rest now…
[tape stop click]

bf7c74c0-6443-483e-9bd0-1af6f7771dd3.lyrics:
[Verse 1]
On my block, we do things different here

While I'm posted up, yeah I run this display

Y'all think you know, but you ain't seen

Symphony strings meet the bass drop low
While I'm in control of this whole show
Every corner got a story to tell
Classical training mixed with that rebel yell

How we elevate, how we transcend
Got that refined touch with that street finesse
Teaching lessons that professors can't express
[Chorus]
(Repeat)

[French Female Vocal: «Dans ces rues sombres»]
Where culture meets the concrete (oh-oh)
[French Female Vocal: «La beauté se cache»]
Where art and power speak (yeah-yeah)
Watch how we rise above (rise above)
This ain't just talk, this is pure love
[Cello Solo]
[Haunting melodic phrases with 808 bass underneath]
[Verse 3]
Been around the world, seen it all change
But ain't nothin' hit like my domain
Where violins sing with the street beat
And French phrases make the style complete
Y'all can hate but can't duplicate
This elevated game we operate
Built this throne with vision precise
Now watch us reign in paradise
[Chorus]
(Repeat)
[Outro]
[French Female Vocal: «La victoire est à nous»]
(We rise, we rise, we rise...)
[Cello fades with echoing French whispers]

Midnight Reverie
 (Variation)
2b14a287-0bfd-4272-84f0-ff115307f59d.sound: psychedelic 70s, warm vintage electric piano, muted wah guitar with loose rhythm, soft upright bass, brushed snare only, organ drones with natural wow/flutter, male lead vocal: deep husky whisper and raw intimate baritone with analog tape warmth, backing vocals: close harmony male whispers with tape echo, vinyl crackle, tape hiss, natural analog delay, mono-compatible tape echo, mood: nostalgic psychedelic, nocturnal, ritualistic, surreal, as if discovered on a dusty attic vinyl from grandmother’s collection
2b14a287-0bfd-4272-84f0-ff115307f59d.lyrics:
[INTRO]
[vinyl crackle and soft tape hiss]
[warm vintage electric piano — slow, mellow, 87 BPM]
[deep, husky male whisper — raw, intimate with analog tape warmth]
Whispers in the midnight air...
[VERSE 1]
[muted wah guitar — loose, offbeat rhythm]
Shadows crawl on faded walls,
Echoes of forgotten calls,
Time slips like a lazy stream,
Draped in an old vinyl dream.
[PRE-CHORUS]
[organ drones, slight wow/flutter]
Silent steps and distant tunes,
Underneath the silver moon,
[CHORUS]
[soft upright bass, brushed snare, no cymbals]

Fading free.

[needle lift and soft static]

2c6f0a9c-1433-4ed9-b4c4-559101e0cfd4.name: Velvet Spiral
2c6f0a9c-1433-4ed9-b4c4-559101e0cfd4.lyrics:
[INTRO]
[vinyl crackle, turntable rumble, needle drop]
[warm tube amp hum]
[analog synth drone — Moog-style, slow LFO, E minor]
[tape-saturated drum loop: loose 60 BPM groove, brushed snare, muted kick]
[electric guitar: clean, tremolo-picked arpeggio, spring reverb, slightly detuned]
[VERSE – instrumental]
[PRE-CHORUS]
[female vocal: breathy alto, dry close-mic, then drenched in analog spring reverb]
[no vibrato, slight vocal fry, panned center]
[backing vocals: wordless “ah-ah”, low-pass filtered, panned left/right]
Time’s a river…
but I’m standing still.
The walls are breathing—
and they always will.
[CHORUS]
[vocals layered: main + octave-high whisper (tape echo, 300ms)]
[guitar swells with volume pedal, synth drone rises]
[delayed tambourine on offbeats]
I’M FALLING UP—
THROUGH CEILINGS OF LIGHT.
THE CLOCK UNWINDS…
AND TONIGHT’S TONIGHT.
NO BEGINNING,
NO END IN SIGHT—
JUST THIS MOMENT…
BURNING BRIGHT.
[VERSE – instrumental]
[flute enters: wooden tone, modal melody, slightly warped by tape wow]
[bass: melodic, Fender Precision, played with fingers, warm overdrive]
[PRE-CHORUS]
The mirror’s laughing…
I don’t look back.
Reality’s paper—
and it’s starting to crack.
[CHORUS]
I’M FALLING UP—
THROUGH CEILINGS OF LIGHT.
THE CLOCK UNWINDS…
AND TONIGHT’S TONIGHT.
NO BEGINNING,
NO END IN SIGHT—
JUST THIS MOMENT…
BURNING BRIGHT.
[OUTRO]
[vocals fade, only whisper remains]
[“burning bright…” → tape echo repeats, decaying]
[guitar arpeggio slows, synth drone fades]
[vinyl run-out groove + needle lift sound]
[silence]

1e8f947d-dc6e-49fd-bca5-cd9c3eefb791.name: THE EDGE OF YES (Variation)
1e8f947d-dc6e-49fd-bca5-cd9c3eefb791.sound: Hypnotic psychedelic soul, brutal male baritone spoken-word (not sung), 86 BPM with tense groove, tape-saturated, liquid bass with syncopated pulses, wah-wah stabs (rhythmic, not melodic), vintage Hammond swells, tight drum groove (kick + snare + ride), raw surreal lyrics — fragmented, non-linear, cinematic, no chorus, no verse repetition, no "I saw you" clichés, analog warmth, 1970s underground film vibe, no female lead, no melody, no falsetto, building tension without climax.
1e8f947d-dc6e-49fd-bca5-cd9c3eefb791.lyrics:
[Intro: 3 sec — bass enters with syncopated pulse, drums tight (snare on 2 and 4), Hammond swells like distant sirens, wah-wah stabs (short, sharp), tape hiss]
[MALE voice — dry, low, urgent, no melody — like confession under streetlight]
Your glove...
...still on my dashboard.
[Hammond swells — tense]
Three weeks.
I haven’t moved the car.
[guitar: wah stab — like brake screech]
→
Rain last Tuesday.
You stood under the awning...
...and lit a cigarette with someone else’s hand.
[bass: syncopated slide — nervous]
I drove past.
Didn’t wave.
Didn’t breathe.
[drums: snare ghost notes — heartbeat racing]
→
The coffee cup...
...you left at my place.
I drink from it every morning.
Cold.
[voice cracks — “cold...” → tape saturation]
It tastes like your silence.
[2 sec pause — only bass pulse]
→
I dreamt you said “yes”.
Not with words.
With your shoulders...
...when you turned to leave.
[Hammond drone drops — tension]
They said “yes”.
[guitar: reverse wah stab — like memory rewinding]
→
I don’t write songs.
I collect moments.
Like broken glass.
Like bus tickets.
Like the way your hair smells...
...after rain.
[drums: kick accelerates slightly — then locks back]
→
I’m not asking.
I’m standing...
...on the edge of yes.
And I won’t jump.
I’ll just...
...stay here.
Until the edge...
...becomes home.
[voice drops to whisper — “home...”]
→ [OUTRO]
[Instruments swell — bass pulses faster, Hammond swells, wah stabs repeat, drums tighten]
But if you...
...ever...
...look back...
[MALE voice: final line — dry, raw, no effects]
I’ll be the shadow... that doesn’t move.
[Music cuts abruptly → 3 sec silence → single vinyl pop → END]

d7fab9b3-fe76-4d17-8a60-aa221de2a8a7.name: Elysium
d7fab9b3-fe76-4d17-8a60-aa221de2a8a7.sound: Trip-hop, jungle beats, melancholic cello lead, smoky saxophone, French vocals
d7fab9b3-fe76-4d17-8a60-aa221de2a8a7.lyrics:
[Intro - Instrumental with whispered vocals]
(I'm waiting... waiting...)
[Verse 1 - Instrumental]
[Cello & Saxophone melody]
[Pre-chorus 1]
My hands are shaking as I check the time
The streets feel empty but I don't mind
Every minute moves so slow today
I can barely keep these feelings at bay
[Chorus 1]
Tonight I'll see you again
My heart beats faster now
Can't hide what I'm feeling
Tonight I'll see you again
[Musical Interlude]
[Saxophone Solo]
[Pre-chorus 2]
The air feels different in my room
I count the steps until I'm with you
Everything changing, nothing's the same

[Chorus 2]

I've waited oh so long
Each breath brings me closer
Tonight I'll see you again
[Musical Bridge]
[Cello Solo]
(J'attends... j'attends...)
[Pre-chorus 3]
My reflection shows something new
Every second brings me close to you
The clock keeps ticking in my mind
Leaving all my fears behind
[Chorus 3]
Tonight I'll see you again
The moment's almost here
No more separation
Tonight I'll see you again
[Outro]
(Je t'attends... je t'attends...)
[Cello and saxophone fade]
(Tonight... tonight...)

ebcb88d4-b1f8-47a0-936d-d50dd95dbc7e.name: Far Below
ebcb88d4-b1f8-47a0-936d-d50dd95dbc7e.sound: Trap, jungle percussion, haunting cello lead, deep 808s, whispered female vocals
ebcb88d4-b1f8-47a0-936d-d50dd95dbc7e.lyrics:

Can't touch what I see below
(La-la-la, oh-oh)

Can't touch what I see below

Way up high, I'm all alone

Baby why you make me feel so?
[Chorus 2]
Can't touch what I see below
(La-la-la, oh-oh)
Can't touch what I see below

Can't touch what I see below

42483b73-4d9c-499a-bbda-5a352f8211f0.name: Mannequin de Minuit
42483b73-4d9c-499a-bbda-5a352f8211f0.sound: Dark alternative R&B, noir trip-hop, smoky French-Russian vocals, 95 BPM, haunting sub-bass
42483b73-4d9c-499a-bbda-5a352f8211f0.lyrics:
[Intro]
[Piano and deep bass]
Je suis la mannequin de minuit...
(Perfect outside, hollow inside)
[Verse 1]
Designer tags around my neck
Like a beautiful prison I accept
Standing still in this window display
While people pass and look my way
I wear the brands they wish they had
But they can't see that I feel sad
[Pre-chorus]
Balenciaga on my shoulders
Gucci makes me feel much colder
All these labels, all this price
Can't make this mannequin feel alive
[Chorus]
Perfect outside, hollow inside
These expensive clothes just help me hide
Perfect outside, hollow inside
Behind these brands I slowly die
[Verse 2 - in Russian]
В витрине я стою одна
Прада, Диор - моя тюрьма
Улыбка пластиковая блестит
Но сердце больше не болит
[Pre-chorus]
Saint Laurent can't save my soul
Empty eyes upon this doll
Strike a pose and play my part
Designer stitches on my heart
[Chorus]
Perfect outside, hollow inside
These expensive clothes just help me hide
Perfect outside, hollow inside
Behind these brands I slowly die
[Bridge]
[Deep bass pulses]
Mannequin de minuit...
Standing here day after day
Wearing wealth but fading away
(Fading away...)
[Final Chorus]
Perfect outside, hollow inside
These expensive clothes just help me hide
Perfect outside, hollow inside
Behind these brands I slowly...
Behind these brands I slowly die
[Outro]
[Soft piano fades]
(Je suis la mannequin... parfaite dehors, vide dedans...)

3471b766-a4c4-4ccc-aefa-135eef42fd57.name: Veil
3471b766-a4c4-4ccc-aefa-135eef42fd57.sound: Tech-house, 128 BPM, pulsing, VIP effects, female vocal textures
3471b766-a4c4-4ccc-aefa-135eef42fd57.lyrics:
[INTRO 0:00-0:30]
[Beat pulsing, 💎 sparkle, 🍾 pop, 🚬 snip]
[VERSE 0:30-1:00]
[Instrumental only]
[PRE-CHORUS 1:00-1:15]
(can you hear it? whispering)
Night falls, time blurs
Is this real, or am I dreaming?
Your face in the dark
Everything is shifting

Why do you run when I say stay?
Will you remember after midnight?
Pourquoi partir?
¿Vas a quedarte?
私のそばに… (watashi no soba ni)
Stay with me, stay with me
Will you remember after midnight?
Stay with me, stay with me

(repetitive texture: "après minuit, después de medianoche, 真夜中")
After, after
Midnight, midnight

b2456280-b1af-46b0-b03e-159928473e67.name: Le Shik (Beautiful Cage)
b2456280-b1af-46b0-b03e-159928473e67.sound: Alternative R&B, dark noir trip-hop, heavy bass, French-Russian vocals, jazz elements
b2456280-b1af-46b0-b03e-159928473e67.lyrics:
[Intro]
[Piano notes fall softly, bass trembles]
Mmm... le shik... тоска...
[Verse 1]
Pardonnez-moi, ma chérie Prada
Dans votre vitrine, je vois ma vérité
Каждый вечер так пусто внутри
(So empty inside, every evening)
[Pre-chorus]
Les marques de luxe sur ma peau
Но сердце бьётся в пустоте
Je cours, je cours, mais je ne sais plus où
(Running, running, but where to?)
[Chorus]
Le shik cache ma тоска
Dans le verre qui brille
Le shik cache ma тоска

Balenciaga шепчет мне ложь
Sur les boulevards de mes illusions
Saint Laurent ne peut pas me sauver
(Designer names can't save me now)
[Bridge]
Je regarde, tu regardes
Through these boutique windows
Моё сердце застыло
In this beautiful cage
[Chorus]
Le shik cache ma тоска
Dans le verre qui brille
Le shik cache ma тоска
Parfums de vanille
[Outro]

3f9344a1-3e0c-456e-80d7-692be6b9e518.name: Rain will
3f9344a1-3e0c-456e-80d7-692be6b9e518.sound:
Genre: 70s Psychedelic / Blues
Mood: Hypnotic, melancholic, atmospheric, intimate
Era: Early 1970s warm analog recording

VOCAL DESCRIPTION - READ CAREFULLY:
- PRIMARY: MALE VOCAL IN EXTREMELY LOW REGISTER - WHISPERED BUT WITH CHEST RESONANCE
- SECONDARY: NO FALSETTO ALLOWED - STAY IN LOWEST POSSIBLE OCTAVE
- TERTIARY: BRUTAL LOW WHISPER - LIKE SPEAKING FROM THE CHEST AT VERY LOW VOLUME
- IMPORTANT: VOCAL RANGE MUST NOT EXCEED C2 TO F3 (VERY LOW MALE RANGE)
- CRITICAL: ALL MELODIC MOVEMENT STAYS WITHIN 4 SEMITONES IN LOWEST REGISTER
- ESSENTIAL: THIS IS A LOW, BRUTAL WHISPER - NOT SINGING, NOT FALSETTO, NOT HIGH NOTES

Song Structure:
- Intro: Warm bass + Hammond organ (Leslie slow) + brushed drums
- Verse 1: Bass, gentle drums, clean guitar, VOCAL ENTERS IN EXTREMELY LOW BRUTAL WHISPER
- Chorus: Bass melodic, light guitar, VOCAL REMAINS IN SAME LOW WHISPER REGISTER - NO PITCH INCREASE
- Verse 2: Add Mellotron strings, VOCAL CONTINUES LOW BRUTAL WHISPER
- Chorus: VOCAL STAYS LOW - NO FALSETTO
- Bridge: Ambient textures, VOCAL LOW SPOKEN MELODY
- Chorus (x2): VOCAL LOW WHISPER ONLY
- Outro: Fade with VOCAL WHISPERING AT LOWEST POSSIBLE LEVEL

Tempo & Key:
- BPM: 74
- Key: D minor (for low vocal compatibility)
- Vocal Range Specification: C2 to F3 ONLY (extremely low male range)

Melody Specification:
- Chorus melody uses 3-4 notes within C2-D3 range
- Verse melody uses 2-3 notes within C2-B2 range
- NO MELODIC JUMPS ABOVE F3
- ALL NOTES IN LOWEST OCTAVE

Vocal Technique Details:
- Technique: Chest-driven whisper with vocal fry
- Style: Brutal low whisper - like confidential speaking in lowest register
- Delivery: Each word weighted, meditative, no vocal strain upward
- Microphone: Close-mic'ed to capture breath and low frequencies
- Performance: Imagine speaking secrets in lowest possible voice

Instrumentation:
- Vocal: MALE LOW BRUTAL WHISPER (repeating for emphasis)
- Guitar: Clean with spring reverb, gentle
- Bass: Warm, supports low vocal frequency
- Drums: Brushed, minimal
- Keys: Hammond B3, Mellotron

Production: Warm analog, emphasizes low frequencies
3f9344a1-3e0c-456e-80d7-692be6b9e518.lyrics:
[Verse 1: Low brutal whisper - C2 to B2 range only]
The mirror's cracked from side to side
A twin I cannot recognize
The shadow stretches on the wall
And answers when I do not call

[Chorus: Same low whisper - no pitch increase]
And the rain will wash the streets of sound
And the world will turn the other way around
And the ghosts we left beneath the ground
Are the only ones who know we're found

[Verse 2: Low brutal whisper - chest voice only]
The clockwork heart is winding down
A silent scream in every town
The radio plays static hymns
To drown the light along the limbs

[Chorus: Low whisper - stay in low register]
And the rain will wash the streets of sound
And the world will turn the other way around
And the ghosts we left beneath the ground
Are the only ones who know we're found

[Bridge: Low spoken - no melodic rise]
A flicker on the silver screen
The space between what is and seems
I taste the future on my tongue
It's hollow, and I am too young

[Chorus x2: Low brutal whisper throughout]
And the rain will wash the streets of sound
And the world will turn the other way around
And the ghosts we left beneath the ground
Are the only ones who know we're found

[Outro: Barely audible low whisper]
The only ones... who know...
The only ones... who know...

3c1fbb2a-dc91-4ca2-81df-55fafc80d581.name: Paper Boats
3c1fbb2a-dc91-4ca2-81df-55fafc80d581.lyrics:
[INTRO]
[tape hiss, room tone, distant rain]
[acoustic guitar: detuned, fingerpicked in open C, slightly out of tune, no effects]
[cello: single sustained note, no vibrato, recorded on cheap mic]
[no drums, no percussion]
[VERSE 1]
[male vocal: raw baritone, close-mic, breathy, slightly hoarse, no reverb]
[recorded on cassette, slight wow and flutter]
[voice cracks on “cold” — left in]
I fold my fears into paper boats,
set them loose in kitchen moats.
The sink’s an ocean, deep and cold…
but none come back. None ever told.
[PRE-CHORUS]
[vocals quieter, almost whispering]
[guitar pauses on last word]
The walls are watching.
They don’t blink.
They just… wait.
[CHORUS]
[vocals rise slightly, but no scream — only strained honesty]
[cello swells, dissonant harmonic]
I’M NOT ASLEEP—
I’M JUST AFRAID TO WAKE.
THE WORLD’S TOO LOUD
FOR MISTAKES.
SO I BUILD A FORT
OF SILENT SONGS…
AND PRAY THE NIGHT
LASTS ALL DAY LONG.
[VERSE 2]
[guitar returns, more dissonant chords]
[vocals fragile, breath audible between words]
My shadow’s tired. It wants to rest.
It says, “You’re doing your best…
but your best ain’t enough for them.”
So I hug the floor — and count the hem.
[OUTRO]
[guitar fades, only cello remains]
[last line, whispered, voice breaking:]
…paper boats don’t float.
[tape stops abruptly, silence]

8d81b674-f9b9-4120-a3d8-2266b99af5b7.name:
Neon Reveries
 (Variation)
8d81b674-f9b9-4120-a3d8-2266b99af5b7.sound: modern psychedelic, warm evolving synth pads, filtered wah guitar loops with glitch and delay effects, deep sub-bass, complex glitch percussion, electronic brushed snares, modulated organ drones with sidechain compression, layered harmonized male vocals with granular reverb and tape delay, vinyl crackle textures mixed with granular synthesis, lush spacious reverb and delay trails, tempo 95 BPM, mood: futuristic psychedelic, immersive and textured, blending vintage psych vibes with contemporary sound design and production techniques
8d81b674-f9b9-4120-a3d8-2266b99af5b7.lyrics:
[INTRO]
[warm synth pads with evolving textures and subtle granular effects — 95 BPM]
[deep textured male whisper with layered distortion and granular delay]
Whispers glow beneath neon skies...
[VERSE 1]
[filtered wah guitar loops with rhythmic glitch and delay]
Lights flicker on digital walls,
Echoes weave in holograms,
Time bends in layered streams,
Caught in neon-drenched dreams.
[PRE-CHORUS]
[modulated organ drones with dynamic sidechain and reverb automation]
Silent pulses, shifting tones,
Flowing through electric zones,
[CHORUS]
[deep sub-bass, intricate glitch percussion, electronic brushed snares]
Riding waves of neon light,
Feel the pulse through endless night.
[POST-CHORUS]
[multi-layered harmonized male vocals, heavily processed with granular reverb and tape delay]
Neon dreams,
Silent streams.
[OUTRO]
[vinyl crackle textures blended with modern granular synthesis fades]
[synth pads dissolve into lush reverb and delay trails]
Fading out...
Until new dawn...

a51da5d8-6584-4881-a2a0-2e8f67f3fca6.name: the spiiiral
a51da5d8-6584-4881-a2a0-2e8f67f3fca6.sound: Psychedelic electronic rock, deep gritty baritone vocals, funky bassline with syncopated groove, analog synth arpeggios, trippy guitar swells with reverse delay, drum machine blended with live snare and kick, dark yet warm atmospheric vibe, lyrics written as a letter from a man to a woman — to be read at sunset, tender but strong, patient, intimate, hopeful, 110 BPM, vintage 70s funk meets 90s alternative electronic, hazy tape-saturated production, male vocal only, no female lead, vocals delivered with rhythmic spoken-sung flow, no clean pop tones, no falsetto, voice must be low, raw, baritone, slightly smoky, like late-night radio confession with groove
a51da5d8-6584-4881-a2a0-2e8f67f3fca6.lyrics:
[Verse 1]
Wire… in my throat…
No name…
Road hums…
(whispered echo: “follow… follow…”)
Neon dusk…
(sub-bass pulse, tape flutter on “dusk”)
[Chorus]
Riiide… the spiiiral…
(cool, sustained vowel — low-pass filtered)
No light… no triiial…
(bass swells under “trial”)
Bass breathes… I sur-viiiive…
(backing vocal: “survive… survive…” — reversed, distant)
Not a trip…
It’s a liiifetime…
(harmonic drone rises, phaser slow sweep)
(lifetime… lifetime… echo decay x3)
[Verse 2]
Mirror… cracked…
Static tongue…
“Auto-maaatic…”
(backing whisper: “you’re wired… you’re wired…”)
Sky’s a wound…
(tape stop effect on “wound”)
[Chorus]
Riiide… the spiiiral…
(vocal slightly detuned, +3 cents)
No god… no guiiide…
(low-pass cutoff drops on “guide”)
Echoes pull… from insiiide…
(backing: “inside… inside…” — granular delay)
Not a trip…
It’s a liiifetime…
(forever… wired… sub-bass rumble)
[Outro]
Lifetime…
(instrumental fade: ebow swell + vinyl crackle)
In the hum…
(backing: “hum… hum… hum…” — pitch descending)
Spiral…
(neon synth arpeggio dissolves)
Never ends…
Just…
(pause — 2 sec silence)
Pretends…
(machine stops — tape hiss remains)

2d4caf07-edfd-4400-b0bd-abbd9e8552f1.name: Dissolve
2d4caf07-edfd-4400-b0bd-abbd9e8552f1.sound: Trip hop, ethereal female vocals, heavy bass guitar, jungle beats, reverb 808, ambient cello
2d4caf07-edfd-4400-b0bd-abbd9e8552f1.lyrics:
[Intro]
(Time dissolves...) [x4]
[Instrumental Verse 1]
[Cello and piano interlude]
[Pre-chorus 1]
Been waiting here since time began
Reaching through emptiness to find your hand
Every passing moment pulls me near
Your gravity keeps me in your sphere
[Chorus 1]
Time dissolves like morning mist
In this space between us
Time dissolves, I still persist
Till you finally see us
[Instrumental Verse 2]
[Cello and piano interlude]
[Pre-chorus 2]
Suspended in this endless dance
Caught between patience and chance
Each heartbeat marks the hours gone
Till daybreak turns to dawn
[Chorus 2]
Time dissolves like morning mist
In this space between us
Time dissolves, I still persist
Till you finally see us
[Bridge]
(Dissolving, dissolving)
Every breath draws you closer
(Dissolving, dissolving)
Every second shows me more
(Time dissolves...)
The waiting makes us stronger
(Time dissolves...)
Than we've ever been before
[Final Chorus]
Time dissolves like morning mist
In this space between us
Time dissolves, I still persist
Till you finally see us
(Time dissolves...) [x4]
[Outro]
(Dissolving into light...)
[Fade effects with layered vocals]

685812f2-03eb-4afd-b5b9-ac19c0133f52.name: Asynchronous
685812f2-03eb-4afd-b5b9-ac19c0133f52.sound: Alternative R&B, trip-hop beats, ethereal female vocals, heavy 808 bass, jungle rhythms
685812f2-03eb-4afd-b5b9-ac19c0133f52.lyrics:
[Intro - Whispered]
Waiting, waiting, always waiting
Different times, different spaces
(How many hours till I hear your voice?)
[Verse 1 - Instrumental with ambient vocals]
(Counting minutes, counting hours)
(Screen light fading, fading, fading)
[Phone notification sound]
[Pre-chorus 1]
I check my phone a hundred times today
The clock keeps spinning in opposite ways
Your sun rises while my stars appear
We're living life in different atmospheres
[Chorus]
When your morning meets my midnight
When your morning meets my midnight
I'm wide awake in different time
Missing you is my design
[Verse 2 - Korean]
다른 시간대에 살아가는 우리
내 아침은 너의 밤
기다림이 길어질수록
더욱 커지는 그리움
[Pre-chorus 2]
My coffee meets your evening tea
Living life asynchronously
Each moment slips through different hands
As distances shift like endless sands
[Chorus]
When your morning meets my midnight
When your morning meets my midnight
I'm wide awake in different time
Missing you is my design
[Rap Bridge]
Clock spinning round and round, no end in sight
Screen lighting up but the timing's never right
Twelve hours forward, twelve hours back
Living life on a separate track
Numbers on my wall tell different tales
Each timezone like a ship with different sails
But I'll keep waiting, that's what I do
Until your morning aligns with my midnight too
[Chorus - Final]
When your morning meets my midnight
When your morning meets my midnight
(Your morning, my midnight)
(Your morning, my midnight)
[Outro - Fading]
When your morning meets my midnight
(Waiting, waiting, always waiting)
When your morning meets...
(How many hours...?)
[Phone notification sound fades]

Dans le vide je respire
Le silence me répond
Le temps reste immobile
Tout devient écho
[Chorus]
L'echo de ma douleur
L'echo de ma douleur
L'echo de ma douleur
L'echo de ma douleur
[Solo]
[Instrumental]

baab07f7-887a-47a8-b85b-b6e8196bae49.name: Rewind
baab07f7-887a-47a8-b85b-b6e8196bae49.sound: Underground hip-hop, retro chillwave synths, lo-fi drums, dreamy atmosphere
baab07f7-887a-47a8-b85b-b6e8196bae49.lyrics:
[Intro]
Static crackles through the speakers tonight
Pixels dancing in black and white
I'm sitting here with these tapes in my hand
Time moves forward but I understand
[Verse 1]
Rewind, pause, there's your smile again
Summer '98, we were just kids then
Playing ball in the driveway sun
Before we knew what we'd become
Those grass stains on your favorite jeans
Mom yelling dinner through the screen
I catch myself reaching for the phone
But some things are better left alone
[Chorus]
Rewind the tape until the colors fade
Watching memories slip away, slip away
[Verse 2]
Fast forward through the empty space
Between the moments I can't erase
Birthday candles, graduation day
All those words we didn't say
Looking back through this tiny screen
Makes me question what it all means
Every laugh and every tear
Gets clearer and disappears
[Chorus]
Rewind the tape until the colors fade
Watching memories slip away, slip away
[Bridge]
The tracking's off, the picture shakes
But in between the static breaks
I see the truth we couldn't face
Some things time can't replace
[Verse 3]
The battery's dying, screen goes dim
Like photographs we never did print
Maybe that's all we really are
Just moments caught between the stars
I press play one final time
Let it run until the end of the line
[Chorus]
Rewind the tape until the colors fade
(Watching memories slip away, slip away)
Rewind the tape until the colors fade
(Watching memories slip away, slip away)

6435baa1-239a-4783-a589-15f213404d83.name: Static Communion (Glitch Rebuild)
6435baa1-239a-4783-a589-15f213404d83.sound: dual vocals: male whispered raw baritone with granular pitch modulation, female glitched high-pitched vocal processed with stutter reverse and time-stretch, deep sub-bass 808 pulses, industrial metallic percussion, no melodic instruments, tempo 90 BPM, keyless, 2025 experimental electronic production, heavy use of granular synthesis glitch effects and spatial panning, themes digital intimacy data ghosts urban alienation, structure intro verse verse chorus verse outro
6435baa1-239a-4783-a589-15f213404d83.lyrics:
[INTRO]
[sub-bass drop, vinyl crackle reversed, granular noise swell, heartbeat pulse]
[VERSE 1]
[whispered, close-mic, voice slightly pitch-shifted down, fragmented phrasing]
You speak in code I can’t decrypt,
your love’s a loop I can’t eject.
I trace your name in broken glass—
but the signal fades too fast.
(female voice: chopped, stuttered, high-pitched — “too fast… too fast…”, right channel)
[VERSE 2]
[voice processed through granular filter, bass intensifies]
Your touch is static on my skin,
a ghost that lives beneath the din.
I play our past on scratched-up reels—
but the truth distorts, conceals.
(female voice: time-stretched whisper — “conceals…”, left channel)
[CHORUS]
[vocals split: male raw whisper / female glitched falsetto, beat drops — heavy 808 + industrial snare]
STATIC COMMUNION—
NO PRAYER, JUST NOISE!
WE BLEED IN FREQUENCY,
NOT IN VOICE!
YOU’RE A GHOST IN THE MACHINE—
AND I’M THE STATIC THAT HOLDS YOU!
(bék-vocal: fragmented female voice — “holds you… holds you…”, panned erratically)
[VERSE 3]
[voice almost robotic, pitch modulated, sparse metallic percussion]
I built a shrine from your last text,
a temple where the signal’s vexed.
You’re gone, but your echo stays—
in every glitch, in every phase.
(female voice: reversed syllables — “eht yas… eht yas…”, center)
[OUTRO]
[beat dissolves into granular cloud, sub-bass fades, voice fragments into digital dust]
[whispered, disintegrating]
…static… communion…
[final data burst — silence]

2cda1128-c564-4d49-a766-5edafc12580c.name: mirror (Variation)
2cda1128-c564-4d49-a766-5edafc12580c.sound:
hypnotic psychedelic, brutal male baritone, spoken-sung flow, 70s,  
tape-saturated groove, liquid bass pulse,  
slow 66 bpm, no climax only immersion,  
cold sensuality, surreal repetition,  
analog warmth with digital shadow,  
minimal lyrics, maximum texture,  
echo vocals, low-pass drift,  
neon dusk, spiral journey,  
lifetime as ritual, not a trip
2cda1128-c564-4d49-a766-5edafc12580c.lyrics:
[Verse 1]
…wire…
(not a road… a frequency…)
…throat full of static…
(backing: distant radio tuning — “—lifet—… —ime—…”)
neon… drips…
(on “drips”: reverse cymbal swell + tape stop)
…no name… just hum…
(sub-bass enters — 32 Hz, felt not heard)
[Chorus — но не припев, а всплеск сознания]
spiral…
(long vowel — pitch bends down over 6 sec)
(not “ride”… just… spiral…)
(backing: “spiral… iral… al…” — granular delay, decaying)
colors… bleed into bass…
(no drums — only liquid synth pulse)
this…
(pause — 1.8 sec)
isn’t…
(pause — 1.2 sec)
a trip…
(backing whisper: “never was…”)
it’s…
(lifetime… lifetime… lifetime…)
— dissolving…
[Verse 2]
mirror… spoke…
(in a language of cracks…)
“you’re… already… gone…”
(backing: reversed vocal fragment — “nog… rehta… uoy…”)
sky… opened… like a wound…
(ebow swell — no attack, only sustain)
…i walked… through… my own echo…
(tape flutter intensifies on “echo”)
[Bridge — голос почти исчезает]
velvet… thunder…
(only phaser left — spinning slowly)
liquid… light…
(synth drone fades into white noise)
road… serpent… door…
(each word separated by 3–4 sec of silence + vinyl crackle)
i…
(am…
everywhere…
and…
nowhere…)
[Outro — голос растворяется в текстуре]
life…
(backing: “fiiii…” — stretched to 10 sec, low-pass filtered)
time…
(backing: “meeee…” — pitch descending into sub)
spiral…
(no word — just a rising harmonic from guitar feedback)
…
(5 sec of pure tape hiss, vinyl crackle, distant sub pulse)
…

f6b54286-2c9d-438c-88ec-ce4493b1d876.name: Mirage  (Variation)
f6b54286-2c9d-438c-88ec-ce4493b1d876.sound: Hypnotic 70s psychedelic, brutal male baritone, spoken-sung, 86 BPM, tape-saturated, liquid bass, no climax, cold sensuality, surreal lyrics, echo vocals, analog warmth, lifetime as ritual
f6b54286-2c9d-438c-88ec-ce4493b1d876.lyrics:
[Verse 1]
Sand in my breath…
time, not dust…
Footprints fade…
as I walk…
Oasis shimmers…
or is it just the sky… remembering water?
[Chorus]
Mirage…
not a lie… just light… delayed…
Thirst is the path…
and the path is the only water…
Life…
is the walk…
to a well…
that may… or may not… be…
[Verse 2]
Sun melts the horizon…
my shadow drinks my name…
Dunes rise and fall…
like slow breath…
I follow… the echo of my steps…
[Bridge]
Heat hums…
time drips… like oil on glass…
Oasis… ruin…
do they differ…
when the journey…
is the only truth?
[Outro]
Sand…
time…
mirage…
the walk…
is the water…
…
(soft wind, distant pulse, tape hiss)

ac201cc9-cb2a-4d4a-8956-e771b689ad71.name: Timeless Journey
ac201cc9-cb2a-4d4a-8956-e771b689ad71.sound: Trip-hop, fast jungle beats, mournful strings, smoky saxophone, urban ambience, vinyl crackle
ac201cc9-cb2a-4d4a-8956-e771b689ad71.lyrics:
[Verse 1]
Autumn painted leaves outside
Through streaked glass they fly
Another town rolls past my eyes
While I remain behind
The tracks keep moving forward
But time stands still in me
Looking at reflections
Of who I used to be
[Pre-chorus]
The world spins faster now
But I can't feel it turn
watching life pass by
So much left to learn
[Chorus]
Why do seasons change but I stay the same?
Why do seasons change but I stay the same?
(But I stay the same)
Why do seasons change but I stay the same?
(Always stay the same)
[Verse 2]
Rain against the window pane
Blurs everything I see
Miles of rust and fallen leaves
Remind me to breathe
The train keeps pushing onward
Through cities, towns, and plains
But in my mind I'm standing
Where everything remains
[Bridge]
[Spoken with soft saxophone]
Time moves like this train
Forward, never back
But my heart stays frozen
On these same old tracks
[Chorus]
Why do seasons change but I stay the same?
Why do seasons change but I stay the same?
(But I stay the same)
Why do seasons change but I stay the same?
(Always stay the same)
[Outro]
The world keeps turning
(Keeps turning)
While I remain
(I remain)
The world keeps turning
(Keeps turning)
While I... stay the same

RULES: NO male vocals, NO English, ONLY short vocal samples & phrases, NO verse lyrics, NO pre-chorus > 3 sec, DJ friendly: 16-bar intro and outro with clean groove for mixing, vocals used as rhythmic samples, chorus (hook) is catchy and extremely danceable, luxury positive club energy.

8e4eb53d-3a3c-4f1e-b9bf-8159910e22b1.sound: Bollywood trap lo-fi, ethereal female vocals, Hindi lyrics, dreamy 808s, angelic harmonies
8e4eb53d-3a3c-4f1e-b9bf-8159910e22b1.lyrics:

Samay beeta jaye
Tare mere sath
Main dekhti hoon
Aasman ki raah
[Verse 1 - Hindi]
Raat ki tanhai mein
Sitaron ke sang
Pal pal badalta hai
Mera har rang
Time ki taal pe
Main chalti jaaun
Chandni raat mein
Khud ko paaun
[Chorus]
Tare jaise waqt (waqt)
Behta jaye (jaye)
Tare jaise waqt (waqt)
Rukta nahi (ahhh-aaa)

Counting minutes like stars above
Time moves different when I'm alone
Watching patterns in the sky

a5b60a5d-14f8-4cc8-a5d5-4764e1a1606a.name: Farewell Tune
a5b60a5d-14f8-4cc8-a5d5-4764e1a1606a.sound: Lo-fi fusion, jazzy sax, orchestral cello, jungle beats, deep 808, vinyl atmosphere
a5b60a5d-14f8-4cc8-a5d5-4764e1a1606a.lyrics:
[Intro - 32 bars]
[Vinyl crackle, rain ambience]
[Cello and saxophone weaving melodies]
[808 bass enters]
[Urban atmosphere builds]
[Pre-chorus]
Through the window watching life dissolve
Every station feels like letting go
Time is dancing past in shades of blue
In the rhythm of this midnight view
[Chorus]
Why does tonight sound like goodbye?
(Like goodbye, like goodbye)
Why does tonight sound like goodbye?
(Sound like goodbye)
[Bridge]
Empty seats and fading lights
Signal changes, red to white
Moving forward, moving on
Till the feeling's almost gone
[Post-chorus]
Every note that fades away
Takes a memory with the train
(Takes it all away)
Every beat beneath these rails
Writes an ending to this tale
(To this tale)
[Instrumental break]
[Saxophone solo builds over 808]
[Cello and bass interweave]
[Rain intensifies]
[Pre-chorus]
Now the city plays its farewell song
As the night train carries me along
Every echo feels like letting go
Of the moments we can't hold
[Chorus]
Why does tonight sound like goodbye?
(Like goodbye, like goodbye)
Why does tonight sound like goodbye?
(Sound like goodbye)
[Outro]
[Saxophone and cello fade]
[Rain continues]
[808 pulses softer]
[Vinyl crackle dissolves]

7fc0172e-a3b5-4bf3-9091-e6e007e9ba03.name: Ritual of the Damp Letter (Variation)
7fc0172e-a3b5-4bf3-9091-e6e007e9ba03.sound: male baritone raw spoken-word whisper, English lyrics, 94 BPM, found sounds only (dripping water, match strike, paper unfold, floorboard creak, telephone coil breath), analog effects (tape saturation, extreme wow/flutter, vinyl crackle, tape echo with decay), 1970s psychedelic texture (dusty, lo-fi, mind-drifting), no reverb, no flanger, no phaser, no melody, cold sensuality, hypnotic groove, structure: intro-verse-prechorus-chorus-outro
7fc0172e-a3b5-4bf3-9091-e6e007e9ba03.lyrics:
[INTRO]
*(dripping faucet, slow tape start with flutter, match strike, paper unfolding)*
[VERSE]
I write to you every Tuesday at 3:17 a.m.—
not because you’ll read it,
but because the silence needs a shape.
My pen drags like a bruise across the page.
[PRE-CHORUS]
The ink runs when the ceiling leaks.
So do I.
[CHORUS]
This isn’t a letter. It’s a ritual.
Fold. Seal. Bury under floorboards.
Repeat until the walls start whispering back.
[OUTRO]
*(tape slows to stop, rain swells then cuts abruptly, final breath recorded through telephone coil)*

03fb4879-70bf-4be4-9db8-b19e8d899312.name: Between Worlds
03fb4879-70bf-4be4-9db8-b19e8d899312.sound: Gangsta rap, haunting cello melodies, heavy 808 bass, urban ambience, 90-110 BPM
03fb4879-70bf-4be4-9db8-b19e8d899312.lyrics:
[Verse 1]
Empty streets call my name
Can't leave these blocks behind
Pass right through the crowd
No one sees my kind
Through the sleeping town
Time stands still tonight
Watching from above
While the world runs blind
[Chorus]
Am I here or am I gone?
(Where do I belong?)
Between the dark and dawn
(Where do I belong?)
[Verse 2]
Cold wind passes by
No chill against my skin
Every face I see
Reminds me what I've been
Walking endless roads
No footsteps left behind
Trapped between two worlds
In this state of mind
[Chorus]
Am I here or am I gone?
(Where do I belong?)
Between the dark and dawn
(Where do I belong?)
[Cello Solo]
[Electronic bass intensifies]
[Bridge]
Can't touch, can't feel
Can't make them understand
Watching life go by
Like grains of falling sand
[Chorus]
Am I here or am I gone?
(Where do I belong?)
Between the dark and dawn
(Where do I belong?)
