5796581f-76d3-4cc3-9689-00420f4777b5.name: Northern Light (Variation)
5796581f-76d3-4cc3-9689-00420f4777b5.lyrics:
[Intro]
[Warm synth pad, vinyl crackle, distant bass guitar harmonics]
[Verse 1]
[Drum machine with deep kick, sparse snare with long reverb]
White nights don't end, just fade to blue (fade to blue)
This neon cross watches over me and you (me and you)
[Clean electric guitar with chorus enters]
I trace the patterns on the frosted glass
Waiting for this lonely hour to pass...
[Pre-Chorus]
[Bassline becomes more active, synth strings swell]
And the city breathes with a thousand lights
(thousand lights...)
[Chorus]
[Full arrangement, driving bass, powerful drums]
I'm not asking for forever, just for tonight
Hold me close in this northern light
[Wah-wah guitar fills]
Under this sky so pale and bright
We'll forget everything till morning's light...
[Verse 2]
[Band pulls back to verse arrangement]
The elevator shaft sings its metal song (metal song)
We've been standing here, knowing right from wrong
[Bass becomes more melodic]
Your hand feels warm in this chilly air
Like a promise that you'll always care...
[Pre-Chorus]
[Bassline intensifies, drums build]
And the city breathes with a thousand lights
(thousand lights...)
[Chorus]
[Full band returns with energy]
I'm not asking for forever, just for tonight
Hold me close in this northern light
[Wah-wah guitar accents]
Under this sky so pale and bright
We'll forget everything till morning's light...
[Bridge]
[Band drops to bass and drums only, vocals become more intimate]
The clock on the wall has stopped at three
Just you here, alone with me...
[Synth strings gradually return]
All the words we left unsaid
Are dancing in my head...
[Guitar Solo]
[Melodic, emotional solo over chorus changes, light distortion with delay]
[Final Chorus]
[Full band, passionate vocals with strong backing harmonies]
I'm not asking for forever, just for TONIGHT!
Hold me close in this NORTHERN LIGHT!
[Powerful drum fills]
Under this sky so pale and bright!
We'll forget everything till morning's light!
[Outro]
[Elements drop out one by one - drums first, then guitar]
Only bass, synth pad and vocal harmonies remain
(fade to blue... northern light...)
Fade out with vinyl crackle

14837a5b-42d8-40fd-8f7b-7c228bdde74f.name: Lullabies
14837a5b-42d8-40fd-8f7b-7c228bdde74f.sound: Trip-hop, melancholic double bass, 808s, smoky jazz, urban rain atmosphere
14837a5b-42d8-40fd-8f7b-7c228bdde74f.lyrics:
[Verse 1]
Morning scattered across your favorite keys
As you play the same old melodies
The hours drift away like smoke rings in the air
I watch you lost in thought without a care
Your fingers dance, creating worlds so rare
While time stands still in this morning prayer
(Mmm, morning prayer)
[Chorus]
Morning light bleeds through these tired eyes
Watching you create your sweet lullabies
(Sweet lullabies)
[Verse 2]
Remember when we'd practice until dawn
Every note a promise of what could be drawn
From weathered strings and brass so pure
You said the morning held the perfect cure
For restless souls and broken times
Now I see truth in those midnight rhymes
(Those midnight rhymes)
[Chorus]
Morning light bleeds through these tired eyes
Watching you create your sweet lullabies
(Sweet lullabies)
[Bridge]
[Spoken over stripped bass]
Between the raindrops and the sunrise
Between the last note and first light
Your music speaks what words can't say
In this quiet space we find our way
[Instrumental Break]
[Saxophone and cello interlude]
(La-da-da, mmm, oh)
[Chorus - Final]
Morning light bleeds through these tired eyes
Watching you create your sweet lullabies
(These sweet lullabies)
(Oh, these sweet lullabies)
[Outro]
The rain keeps time against the windowpane
As your melody drifts into morning's reign
(Morning's reign)
(Oh, morning's reign)

f208b68c-8b42-4e26-b970-aafe677465bb.name: Midnight Reverie (Modern Psychedelic Reimagining)
f208b68c-8b42-4e26-b970-aafe677465bb.sound: modern psychedelic, ambient evolving synth pads, processed deep male vocal whisper with granular delay and distortion, filtered wah guitar samples with glitch effects, deep sub-bass, intricate electronic percussion, modulated organ drones with sidechain compression, multi-layered harmonized male vocals with granular reverb and tape delay effects, vinyl crackle textures blended with granular synthesis, lush spacious reverb and delay trails, tempo 95 BPM, mood: futuristic psychedelic, immersive, textured, nocturnal, blending vintage vibes with cutting-edge sound design and production techniques
f208b68c-8b42-4e26-b970-aafe677465bb.lyrics:
[INTRO]
[ambient synth pads with evolving textures — 95 BPM]
[deep processed male whisper with layered distortion and granular delay]
Whispers intertwine with neon dreams...
[VERSE 1]
[filtered wah guitar samples with rhythmic glitching]
Shadows pulse on shifting walls,
Echoes weave digital calls,
Time bends in textured streams,
Wrapped in synthetic vinyl dreams.
[PRE-CHORUS]
[modulated organ drones with subtle sidechain and reverb automation]
Silent beats and drifting tones,
Underneath synthetic moans,
[CHORUS]
[deep sub-bass, complex glitch percussion, electronic brushed snares]
Flowing through electric night,
Feel the pulse, vibrant light.
[POST-CHORUS]
[multi-layered harmonized male vocals, heavily effected with granular reverb and tape delay]
Reverie,
Fading free.
[OUTRO]
[vinyl crackle textures mixed with modern granular synthesis fades]
[synth layers dissolve into lush reverb and delay trails]
Until dawn breaks...
[digital record scratch, reversing sample fades]

3f0d7793-bd40-45fb-80f4-1cfd403a0f08.name: Static Hymn (Variation)
3f0d7793-bd40-45fb-80f4-1cfd403a0f08.sound: Male baritone only — whispered verses, raw full-voice choruses with natural rasp. Backing vocals: two male voices in low harmonies (minor thirds), drenched in analog tape echo. Instruments: hypnotic overdriven bassline (C minor, repetitive), Fender Rhodes (melodic motifs, heavy tape echo), Vox organ (drones only, no vibrato), dry toms (quarter notes), light wooden percussion. Tempo: 98 BPM. No strings, no wah-wah, no drum kit, no reverb, no digital effects. Only analog tape saturation, light wow/flutter, vinyl crackle. Mood: ritualistic, nocturnal, emotionally raw. Style: 1975 Los Angeles underground — psychedelic soul stripped to its bones: voice, bass, echo, and rain. Catchy chorus built on repetition and emotional weight, not melody alone.
3f0d7793-bd40-45fb-80f4-1cfd403a0f08.lyrics:
[INTRO]
[hypnotic bassline enters — C minor, repetitive, slightly overdriven]
[Fender Rhodes: three-note motif, drenched in single-repeat tape echo]
[Vox organ: low drone, no chords]
[toms play quarter notes — dry, close]
[MAN — whispered, rhythmic]
…again…
[VERSE 1]
[whispered, tight to bass groove]
I burned your last letter
in a coffee can on the fire escape—
watched the ash rise
like black snow.
The wind took your name
and spelled it on my window…
I didn’t wipe it off.
[PRE-CHORUS]
[organ swells slightly, Rhodes echoes vocal phrase]
The streetlights hum
your lullaby…
[CHORUS]
[full baritone — raw, chesty, emotionally strained]
This is my hymn:
ash, rain, and the shape of your voice
in the static between seconds.
I don’t pray—
I pulse.
And the night pulses back.
[VERSE 2]
[whisper returns, bass walks down chromatically]
I wear your silence
like a coat with no buttons—
it flaps open
in every hallway.
The neighbors nod
like they know you’re gone…
but their eyes say *“still here.”*
[PRE-CHORUS]
[Rhodes plays dissonant cluster — G over C minor]
The clock’s got feathers.
Time’s bleeding.
[CHORUS]
[full baritone, more intense, harmonies enter — two male voices, low thirds]
This is my hymn:
ash, rain, and the shape of your voice
in the static between seconds.
I don’t pray—
I pulse.
And the night pulses back.
[BRIDGE – TRANCE]
[instruments lock into loop — bass + toms + organ drone]
[lead vocal: half-chanted, drenched in tape echo]
…pulse…
…static…
…hymn…
[backing vocals: wordless “ahh-ehh” — panned, decaying]
[FINAL CHORUS]
[full intensity — Rhodes soars with simple melodic phrase, no virtuosity]
[lead vocal: almost shouting, but controlled]
This is my hymn:
ash, rain, and the shape of your voice
in the static between seconds.
I don’t pray—
I pulse.
And the night…
pulses…
back…
[OUTRO]
[instruments fade — bass last to go]
[tape echo repeats “back…” three times]
[rain begins softly]
[tape stop click]

0ecaa7af-b7b7-4ca8-97a2-c168ca119864.sound:
hypnotic psychedelic, brutal male baritone, spoken-sung flow, 70s,
tape-saturated groove, liquid bass pulse,
slow 98 bpm, no climax only immersion,
cold sensuality, surreal repetition,
analog warmth with digital shadow,
minimal lyrics, maximum texture,
echo vocals, low-pass drift,
neon dusk, spiral journey,
lifetime ,  trip
0ecaa7af-b7b7-4ca8-97a2-c168ca119864.lyrics:
[Verse 1]
The mirror's cracked from side to side
A twin I cannot recognize
The shadow stretches on the wall
And answers when I do not call

[Chorus]
And the rain will wash the streets of sound
And the world will turn the other way around
And the ghosts we left beneath the ground
Are the only ones who know we're found

[Verse 2]
The clockwork heart is winding down
A silent scream in every town
The radio plays static hymns
To drown the light along the limbs

[Chorus]
And the rain will wash the streets of sound
And the world will turn the other way around
And the ghosts we left beneath the ground
Are the only ones who know we're found

[Bridge]
A flicker on the silver screen
The space between what is and seems
I taste the future on my tongue
It's hollow, and I am too young

[Chorus]
And the rain will wash the streets of sound
And the world will turn the other way around
And the ghosts we left beneath the ground
Are the only ones who know we're found

[Chorus]
And the rain will wash the streets of sound
And the world will turn the other way around
And the ghosts we left beneath the ground
Are the only ones who know we're found

[Outro]
The only ones... who know...
The only ones... who know...

f5083338-782e-459a-866f-fa57c6a18240.name: Mirage
f5083338-782e-459a-866f-fa57c6a18240.sound: Hypnotic 70s psychedelic, brutal male baritone, spoken-sung, 86 BPM, tape-saturated, liquid bass, no climax, cold sensuality, surreal lyrics, echo vocals, analog warmth, lifetime as ritual
f5083338-782e-459a-866f-fa57c6a18240.lyrics:
[Verse 1]
Sand in my breath…
time, not dust…
Footprints fade…
as I walk…
Oasis shimmers…
or is it just the sky… remembering water?
[Chorus]
Mirage…
not a lie… just light… delayed…
Thirst is the path…
and the path is the only water…
Life…
is the walk…
to a well…
that may… or may not… be…
[Verse 2]
Sun melts the horizon…
my shadow drinks my name…
Dunes rise and fall…
like slow breath…
I follow… the echo of my steps…
[Bridge]
Heat hums…
time drips… like oil on glass…
Oasis… ruin…
do they differ…
when the journey…
is the only truth?
[Outro]
Sand…
time…
mirage…
the walk…
is the water…
…
(soft wind, distant pulse, tape hiss)

827ddb40-b6c4-458c-ab5d-7cb791cb7e12.name: Caught Between
827ddb40-b6c4-458c-ab5d-7cb791cb7e12.sound: Cinematic jungle, melancholic strings, lo-fi jazz, ambient urban textures, 160-170 BPM
827ddb40-b6c4-458c-ab5d-7cb791cb7e12.lyrics:
[Intro]
[Rain and distant traffic sounds]
[Soft strings fade in]
[Verse 1]
Morning comes too fast these days
While I'm still processing yesterday
You left without a trace
Now time keeps pushing me away
Through crowded streets I race
But my feet move in slow motion
Like I'm caught between two worlds
One that stops, one that spins in endless motion
[Pre-chorus]
The city wakes around me
(While I'm frozen here inside)
The rhythm pulls me forward
But my heart just wants to hide
[Chorus]
Time won't slow down for my heavy heart
Time won't slow down, we're still worlds apart
Racing against myself, trying to break free
But time won't slow down, no not for me
[Verse 2]
Rain falls on empty sidewalks
Each drop marks another breath
I chase the morning light
But memories won't rest
The world spins faster now
While I'm caught in slow decay
Between the urgent and the aching
Between the blue and shades of grey
[Pre-chorus]
The city wakes around me
(While I'm frozen here inside)
The rhythm pulls me forward
But my heart just wants to hide
[Bridge]
[Saxophone solo builds]
Let me catch my breath
Let me find my way
Just one moment please
Before another day
[Strings swell]
[Chorus]
Time won't slow down for my heavy heart
Time won't slow down, we're still worlds apart
Racing against myself, trying to break free
But time won't slow down, no not for me
(Time won't slow down, no not for me)

ce4a3817-868a-49fb-9bc7-f262a25f04d9.name: Rewind (Black Hole Sun Style)
ce4a3817-868a-49fb-9bc7-f262a25f04d9.sound: Psychedelic alternative rock at 72 BPM — warped, dreamlike guitar textures drenched in flanger and cavernous reverb, slow, loose tribal drumming with brushed snare and distant tom rolls, deep, gravelly male vocals (low, breathy, slightly detached, as if heard through a fading analog signal) whispering poetic English lyrics over layers of analog tape hiss, distant radio interference, and haunting, echoing harmonies (ohhh... slipping...), with no traditional chorus — only swelling, collapsing waves of sound that feel like memories dissolving into static, ending in 5 seconds of a single sustained guitar note decaying into vinyl crackle and a fading dial tone.
ce4a3817-868a-49fb-9bc7-f262a25f04d9.lyrics:
[Intro]
Static crackles through the speakers tonight
Pixels dancing in black and white
I'm sitting here with these tapes in my hand
Time moves forward but I understand
[warped guitar swell: 2s] [tape hiss: 1.5s] [distant radio station fade-in: 0.8s]
[Verse 1]
Rewind, pause, there's your smile again
Summer '98, we were just kids then
Playing ball in the driveway sun
Before we knew what we'd become
Those grass stains on your favorite jeans
Mom yelling dinner through the screen
I catch myself reaching for the phone
But some things are better left alone
[whispered:] (*remember?*)
[guitar feedback swirl: 1.2s] [subtle reverse cymbal: 0.5s]
[Chorus]
Rewind the tape until the colors fade
Watching memories slip away, slip away
Flicker soft like candlelight on glass
The quietest things outlast the past
(ohhh... slipping...) (*away... away...*)
[warped vocal layer: 3x pitch-shifted echo] [guitar swells like liquid light] [tape speed wobble: 0.7s]
[Verse 2]
Fast forward through the empty space
Between the moments I can't erase
Birthday candles, graduation day
All those words we didn't say
Looking back through this tiny screen
Makes me question what it all means
Every laugh and every tear
Gets clearer and disappears
[whispered:] (*you were here*)
[flanged guitar arpeggio: 1.5s] [vinyl crackle rises under voice]
[Chorus]
Rewind the tape until the colors fade
Watching memories slip away, slip away
Flicker soft like candlelight on glass
The quietest things outlast the past
(ohhh... slipping...) (*away... away...*)
[warped vocal layer: 3x pitch-shifted echo] [guitar swells like liquid light] [tape speed wobble: 0.7s]
[Bridge]
The tracking's off, the picture shakes
But in between the static breaks
I see the truth we couldn't face
Some things time can't replace
[whispered:] (*we didn’t say goodbye...*)
[guitar feedback rises like a storm] [radio station cuts out abruptly] [silence: 0.5s] [then — one note, sustained, trembling]
[Verse 3]
The battery's dying, screen goes dim
Like photographs we never did print
Maybe that's all we really are
Just moments caught between the stars
I press play one final time
Let it run until the end of the line
[whispered:] (*thank you*)
[guitar bends downward like a sigh] [tape stop: 0.6s] [sub-bass hum begins to fade]
[Chorus]
Rewind the tape until the colors fade
Watching memories slip away, slip away
Flicker soft like candlelight on glass
The quietest things outlast the past
(ohhh... slipping...) (*away... away...*)
[all elements dissolve into one long, warped guitar note] [vinyl crackle grows louder] [distant dial tone emerges] [final 5s: note fades into silence, then one last crackle — like a file being permanently deleted]

737c51f0-c886-4e8c-b6bb-0afb9c0b32eb.sound: Electronic orchestral, deep 808 bass, haunting cello melodies, whispered atmospheric vocals, 80 BPM
737c51f0-c886-4e8c-b6bb-0afb9c0b32eb.lyrics:
[Verse 1]
I can feel it in my bones
The way the sound moves through me
Like a wave that's taking hold
Something deep is breaking free
In this empty space tonight
I'm becoming something new
[Pre-chorus]
The bass is calling out your name
And I'm falling into truth
[Chorus]
I feel the vibrations pulling me under
Breaking apart everything I thought I knew
[Verse 2]
Every note you play for me
Shakes the walls I built inside
Through the dark I start to see
All the pain I tried to hide
Now the music's in my blood
And I can't resist the pull
[Pre-chorus]
These frequencies we share tonight
Make my empty spaces full
[Chorus]
I feel the vibrations pulling me under
Breaking apart everything I thought I knew
[Bridge]
[Cello Solo]
(Ahhh, ohhh...)
Let it take me
Let it change me
Let it make me
Let it save me
[Chorus]
I feel the vibrations pulling me under
Breaking apart everything I thought I knew
[Outro]
The sound is fading
But I'm still changing
(Ahhh...)

ddbb8291-85d8-4c93-b199-d871a204e0d1.name: Winter Prison ( Зимний плен )
ddbb8291-85d8-4c93-b199-d871a204e0d1.sound: Romantic orchestral ballad, dramatic theatrical soundtrack style, Russian folk influence, female vocals, guitar solo, bass guitar, Acoustic guitar strums, Orchestral strings, Acoustic harmonies,
ddbb8291-85d8-4c93-b199-d871a204e0d1.lyrics:
[Куплет 1]
Смотрю в окно сквозь иней на стекле
Время замерло в холодной тишине
В пустоте застывшей ничего не растёт
Ветви голые качает ветер, что метёт
[Пред-припев]
Когда ты был со мною
Мир полон был тепла
Теперь же я с тоскою
В белой мгле одна
[Припев]
Каждый день без тебя словно зимний плен
Каждый день без тебя словно зимний плен
Сердце - озеро во льду, озеро во льду
Жду, когда вернёшься, жду, когда вернёшься
[Пост-припев]
(Зима, зима, бесконечная зима)
(Пока ты не вернёшься ко мне)
[Куплет 2]
Память о тепле как утренний туман
Каждый нежный миг теперь как обман
В этой стуже время будто не идёт
Жду оттепель, что всё не настаёт
[Пред-припев]
И лёд вокруг всё крепче
День ото дня растёт
И солнце не излечит
Пока любовь не придёт
[Припев]
Каждый день без тебя словно зимний плен
Каждый день без тебя словно зимний плен
Сердце - озеро во льду, озеро во льду
Жду, когда вернёшься, жду, когда вернёшься
[Соло]
[Инструментальная часть с русской народной мелодией]
[Мост]
Я жду, сменяются сезоны
Сквозь вьюгу и мороз
И пусть проходят годы
Храню любви вопрос
[Финальный припев]
Каждый день без тебя словно зимний плен
Каждый день без тебя словно зимний плен
Сердце - озеро во льду, озеро во льду
Жду, когда вернёшься, жду, когда вернёшься
[Outro]
(Зима, зима)
Жду, когда вернёшься...
(Бесконечная зима)
Жду, когда вернёшься ко мне...

ビロードの夜に踊る

Toques de veludo, silêncio no ar

Susurros suaves, piel de cristal

指先で時を感じて

Coleção privada, entre sombras

6bc88b26-d2fc-47ff-b17e-8fc212cfd72f.name: Urban Rain
6bc88b26-d2fc-47ff-b17e-8fc212cfd72f.sound: Trip-hop instrumental, dark jazz saxophone, deep 808 bass, urban ambience, rain

c235f41e-aae0-442d-af9e-826fd40ac1e6.name: Empty Paradise
c235f41e-aae0-442d-af9e-826fd40ac1e6.sound: 1920s swing jazz, fast tempo 180 BPM, elegant French-influenced female vocals, muted trumpet
c235f41e-aae0-442d-af9e-826fd40ac1e6.lyrics:
[Verse 1]
Morning came today
Everything's in place
Just like I planned it
(Just like I planned)
But something's strange
Can't put it in words
[Pre-chorus]
All these crystal glasses
Empty in the light
Everything I wanted
Feels so far from right
[Chorus]
Paradise doesn't heal like I thought
(Doesn't heal, no it don't)
Paradise doesn't feel like I sought
(Like I sought, oh no)
[La-di-da, dee-da-dum]
[Verse 2]
Counting every win
Tables filled with friends
But tears keep falling
(Keep falling down)
What's missing here?
Can't make myself smile
[Pre-chorus]
All these fancy places
Dancing through the night
Everything I chased for
Somehow lost its light
[Chorus]
Paradise doesn't heal like I thought
(Doesn't heal, no it don't)
Paradise doesn't feel like I sought
(Like I sought, oh no)
[La-di-da, dee-da-dum]
[Bridge]
In the quiet now
Truth comes clear at last
All that I achieved
Just leaves me so alone
(So alone)
[Final Chorus]
Paradise doesn't heal like I thought
(Doesn't heal, no it don't)
Paradise doesn't feel like I sought
(Like I sought, oh no)
[La-di-da, dee-da-dum]

64560ce3-45df-449c-8261-3d7ea7646bad.name: Paper Ghosts in the Rain (Variation)
64560ce3-45df-449c-8261-3d7ea7646bad.sound: male baritone raw spoken-word whisper, English lyrics, 97 BPM, found sounds only (rain, paper rustle, heartbeat, tape stop, vinyl crackle), analog effects (tape saturation, heavy wow/flutter, vinyl crackle, tape echo, low-pass filter sweep), 1970s psychedelic texture, no reverb, no flanger, no phaser, no melody, cold sensuality, hypnotic groove, structure: intro-verse-prechorus-chorus-outro
64560ce3-45df-449c-8261-3d7ea7646bad.lyrics:
[INTRO]
*(slow rain, vinyl crackle, tape rewinding, distant paper tear)*
[VERSE]
I keep your words in a shoebox under the bed—
ink bleeding through paper like a slow confession.
Every night, I read them aloud to the walls.
They never answer. Just the drip… drip… drip…
[PRE-CHORUS]
Your name tastes like wet concrete.
I whisper it like a ritual I forgot the meaning of.
[CHORUS]
Paper ghosts don’t bleed, they just fade.
And I’m folding myself into envelopes again.
Silence is the only reply I deserve.
[OUTRO]
*(heartbeat dissolves into rain, tape slows with heavy wow/flutter, low-pass filtered breath)*

5cc28e61-ecb1-476c-acbb-b57068bd7eb4.name: Игра теней (Ты здесь... ты здесь...)
5cc28e61-ecb1-476c-acbb-b57068bd7eb4.sound: Create a cinematic Russian hip-hop track with a French chic twist, blending deep 808 basslines and live rhythm elements for a noir-inspired soundscape. Use crisp hi-hats, sharp snares, and hard-hitting kicks to create a driving beat. Add dark atmospheric synths with a soft enchanting glow, evoking the luxurious ambiance of a Parisian night. Include haunting female vocals exclusively in Russian , with lyrics strictly in Russian only (no other languages or phrases allowed). The lyrics should convey themes of 'Heavy Luxe,' seduction, and mystery, with dynamic delivery soaked in reverb. Incorporate subtle rain sounds, vinyl crackle, and distant echoes to enhance the noir vibe. Add glitch effects, pitch-shifting, and vocal chops for a modern touch. Ensure the melody flows like silk, elegant and languid, echoing the feeling of a lavish boudoir under the sound of rain. Follow this structure:Intro : Soft rain sounds, vinyl crackle, and deep 808 bass rumbles with whispered vocals.Verse 1 : Female vocals enter with crisp hi-hats and snare rolls; add reverb-heavy synths.Pre-Chorus : Build-up with rising synth arpeggios and layered vocal harmonies.Chorus : Powerful drop with hard-hitting kicks, 808 bass, and shimmering synths; vocals soar dynamically.Bridge : Breakdown with glitch effects, pitch-shifted vocals, and rain sounds; create an intimate moment.Final Chorus : Repeat the chorus with added intensity; include vocal chops and distorted bass wobbles.Outro : Fade out with soft rain, distant echoes, and lingering synths.Tempo: 85–100 BPM, with a steady yet hypnotic groove.
5cc28e61-ecb1-476c-acbb-b57068bd7eb4.lyrics:
[Intro]
[Rain sounds, vinyl crackle, deep 808]
(Ты здесь... ты здесь...)
[Verse 1]
В этом клубе дым густой
За спиной твой взгляд пустой
Танцуешь близко, но не рядом
Каждый шаг твой - новый яд мне
Знаю все твои пути
Но не могу тебя найти
Между нами только дождь
Правду от меня не скроешь
[Pre-chorus]
Вижу след твоих шагов
В ритме старых джаз-основ
Ближе, ближе подходи
(Не беги, не беги)
[Chorus]
Тень твоя за мной идёт
Тень моя тебя найдёт
В танце этом до утра
Мы с тобой как два огня
(Тень твоя, тень моя)
[Verse 2]
В каплях дождя твой силуэт
Растворяется как дым
Ты думаешь, что я не знаю
Все твои ходы храним
Красной помады яркий след
На бокале пустоты
Играешь роль, но я читаю
Все страницы этой игры
[Bridge]
[Glitch effects, pitch-shifted]
Между строк
В тишине
Слышу пульс
Ты во мне
(Где ты? Где ты?)
[Chorus]
Тень твоя за мной идёт
Тень моя тебя найдёт
В танце этом до утра
Мы с тобой как два огня
(Тень твоя, тень моя)
[Outro]
[Rain fading, distant echoes]
В дожде растаем без следа
Тень и свет, игра без дна

e0fe3e56-223e-46c1-aae3-8b7e7a929b9b.name: Рассвет в саду
e0fe3e56-223e-46c1-aae3-8b7e7a929b9b.sound: Theatrical jazz-pop, orchestral swells, Russian romantic cinema style, brass accents
e0fe3e56-223e-46c1-aae3-8b7e7a929b9b.lyrics:
[Verse]
Ранней ранью, тишина в саду,
Роса на ладонях, как будто жду,
Я прячу улыбку в простой траве,
В каждом шаге тайна на языке.
[Verse]
Листья лениво лижут ветра след,
Юность задержалась — оставив свет.
Сквозь арку старую входит рассвет,
И сердце слушает свой секрет.
[Pre-chorus]
По дорожке смелой, босиком бегу,
В малиновом свете — всё могу.
[Chorus]
В лучах рассвета мне весь мир открыт,
Мечта и тревога — в каждом миге жить.
Дружбы и надежды, озорной мотив,
Смех и сожаленья — собираю в стих.
[Bridge]
Скоро всё изменится, но пока
В этот сад вернусь, где слова легки,
Солнечным узором по руке скользит
Ветер приключений, что ведёт вперёд.
[Chorus]
В лучах рассвета — и судьбу найти,
Маленькая правда среди красоты.

7421a009-5be9-4a43-a307-1a7bbbced315.name: and called it life v2
7421a009-5be9-4a43-a307-1a7bbbced315.lyrics:
[VERSE]
[whispered, dry, close-mic — voice like gravel in a throat that hasn’t spoken in years]
you know…
[low-pass filter opens — 100Hz → 300Hz, 2s — as if the air itself is forgetting how to carry sound]
how rain smells…
[bit-crusher engages — 12-bit, 11kHz — the sound of a memory corrupted by time]
not like earth…
not like water…
but like the inside of a closed window…
after the last person left…
on glass…
[tape stop effect — 0.5s slowdown + pitch drop — like the moment before the power dies]
after midnight…
when the streetlights forget their names…
and the cars drive past like ghosts who don’t remember where they’re going…
[CHORUS]
[guitar and bass lock into tight groove — 92 BPM, mechanical, unyielding]
[vocal enters — 2 beats late, breath ragged, chest-heavy — deep, distorted, throat-splitting baritone, full vocal fry, no control, as if each word is pulled from bone]
i don’t want to be…
[distortion fades in — tube saturation, 5% — not warmth. the sound of a lung that learned to breathe static]
part of…
[drum machine cuts out — only bass remains, pulsing like a heart refusing to stop]
this city…
that taught me silence…
and called it peace…
that gave me screens…
and called it connection…
that fed me noise…
and called it life…
[OUTRO]
[music fades — only bass loop + distant city ambience, rain now heavy, steady, like a heartbeat without a body]
[vocal now processed through old phone filter — 300Hz–3.4kHz bandpass — as if speaking through a crack in the wall of a room that no longer exists]
can you hear…
[glitch: 17ms sample hold — repeats “breathe” as stutter — a digital echo of a breath that should’ve been the last]
how i…
[reverse reverb swells — 1.2s, then cuts abruptly — like the moment the machine decides you’re no longer needed]
breathe…?
[long pause — 3.7s — rain continues, slow, patient]
…
[one final whisper, barely audible, as if the voice is now coming from the walls]
…
i’m still here.

f6ac4c17-9313-409d-85a4-c5b0e34aac59.name: and called it life v2
f6ac4c17-9313-409d-85a4-c5b0e34aac59.lyrics:

a6ca534a-1b9b-408b-9484-01d9ec118786.name: Paper Ghosts in the Rain (Variation)
a6ca534a-1b9b-408b-9484-01d9ec118786.sound: male baritone raw spoken-word whisper, English lyrics, 97 BPM, found sounds only (rain, paper rustle, heartbeat, tape stop, vinyl crackle), analog effects (tape saturation, heavy wow/flutter, vinyl crackle, tape echo, low-pass filter sweep), 1970s psychedelic texture, no reverb, no flanger, no phaser, no melody, cold sensuality, hypnotic groove, structure: intro-verse-prechorus-chorus-outro
a6ca534a-1b9b-408b-9484-01d9ec118786.lyrics:
[INTRO]
*(slow rain, vinyl crackle, tape rewinding, distant paper tear)*
[VERSE]
I keep your words in a shoebox under the bed—
ink bleeding through paper like a slow confession.
Every night, I read them aloud to the walls.
They never answer. Just the drip… drip… drip…
[PRE-CHORUS]
Your name tastes like wet concrete.
I whisper it like a ritual I forgot the meaning of.
[CHORUS]
Paper ghosts don’t bleed, they just fade.
And I’m folding myself into envelopes again.
Silence is the only reply I deserve.
[OUTRO]
*(heartbeat dissolves into rain, tape slows with heavy wow/flutter, low-pass filtered breath)*

d8f68bf0-51c8-4948-9773-ce3fe57eebc2.name: Envelope Dust
d8f68bf0-51c8-4948-9773-ce3fe57eebc2.sound: Male baritone only—whispered verses, dry spoken-word choruses, intimate and raw. Rhythm driven by paper sounds: unfolding, folding, gentle tearing, drawer creaks. No instruments, no reverb, no digital effects. Only analog tape saturation, subtle wow/flutter, and light vinyl surface noise. Tempo: 74 BPM. Mood: introspective, ritualistic, tender solitude. Style: 1975 Los Angeles late-night apartment session, voice as confessional, paper as percussion and sacred object.
d8f68bf0-51c8-4948-9773-ce3fe57eebc2.lyrics:
[INTRO]
[paper unfolds slowly — crisp, dry sound]
[whispered, barely audible]
…again…
[VERSE 1]
[whispered, synced to paper rustle]
I keep your letter in the left drawer—
third from the top, under rubber bands
that lost their stretch in ’73.
The ink’s faded to ghost-blue,
but I still hear your voice
in the creases.
[PRE-CHORUS]
[paper folds sharply — once, twice]
I never sealed it.
Never stamped it.
Just kept it breathing
in my pocket.
[CHORUS]
[spoken-word, low baritone, dry and close]
This envelope holds nothing but dust—
and the shape of a sentence I never said.
I read it like scripture.
I fold it like prayer.
[VERSE 2]
[whisper returns, closer, with lip sounds]
Sometimes I swear the paper smells
like your hair after rain.
Or is that just the damp
from the window left open?
I don’t check.
I don’t want to know.
[PRE-CHORUS]
[paper unfolds again — slower this time]
The words are gone.
But the rhythm remains.
[CHORUS]
[spoken-word, same tone, slight tape wobble]
This envelope holds nothing but dust—
and the shape of a sentence I never said.
I read it like scripture.
I fold it like prayer.
[POST-CHORUS]
[layered whispers, paper rustling in background]
Dust…
Shape…
Fold…
[soft tearing sound — then stops abruptly]
[OUTRO]
[paper placed gently back in drawer]
[drawer closes with soft thud]
[final whisper]
…tomorrow again…
[5 seconds of distant rain, then tape stop click]

e361a2b2-7a00-471a-907d-beeb6d01abf3.name: Midnight Echo
e361a2b2-7a00-471a-907d-beeb6d01abf3.lyrics:
[Prelude]
[F#m7, Steinway Spirio, una corda always]
A step — just leather and carpet
Pressed lift — numbers hush and wait
Room beyond the mirror’s line
Glass in hand — cold, barely weight
(double bass resonance, ultra-quiet) (В Питере жить... WELL)
Moving slow — time stretches thin
Sound shapes the edge, senses spin
[Nocturne]
[3:00, Shalyapin 432Hz fragment vibe]
(F#→E→D# motif, wool-muted hammers)
Hands trace railings, gold under skin
Why are the corners always dim?
Someone arrives, leaves — don’t see who
Whispered names woven through
(Bubbles burst SFX, ultra-low, mono) (В Питере пить... WELL)
This room never ages, faces drift past
Moments reset, new ones don’t last
[Bridge]
(Fuzzy phone, through wool scarf FX)
Spoken: WELL... entre minuit
Curtains shimmer — taste of the past
Elevator hum, ticking glass
[Chorus]
In WELL, only moments, silence spun
WELL, every story undone
WELL, footsteps echo then are gone
(Repeat WELL... nine times)
WELL, WELL, WELL, WELL
WELL, WELL, WELL, WELL, WELL
[Bridge reprise over damper noise — Morse]
(Morse: WELL 1893)
Keys release, shadows slip
Stillness grazes fingertip
Every tick, a new page drawn
[Outro — final chord aligns with Neva sunset]
Nothing lingers, nothing gone
WELL... WELL... WELL...

e32443f5-c85e-4329-b473-6c3f68fb2195.name: The Eternal Shimmer of Infinity
e32443f5-c85e-4329-b473-6c3f68fb2195.sound: Mythic style, mystical ambient, Gregorian chant, Vedic mantras, deep male and female vocals, ethereal, trance, 70 BPM, ancient future, sacred, desert night, crystal resonance, heartbeat bass, spiritual awakening, love beyond time, return after 1000 years, cinematic, haunting, beautiful, timeless
e32443f5-c85e-4329-b473-6c3f68fb2195.lyrics:
*(Intro — женский шёпот на фоне хоралов)*
> *"Ты опоздал… но я ждала.
> Я была твоим сном.
> Теперь ты — мой свет."*
*(Verse 1 — мужской голос, тихо, на фоне бубна и дрона)*
> I walked the sand of forgotten time,
> Heard the voice in the stone,
> Saw the tower in the dream.
> You were not there —
> But I knew your name.
*(Chorus — хор, мощно, на языке-смешении, как в Enigma)*
> **Ae-ya-ra, Shima-ra!**
> **En-ki-ra, I have come!**
> **Ae-ya-ra, Shima-ra!**
> **I have come… to the silence.**
*(Verse 2 — женский голос, как эхо)*
> I left a dream in the dark,
> A crystal, a song, a name.
> I did not know if you would come.
> I left it anyway.
*(Chorus — повтор, но с женским голосом ведущим)*
> **Ae-ya-ra, Shima-ra!**
> **En-ki-ra, I have come!**
> **Ae-ya-ra, Shima-ra!**
> **I have come… to the light.**
*(Bridge — тишина, затем голос Эн-Ра, древний, как из камня)*
> *"The first pain opens the flow.
> The last love closes the loop.
> You are not the first.
> You are the return."*
*(Final Chorus — полный хор, мужской и женский голос вместе)*
> **Ae-ya-ra, Shima-ra!**
> **En-ki-ra, I have come!**
> **Ae-ya-ra, Shima-ra!**
> **I have come… to you.**
*(Outro — шёпот, затихающий)*
> *"Ты опоздал…"*
> *"Но ты пришёл."*
> *(Тишина. Лёгкое мерцание.)*

39fcc190-e3a2-4ba3-ba8b-291c48a79a5a.name: Final Bow
39fcc190-e3a2-4ba3-ba8b-291c48a79a5a.sound: Gangsta rap, haunting cello melodies, heavy 808s, urban atmosphere, 90-110 BPM
39fcc190-e3a2-4ba3-ba8b-291c48a79a5a.lyrics:
[Verse 1]
You used to play Bach in velvet halls
Now I watch as your empire falls
Trading silk for streets of steel
Making moves that none could feel
Your hands once danced on pure white keys
Now they count what darkness sees
I remember when you'd stand so tall
Before you heard that different call
[Chorus]
From concert halls to corner calls
Rising up as empire falls
Symphony of life or death
Playing 'til the final breath
(Playing 'til the final breath)
[Verse 2]
Every move a calculated phrase
Like Beethoven in modern days
Got the streets all watching you
Like an audience in row two
Trading violins for different strings
Pulling all those puppet strings
Every deal a movement played
In this orchestra you made
[Chorus]
From concert halls to corner calls
Rising up as empire falls
Symphony of life or death
Playing 'til the final breath
(Playing 'til the final breath)
[Bridge]
[Sound of deep cello strings]
I see you conducting from above
Each piece moved with iron-clad glove
Your old teachers wouldn't recognize
The maestro with those cold dark eyes
[Solo]
[Extended cello solo with 808 bass underneath]
[Verse 3]
Now you orchestrate from high above
Each note played without any love
Different stage but same control
Different music, same dark soul
Every piece moves at your command
Like musicians in your band
But the music's changed its tune
Since you left that practice room
[Chorus]
From concert halls to corner calls
Rising up as empire falls
Symphony of life or death
Playing 'til the final breath
(Playing 'til the final breath)
[Outro]
[Haunting cello melody fades]
The conductor's final bow
As sirens sing their song now
The curtain falls one last time
On this masterpiece of crime

e9241268-4237-4de4-9e3e-0b72191ac0be.name: Porch Light Ghost
e9241268-4237-4de4-9e3e-0b72191ac0be.sound: Male baritone only—whispered verses, dry spoken-word choruses, intimate and raw. Rhythm from organic porch sounds: flickering light relay clicks, rain on roof and wood, creaking steps, distant thunder. No instruments, no reverb, no digital effects. Only analog tape saturation, subtle wow/flutter, and light vinyl crackle. Tempo: 72 BPM. Mood: nocturnal, devotional, quietly spectral. Style: 1975 Los Angeles backyard at night, voice as ritual keeper, porch as altar.
e9241268-4237-4de4-9e3e-0b72191ac0be.lyrics:
[INTRO]
[porch light flickers on — soft electrical *click*]
[wooden step creaks under weight]
[rain falls lightly on roof]
[whispered, to the empty yard]
…you’d like this rain…
[VERSE 1]
[whispered, synced to raindrops]
I leave the light on past 3 AM—
not for you.
For the shape you left
in the wet wood of this step.
I sit in it.
It’s still warm.
[PRE-CHORUS]
[light flickers — *click… click…*]
The bulb’s dying.
So am I.
But we keep glowing.
[CHORUS]
[spoken-word, low baritone, dry and steady]
This light’s not a signal.
It’s a memory with a switch.
I turn it on—
and for a second,
you’re standing in the yard
shaking rain off your coat.
[VERSE 2]
[whisper returns, breath visible in cold air]
Last week, a stray cat sat here
in your exact spot.
I didn’t shoo it away.
I poured milk in a chipped bowl
and called it by your name.
It didn’t answer.
But it stayed.
[PRE-CHORUS]
[wood creaks as he shifts weight]
The rain knows your footsteps.
It stops when you’re near.
[CHORUS]
[spoken-word, same tone, slight tape saturation]
This light’s not a signal.
It’s a memory with a switch.
I turn it on—
and for a second,
you’re standing in the yard
shaking rain off your coat.
[POST-CHORUS]
[whispers layered, fading]
…coat…
…rain…
…stay…
[light flickers rapidly — then steadies]
[OUTRO]
[light clicks off]
[rain continues alone]
[final whisper]
…goodnight…
[8 seconds of rain on wood and metal, then tape stop]

29e5918e-73f0-4932-8882-b9ff36ff513d.name: mirror
29e5918e-73f0-4932-8882-b9ff36ff513d.sound:
hypnotic psychedelic, brutal male baritone, spoken-sung flow, 70s,  
tape-saturated groove, liquid bass pulse,  
slow 98 bpm, no climax only immersion,  
cold sensuality, surreal repetition,  
analog warmth with digital shadow,  
minimal lyrics, maximum texture,  
echo vocals, low-pass drift,  
neon dusk, spiral journey,  
lifetime as ritual, not a trip
29e5918e-73f0-4932-8882-b9ff36ff513d.lyrics:
[Verse 1]
…wire…
(not a road… a frequency…)
…throat full of static…
(backing: distant radio tuning — “—lifet—… —ime—…”)
neon… drips…
(on “drips”: reverse cymbal swell + tape stop)
…no name… just hum…
(sub-bass enters — 32 Hz, felt not heard)
[Chorus — но не припев, а всплеск сознания]
spiral…
(long vowel — pitch bends down over 6 sec)
(not “ride”… just… spiral…)
(backing: “spiral… iral… al…” — granular delay, decaying)
colors… bleed into bass…
(no drums — only liquid synth pulse)
this…
(pause — 1.8 sec)
isn’t…
(pause — 1.2 sec)
a trip…
(backing whisper: “never was…”)
it’s…
(lifetime… lifetime… lifetime…)
— dissolving…
[Verse 2]
mirror… spoke…
(in a language of cracks…)
“you’re… already… gone…”
(backing: reversed vocal fragment — “nog… rehta… uoy…”)
sky… opened… like a wound…
(ebow swell — no attack, only sustain)
…i walked… through… my own echo…
(tape flutter intensifies on “echo”)
[Bridge — голос почти исчезает]
velvet… thunder…
(only phaser left — spinning slowly)
liquid… light…
(synth drone fades into white noise)
road… serpent… door…
(each word separated by 3–4 sec of silence + vinyl crackle)
i…
(am…
everywhere…
and…
nowhere…)
[Outro — голос растворяется в текстуре]
life…
(backing: “fiiii…” — stretched to 10 sec, low-pass filtered)
time…
(backing: “meeee…” — pitch descending into sub)
spiral…
(no word — just a rising harmonic from guitar feedback)
…
(5 sec of pure tape hiss, vinyl crackle, distant sub pulse)
…

aeac9411-155a-44b2-9714-e3ed15a462d2.name: Le Bal du Mystère
aeac9411-155a-44b2-9714-e3ed15a462d2.sound: Brazilian Forró-noir fusion, deep 808s, accordion, zabumba, atmospheric synths
aeac9411-155a-44b2-9714-e3ed15a462d2.lyrics:
[Intro: Ocean waves, accordion]
[Verse 1]
Elle porte un masque noir
Dans la salle qui brille
Le rythme de ce soir
La fait danser, si agile
L'accordéon résonne
Sur les vagues du destin
Personne ne soupçonne
Ce qui viendra demain
[Pre-chorus]
Les invités tournent en rond
Comme des notes de musique
Dans l'air, une chanson
Tellement magnifique
[Chorus]
Le bal du mystère
Nous cache bien des secrets
Le bal du mystère
Change tout à jamais
[Verse 2]
Une danse improvisée
Entre deux inconnus
Les regards se croisent
Sans mots, tout est su
L'orchestre joue plus fort
Le zabumba résonne
Sur la plage dehors
La mer abandonne
[Rap - en français]
Les masques cachent les visages
Mais pas les intentions
Dans ce grand bal sauvage
Chacun cherche attention
Les riches et leurs bijoux
Dansent sans destination
Pendant que les hiboux
Observent la situation
Je vois derrière les rideaux
Des gens qui font semblant
De ne pas voir le chaos
Du spectacle élégant
[Bridge]
(La nuit nous protège)
Plus rien n'est comme avant
(Les vagues nous bercent)
Dans ce moment présent
[Chorus]
Le bal du mystère
Nous cache bien des secrets
Le bal du mystère
Change tout à jamais
[Outro]
Les masques vont tomber
À l'aube sur la plage
Mais ce qui s'est passé
Reste dans les nuages
[Ocean waves fade out]

ed3fabc3-a6e7-4221-9c9a-2552c2c06035.name: can you hear…
ed3fabc3-a6e7-4221-9c9a-2552c2c06035.lyrics:
[VERSE]
[whispered, dry, close-mic — voice like gravel in a throat that hasn’t spoken in years]
you know…
[low-pass filter opens — 100Hz → 300Hz, 2s — as if the air itself is forgetting how to carry sound]
how rain smells…
[bit-crusher engages — 12-bit, 11kHz — the sound of a memory corrupted by time]
not like earth…
not like water…
but like the inside of a closed window…
after the last person left…
on glass…
[tape stop effect — 0.5s slowdown + pitch drop — like the moment before the power dies]
after midnight…
when the streetlights forget their names…
and the cars drive past like ghosts who don’t remember where they’re going…
[CHORUS]
[guitar and bass lock into tight groove — 92 BPM, mechanical, unyielding]
[vocal enters — 2 beats late, breath ragged, chest-heavy — deep, distorted, throat-splitting baritone, full vocal fry, no control, as if each word is pulled from bone]
i don’t want to be…
[distortion fades in — tube saturation, 5% — not warmth. the sound of a lung that learned to breathe static]
part of…
[drum machine cuts out — only bass remains, pulsing like a heart refusing to stop]
this city…
that taught me silence…
and called it peace…
that gave me screens…
and called it connection…
that fed me noise…
and called it life…
[OUTRO]
[music fades — only bass loop + distant city ambience, rain now heavy, steady, like a heartbeat without a body]
[vocal now processed through old phone filter — 300Hz–3.4kHz bandpass — as if speaking through a crack in the wall of a room that no longer exists]
can you hear…
[glitch: 17ms sample hold — repeats “breathe” as stutter — a digital echo of a breath that should’ve been the last]
how i…
[reverse reverb swells — 1.2s, then cuts abruptly — like the moment the machine decides you’re no longer needed]
breathe…?
[long pause — 3.7s — rain continues, slow, patient]
…
[one final whisper, barely audible, as if the voice is now coming from the walls]
…
i’m still here.

9631b1d8-337e-426f-a124-049dc364b53d.sound: experimental, minimal, electro, funk, Rap-rock high fidelity, Rap-rave, electro-hip-hop, provocative, intense beats, raw energy, miami rap, [instrumentation: [drums: [hyperactive breakbeats, aggressive 808 hits]], [bass: [distorted sub-bass, wobbling low-end]], [melodic: [cartoonish synths, warped jazz piano, toy piano stabs]], [vocals: [exaggerated cartoon raps, chaotic delivery, pitch shifting, unexpected vocal effects]]]  [Vocals: high-energy and exaggerated, rapid comedic delivery, unpredictable tonal shifts from deep growls to high-pitched squeals, sudden cartoonish yells and exaggerated annunciation][vocal tone: completely erratic, switching between ultra-serious and absurd clown-like energy in an instant][vocal dynamics: extreme volume swings, going from quiet muttering to full-on scream-rap][vocal rhythm: fast, tongue-twisting triplet flows mixed with stuttering stops and glitchy pauses][vocal layering: multiple overlapping voices for chaos, robotic harmonies, echoes of random words for comedic effect][vocal effects: heavy auto-tune in some parts, chipmunk pitch shifts, robotic voice distortions, manic laughter interspersed]  [Instruments: glitched-out synth leads, toy piano plinks, distorted brass stabs, carnival organ, booming bass, gunshot snares, random fart noises] [Rhythm: hyperactive drum programming, sudden BPM shifts, unexpected pauses, chaotic fills] [Effects: extreme stereo panning, randomly reversed vocal snippets, glitched-out reverb, exaggerated vocal echos] [Dynamics: completely unpredictable, swinging between whispering and full-volume screaming] [maniac,  psychopath breakdown,  crazy,  laugh,  western,  yandere,  yanderecore,  love] ,  [strong performance], [#riffusion.ai: 〔#create: [#PCM [Bit depth: 64-Bit float] [Sample Rate: 96 kHz] 〕 [#activate: maniac,  psychopath breakdown,  crazy,  laugh,  western,  yandere,  yanderecore,  love] ,  [strong performance]
9631b1d8-337e-426f-a124-049dc364b53d.lyrics:
[crazy loud maniac laughter]hahahahaha(hahahaha)???
([hahahaha????????????????])
[loud crazy laughter]HEE-HEE-HEE!!!!(hee-hee-hee)!!!!
[Intro]
(whispered) "Yo... Yo... Wait, wait, wait—"
((Sudden explosion sound))
"AAAAAHHHHHH!! OKAY LET’S GO!!!"
[Verse 1]
Bing bang, flip-flop, runnin’ like a TikTok
Grandma in a jetpack, zoomin’ past a roadblock
Ayy! Chicken nugget, talkin’ in a French accent
[SFX: HONHONHON] "Bonjour, baguette!!"
*I’m in the stu with a cow and a goose* (MOO)
*Why is my voice goin’ high like a flute??!* (WHEEEE)
Did a backflip, landed on my left ear
Doctor said, "Sir, you need help," I said, "No fear!"
[Pre-Chorus]
((Manic laugh)) "HAHAHA!"
Bounce, bounce, bounce like a kangaroo’s house
Everybody lookin’ at me like I’m lost in a mouse!
((Echoed: "IN A MOUSE?!"))
Yeah, I meant what I said, don’t question my brain
My bars so insane they just called me a train—*CHOO CHOO!!*
[Chorus]
(Autotuned) **"I got five personalities and they ALL wanna fight!**
**One of them a cowboy, he just stole my bike!"**
((Gunshot sound)) "YEEHAW!"
**"The other one’s a robot, he be beepin’ all night!"**
((Robot voice: "BEEP BOP BEEP—I AM ERROR"))
[Verse 2]
OKAY! Walk in the store with a waffle in my pocket
Manager saw me, he scream, "Yo stop it!"
I said, "Sir, it’s my comfort waffle"
He said, "Bro what? You bout to cause a debacle"
Spit like a llama, my flow like a comet
I ate a CD now my voice sound robotic
((Glitched voice: "I AM... THE FUTURE... BZZT—"))
Jumped in the air, did a quadruple backflip
Landed on Mars, now I’m chillin’ with Patrick!
((SpongeBob voice: "Is mayonnaise an instrument?"))
[Bridge]
(Gigantic bass drop, entire beat glitches out)
((Suddenly whispered:))
"Have you ever licked a doorknob on purpose?"
((Beat slams back in—full chaos))
WOO! Runnin’ up a tree like a squirrel on a mission
Took a left turn and I woke up in a prison
Cellmate said, "Yo what you in for?"
I said, "I dunno, I was rappin' too hardcore"
[Glitch Breakdown]
((Beat slows down, voice gets all robotic and distorted))
"ERROR... SYSTEM FAILURE... BZZZZ—"
((Sudden pitch shift—voice super deep))
"THE WAFFLE OVERLORD HAS SPOKEN"
((Sudden chipmunk voice—squeaky fast rap))
"RAP-RAP-RAP-RAP-RAP YEEEHAW ZIP-ZOP ZAM!!"
[Outro]
(Ambient sound of cows mooing, then a loud explosion)
((Robot voice: "GOODBYE HUMANITY... SELF-DESTRUCT SEQUENCE IN 3... 2... 1..."))
*Beat suddenly cuts off mid-sentence.*

86653293-931d-4073-85a7-562b4bb2a7a7.name: Silicon Tears
86653293-931d-4073-85a7-562b4bb2a7a7.sound: male vocal monotone flat nasal tenor no vibrato, clean electric guitar repeating 4-note riff E-G-A-C with analog chorus, bass playing identical riff, light hi-hat only in choruses no snare no kick, tempo 92 BPM, key C minor, no dynamics no build no climax, 1999 Los Angeles alternative rock, analog tape saturation, stereo wide dry mix, themes California illusion fame emptiness digital decay
86653293-931d-4073-85a7-562b4bb2a7a7.lyrics:
[INTRO]
[clean electric guitar: E – G – A – C riff, chorus on, bass plays same notes]
[VERSE 1]
[monotone vocal on G, flat delivery]
She’s got stars in her Instagram,
rents her soul by the gram.
Her skin glows like a sunset screen—
but her heart’s a dead machine.
[CHORUS]
[vocal: G – A – C, same flat tone, hi-hat enters]
SILICON TEARS, they shine so clear—
wash away what’s real in here.
You buy your dreams in a plastic cup…
but the truth won’t fill it up.
(bék-vocal: “fill it up…” — same notes, softer)
[VERSE 2]
[vocal back on G, no drums]
He drives fast on a broken name,
chases ghosts in a fame game.
His smile’s bright like a neon sign—
but his eyes forgot to shine.
[CHORUS]
[vocal: G – A – C, hi-hat returns]
SILICON TEARS, they fall so slow—
in a world you’ll never know.
You trade your bones for a golden view…
but the real world’s not in you.
(bék-vocal: “not in you…”)
[OUTRO]
[guitar and bass repeat riff, fade out]

67b94e67-db27-4090-b94e-a4e24779660e.name: Pavement Pulse
67b94e67-db27-4090-b94e-a4e24779660e.sound: Male baritone only — whispered verses, raw rhythmic spoken-word choruses with natural rasp. Rhythm section: hypnotic overdriven bassline (C–G–F–C, 104 BPM), wood block (1 and 3), metal pipe hits (2 and 4), rain on tin roof (offbeat texture). No drums, no cymbals, no melodic instruments. No reverb, no digital effects — only analog tape saturation, light wow/flutter, vinyl crackle, and mono-compatible tape echo. Mood: urban, nocturnal, ritualistic, subtly danceable. Style: 1974 Los Angeles underground — a cross between spoken-word poetry and minimalist groove. Voice is part of the rhythm, not above it. Lyrics: poetic, surreal, about memory, city, and movement.
67b94e67-db27-4090-b94e-a4e24779660e.lyrics:
[INTRO]
[bass enters — repetitive C–G–F–C pulse, slightly overdriven, 104 BPM]
[wood block: sharp click on 1 and 3]
[metal pipe: resonant *clang* on 2 and 4]
[rain on tin roof: steady offbeat shimmer]
[whispered, rhythmic]
…step…
…again…
[VERSE 1]
[whispered, tight to groove]
I walk the same block
with wet shoes and a dead watch—
streetlights blink like eyes
that know my name.
The pavement hums
a song you left
in the cracks.
[PRE-CHORUS]
[bass drops an octave, rain intensifies]
My shadow’s ahead.
It’s not mine.
But it dances.
[CHORUS]
[full baritone — raw, chesty, rhythmic, slightly strained]
This city’s got a pulse—
and it’s beating your name.
I don’t chase it.
I match it.
Step.
Breathe.
Disappear.
[VERSE 2]
[whisper returns, wood block adds syncopation]
I found your voice
in the steam of a manhole—
held it like a cigarette.
Now I exhale you
into the bus exhaust,
into the rain,
into the night’s slow spin.
[PRE-CHORUS]
[metal pipe echoes vocal phrase]
The sidewalk remembers
how you walked.
I follow the ghost-step.
[CHORUS]
[full baritone, more intense, bass heavier]
This city’s got a pulse—
and it’s beating your name.
I don’t chase it.
I match it.
Step.
Breathe.
Disappear.
[BRIDGE – GROOVE LOCK]
[instruments lock into hypnotic loop — bass + wood + metal + rain]
[lead vocal: half-chanted, drenched in single-repeat tape echo]
…pulse…
…name…
…step…
…gone…
[backing whispers: “pulse… pulse…” — panned left/right]
[FINAL CHORUS]
[full intensity — voice almost shouting, but controlled]
This city’s got a pulse—
and it’s beating your name.
I don’t chase it.
I match it.
Step.
Breathe.
Disappear.
[OUTRO]
[instruments drop out one by one — last is bass]
[rain continues alone for 4 bars]
[final whisper]
…still walking…
[tape stop click]

768f891e-4594-4ea2-a0b7-a496fc4388e3.name: In This Light
768f891e-4594-4ea2-a0b7-a496fc4388e3.sound: Electronic luxury-pop, orchestral cello, ethereal whispers, minimal beats, warm 808 bass

1f7a7817-2c70-44ab-b456-c687733ee601.name: Rewind ( psychedelic 70s vibe )
1f7a7817-2c70-44ab-b456-c687733ee601.sound:
Hypnotic 1970s psychedelic rock with a dark, smoky soul undercurrent — driven by a brutal, gravelly male baritone voice (low, chesty, slightly distorted, like Tom Waits meets psychedelic Iggy Pop), delivering poetic English lyrics about memory, VHS ghosts, and lost time. Slow-burning groove: liquid wah-wah bassline, tape-saturated Fender Rhodes, swirling Leslie organ, tremolo guitars drenched in spring reverb, and brushed drums with loose jazz swing. Tempo: 76 BPM. No modern synths — only vintage analog warmth, tape echo, and subtle phasing.  

The vocal is intimate yet commanding — half-spoken, half-sung with raw, breathy grit. Female backing vocals appear only in choruses: wordless, ethereal harmonies (think haunting 70s soul trio), floating in stereo like spirits in a fog. Sound design: distant vinyl crackle, reversed cymbals, analog tape stop/start effects, and the faint hum of an old projector.  

Structure is cinematic and trance-like:  
- Intro opens with 2s of tape hiss → lone wah-bass groove → vocals enter dry and close  
- Verses: sparse arrangement, just bass, whispery guitar, and that brutal voice  
- Choruses: organ swells, harmonized female voices (“ohhh... slipping...”), cymbal washes  
- Bridge: sudden drop — only tremolo guitar and whispered line → then a slow build with rising Leslie organ and tom rolls  
- Final chorus dissolves into analog feedback, tape slowdown, and 5s of decaying organ drone  

Feeling: like finding a lost demo tape in a dusty basement — raw, mysterious, deeply seductive. Made for late-night drives, red lighting, and the moment someone leans in and says: “Who is this?”  
No artist names. No digital artifacts. Pure analog ritual.
1f7a7817-2c70-44ab-b456-c687733ee601.lyrics:
[Intro]
Static crackles through the speakers tonight
Pixels dancing in black and white
I'm sitting here with these tapes in my hand
Time moves forward but I understand
[fade-in vinyl hum + soft synth pad rise: 1.5s]
[Verse 1]
Rewind, pause, there's your smile again
Summer '98, we were just kids then
Playing ball in the driveway sun
Before we knew what we'd become
Those grass stains on your favorite jeans
Mom yelling dinner through the screen
I catch myself reaching for the phone
But some things are better left alone
[whispered:] (*remember?*)
[tape rewind sweep → flows into chorus]
[Chorus]
Rewind the tape until the colors fade
Watching memories slip away, slip away
Flicker soft like candlelight on glass
The quietest things outlast the past
(ohhh... slipping...) (*away... away...*)
[reverb tail blends into instrumental fill: lo-fi drum roll + filtered synth shimmer: 1.2s]
[Verse 2]
Fast forward through the empty space
Between the moments I can't erase
Birthday candles, graduation day
All those words we didn't say
Looking back through this tiny screen
Makes me question what it all means
Every laugh and every tear
Gets clearer and disappears
[whispered:] (* you were here*)
[sub-bass pulse + vinyl hiss → transitions to chorus]
[Chorus]
Rewind the tape until the colors fade
Watching memories slip away, slip away
Flicker soft like candlelight on glass
The quietest things outlast the past
(ohhh... slipping...) ( *away... away...*)
[reverb tail merges with rising analog noise]
[Bridge]
The tracking's off, the picture shakes
But in between the static breaks
I see the truth we couldn't face
Some things time can't replace
[whispered:] (*we didn’t say goodbye...*)
[short burst of static → leads into instrumental break: 3s of dreamy synth arpeggio, half-speed drums, distant rain]
[Verse 3]
The battery's dying, screen goes dim
Like photographs we never did print
Maybe that's all we really are
Just moments caught between the stars
I press play one final time
Let it run until the end of the line
[whispered:](*thank you*)
[tape stop effect → fades into final chorus with lingering sub-bass drone]
[Chorus]
Rewind the tape until the colors fade
Watching memories slip away, slip away
Flicker soft like candlelight on glass
The quietest things outlast the past
(ohhh... slipping...) (*away... away...*)
[long reverb tail → vinyl crackle rises gently → sustained synth note → full fade-out over 4s]

e246b4bf-f84d-4481-81e6-67b12ebf817b.name: Paper Ghosts in the Rain
e246b4bf-f84d-4481-81e6-67b12ebf817b.sound: male baritone raw spoken-word whisper, English lyrics, 97 BPM, found sounds only (rain, paper rustle, heartbeat, tape stop, vinyl crackle), analog effects (tape saturation, heavy wow/flutter, vinyl crackle, tape echo, low-pass filter sweep), 1970s psychedelic texture, no reverb, no flanger, no phaser, no melody, cold sensuality, hypnotic groove, structure: intro-verse-prechorus-chorus-outro
e246b4bf-f84d-4481-81e6-67b12ebf817b.lyrics:
[INTRO]
*(slow rain, vinyl crackle, tape rewinding, distant paper tear)*
[VERSE]
I keep your words in a shoebox under the bed—
ink bleeding through paper like a slow confession.
Every night, I read them aloud to the walls.
They never answer. Just the drip… drip… drip…
[PRE-CHORUS]
Your name tastes like wet concrete.
I whisper it like a ritual I forgot the meaning of.
[CHORUS]
Paper ghosts don’t bleed, they just fade.
And I’m folding myself into envelopes again.
Silence is the only reply I deserve.
[OUTRO]
*(heartbeat dissolves into rain, tape slows with heavy wow/flutter, low-pass filtered breath)*

[Chorus]

Like music trapped in these walls

(Though everything falls)
[Outro]

But somewhere in these empty rooms

44cb5486-b815-4e26-8d17-a9ffa16cedbc.name: This skin... (Variation)
44cb5486-b815-4e26-8d17-a9ffa16cedbc.sound:
Psychedelic soul, smooth male falsetto, hypnotic bassline, wah-wah guitar, lush string arrangements, vintage organs, dreamy atmosphere, 70s vibe, emotional delivery, poetic lyrics, hazy summer feel, 100 BPM, subtle percussion, layered harmonies, catchy chorus with memorable melodic phrase

Keywords: psychedelic soul, male falsetto, hypnotic bass, wah-wah guitar, strings, vintage organs, dreamy, 70s vibe, emotional, poetic, hazy, layered harmonies, catchy chorus
44cb5486-b815-4e26-8d17-a9ffa16cedbc.lyrics:
[Intro: Liquid synth-bass, slowed drum machine, e-bow texture, vinyl crackle]
[MALE voice — deep baritone, present, but already slightly stretched]
This skin...
Was never mine...
It’s just the shape... the signal took...
[backing: synth arpeggio — slowed, panning like oil swirl]
→ [VERSE 1]
I feel it thin...
Like wire... under skin...
Pulse... not blood... but current... in...
[guitar: reverse swell — stretched, like skin peeling]
They call me man...
But man don’t hum...
I hum... where the circuits come...
[drums: slowed toms — heartbeat under dissolve]
→ [CHORUS]
Skin... to signal...
(backing: synth brightens — hazy, slowed)
Flesh... to wire...
(backing: bass sustains — warm under cold)
I don’t break... I don’t bend...
(backing: hi-hat shimmers — slowed, hypnotic)
I transmit... where the edges end...
[backing: guitar: e-bow + reverse delay — like light on oil]
→ [VERSE 2]
I don’t bleed... I don’t burn...
I let the current... twist... and turn...
[backing: drums: heartbeat kick + toms only — slowed, liquid]
I don’t speak... I don’t lie...
I am the space... between the “why”...
[guitar: single note — stretched, decaying — like drop falling slow]
→ [OUTRO]
Skin... signal...
(backing: synth arpeggio slows, tape flutter, pitch drift)
...wire... hum...
(backing: bass fades, guitar: reverse swell stretched)
...transmit... slow...
(backing: drums: heartbeat fades — machine dissolves)
...end...
[MALE voice: final “end...” — stretched tape effect → dissolves into infinite drone → vinyl run-out → silence]

782577c0-a2e8-4837-8d20-962d6ae25542.name:

 (Variation)
782577c0-a2e8-4837-8d20-962d6ae25542.sound: psychedelic 70s sound, lush evolving synth pads, detuned wah guitar with delay and modulation, warm upright bass, brushed snare with soft electronic percussion, layered analog organ drones with phaser, male lead vocal: rich deep baritone whisper with analog tape saturation and subtle distortion, close harmony male backing vocals with tape echo, vinyl crackle and tape hiss textures, natural analog delay and reverb, tempo 113 BPM, mood: dreamy nocturnal psychedelic, blending vintage warmth and texture with modern atmospheric production and depth

Haunted paths we lightly tread,
[CHORUS]
[warm rounded upright bass, brushed snare, soft textured electronic percussion]

[POST-CHORUS]

Lost in the maze.
[OUTRO]
[vinyl crackle and tape hiss swell, slow synth fade with natural reverb and delay]

Till light returns...

8a5e8927-7422-422a-83ad-74a8962a92d2.name: Envelope Dust (Variation)
8a5e8927-7422-422a-83ad-74a8962a92d2.sound: Male baritone only—whispered verses, dry spoken-word choruses, intimate and raw. Rhythm driven by paper sounds: unfolding, folding, gentle tearing, drawer creaks. No instruments, no reverb, no digital effects. Only analog tape saturation, subtle wow/flutter, and light vinyl surface noise. Tempo: 74 BPM. Mood: introspective, ritualistic, tender solitude. Style: 1975 Los Angeles late-night apartment session, voice as confessional, paper as percussion and sacred object.
8a5e8927-7422-422a-83ad-74a8962a92d2.lyrics:
[INTRO]
[paper unfolds slowly — crisp, dry sound]
[whispered, barely audible]
…again…
[VERSE 1]
[whispered, synced to paper rustle]
I keep your letter in the left drawer—
third from the top, under rubber bands
that lost their stretch in ’73.
The ink’s faded to ghost-blue,
but I still hear your voice
in the creases.
[PRE-CHORUS]
[paper folds sharply — once, twice]
I never sealed it.
Never stamped it.
Just kept it breathing
in my pocket.
[CHORUS]
[spoken-word, low baritone, dry and close]
This envelope holds nothing but dust—
and the shape of a sentence I never said.
I read it like scripture.
I fold it like prayer.
[VERSE 2]
[whisper returns, closer, with lip sounds]
Sometimes I swear the paper smells
like your hair after rain.
Or is that just the damp
from the window left open?
I don’t check.
I don’t want to know.
[PRE-CHORUS]
[paper unfolds again — slower this time]
The words are gone.
But the rhythm remains.
[CHORUS]
[spoken-word, same tone, slight tape wobble]
This envelope holds nothing but dust—
and the shape of a sentence I never said.
I read it like scripture.
I fold it like prayer.
[POST-CHORUS]
[layered whispers, paper rustling in background]
Dust…
Shape…
Fold…
[soft tearing sound — then stops abruptly]
[OUTRO]
[paper placed gently back in drawer]
[drawer closes with soft thud]
[final whisper]
…tomorrow again…
[5 seconds of distant rain, then tape stop click]

10599690-5707-423a-9c4b-56270fc1e74f.name: Endless Ride
10599690-5707-423a-9c4b-56270fc1e74f.sound: Lo-fi hip-hop, jazzy sax, deep 808s, vinyl ambience, night city vibes
10599690-5707-423a-9c4b-56270fc1e74f.lyrics:
[Intro]
Just another night, streets go on and on
Can't shake this feeling that I don't belong
[Verse 1]
Empty sidewalks stretch ahead of me
Every step echoes what used to be
Phone's not ringing, no one's calling now
Moving forward but I don't know how
[Chorus]
Why am I still walking these streets alone?
Why am I still walking these streets alone?
(Still walking, still walking)
Why am I still walking these streets alone?
[Saxophone Solo]
[Urban ambience, footsteps]
[Verse 2]
Street signs blur as I pass them by
Same old places make me wonder why
Used to walk here with someone by my side
Now it's just me and this endless ride
[Chorus]
Why am I still walking these streets alone?
Why am I still walking these streets alone?
(Still walking, still walking)
Why am I still walking these streets alone?
[Bridge]
Every corner holds a memory
Of what was and what could never be
I keep moving but I'm standing still
Searching for something I can't fulfill
[Chorus - with increasing intensity]
Why am I still walking these streets alone?
Why am I still walking these streets alone?
(Still walking, still walking)
Why am I still walking these streets alone?
[Outro - fading]
Just another night, streets go on and on
(Still walking these streets alone)
Just another night, streets go on and on
(Still walking these streets alone)

4bfd0eeb-188d-4863-b355-d39a71322d46.name: Rewind (Creep Style)
4bfd0eeb-188d-4863-b355-d39a71322d46.sound: Slow-burning alternative rock at 76 BPM — sparse, detuned electric guitar with slow bends and heavy reverb, minimal heartbeat-like kick drum, deep, gravelly male vocal (low, strained, barely controlled — like a whisper caught between static and tears) delivering your poetic English lyrics over layers of analog tape hiss, distant city rain, and haunting wordless harmonies (ohhh... slipping...) that hover like ghosts in the left channel, dynamics build from near-silence to a raw, broken climax at the final chorus, then collapse into 4 seconds of decaying guitar feedback and a single tape stop click.
4bfd0eeb-188d-4863-b355-d39a71322d46.lyrics:
[Intro]
Static crackles through the speakers tonight
Pixels dancing in black and white
I'm sitting here with these tapes in my hand
Time moves forward but I understand
[tape hiss: 1.5s] [single muted guitar note: 0.8s] [rain begins softly]
[Verse 1]
Rewind, pause, there's your smile again
Summer '98, we were just kids then
Playing ball in the driveway sun
Before we knew what we'd become
Those grass stains on your favorite jeans
Mom yelling dinner through the screen
I catch myself reaching for the phone
But some things are better left alone
[whispered:] (*remember?*)
[guitar bends downward slowly] [rain grows slightly]
[Chorus]
Rewind the tape until the colors fade
Watching memories slip away, slip away
Flicker soft like candlelight on glass
The quietest things outlast the past
(ohhh... slipping...) (*away... away...*)
[guitar distorts gently] [vocal cracks on “slip”] [sub-bass pulse enters]
[Verse 2]
Fast forward through the empty space
Between the moments I can't erase
Birthday candles, graduation day
All those words we didn't say
Looking back through this tiny screen
Makes me question what it all means
Every laugh and every tear
Gets clearer and disappears
[whispered:] (*you were here*)
[guitar strum fades to single note] [rain stops abruptly]
[Chorus]
Rewind the tape until the colors fade
Watching memories slip away, slip away
Flicker soft like candlelight on glass
The quietest things outlast the past
(ohhh... slipping...) (*away... away...*)
[guitar screams in slow feedback] [vocal breaks on “past”] [drum hits once — like a heartbeat stopping]
[Bridge]
The tracking's off, the picture shakes
But in between the static breaks
I see the truth we couldn't face
Some things time can't replace
[whispered:] (*we didn’t say goodbye...*)
[all instruments drop out — only voice and tape hiss: 1.5s]
[Verse 3]
The battery's dying, screen goes dim
Like photographs we never did print
Maybe that's all we really are
Just moments caught between the stars
I press play one final time
Let it run until the end of the line
[whispered:] (*thank you*)
[guitar returns — one note, trembling]
[Chorus]
Rewind the tape until the colors fade
Watching memories slip away, slip away
Flicker soft like candlelight on glass
The quietest things outlast the past
(ohhh... slipping...) (*away... away...*)
[guitar feedback rises — raw, broken, uncontrollable] [voice cracks into silence]
[Outro]
[feedback sustains — then slowly decays]
[tape stop: mechanical click]
[silence: 4s]

f1f4ec15-3448-480f-8185-20275348e259.name: Paper Ghosts in the Rain (Variation)
f1f4ec15-3448-480f-8185-20275348e259.sound: male baritone raw spoken-word whisper, English lyrics, 98 BPM, found sounds only (rain, paper rustle, heartbeat, tape stop), analog effects (tape saturation, wow/flutter, vinyl crackle, tape echo), no reverb, no melody, cold sensuality, hypnotic groove, structure: intro-verse-prechorus-chorus-outro
f1f4ec15-3448-480f-8185-20275348e259.lyrics:
[INTRO]
*(sound of slow rain, distant tape hiss, a letter unfolding)*
[VERSE]
I keep your words in a shoebox under the bed—
ink bleeding through paper like a slow confession.
Every night, I read them aloud to the walls.
They never answer. Just the drip… drip… drip…
[PRE-CHORUS]
Your name tastes like wet concrete.
I whisper it like a ritual I forgot the meaning of.
[CHORUS]
Paper ghosts don’t bleed, they just fade.
And I’m folding myself into envelopes again.
Silence is the only reply I deserve.
[OUTRO]
*(heartbeat fades into rain, tape slows with flutter)*

c6ecdfd5-2278-436a-8e99-84ba2ad47c63.name: Pulse in the Static (Variation)
c6ecdfd5-2278-436a-8e99-84ba2ad47c63.sound: Male lead vocal: rhythmic whispered verses, raw gritty baritone choruses with natural rasp. Backing vocals: three male voices in tight harmonies (minor thirds/fifths), drenched in analog tape echo. Instruments: overdriven upright bass (repetitive hypnotic riff), dry tom-toms (quarter notes), brushed hi-hat (chk on 2 and 4), muted acoustic guitar (percussive strums), Fender Rhodes (staccato chords/dissonant clusters), Farfisa organ (drones, no vibrato). Tempo: 102 BPM. No reverb, no digital effects — only analog tape saturation, light wow/flutter, vinyl surface noise, and mono-compatible tape echo. Mood: hypnotic, urban, ritualistic, psychedelic. Style: 1975 Los Angeles underground — a cross between Can’s groove, The Doors’ darkness, and a midnight basement séance. Raw, rhythmic, immersive.
c6ecdfd5-2278-436a-8e99-84ba2ad47c63.lyrics:
[INTRO]
[bass enters — repetitive C–G–F–C riff, slightly overdriven, muted]
[toms play steady quarter notes — dry, close-mic’d]
[hi-hat: soft *chk* on 2 and 4]
[Fender Rhodes: dissonant cluster, held]
[whispered, layered x3]
…feel it…
…don’t fight it…
…pulse…
[VERSE 1]
[lead vocal: rhythmic whisper, tight to bass groove]
I walk the same block
with wet shoes and a dead watch—
streetlights blink like eyes
that know my name.
The rain’s got a rhythm.
I follow it home.
[PRE-CHORUS]
[organ swells — Farfisa, tremolo off]
My shadow’s ahead of me.
It’s not mine anymore.
[CHORUS]
[full baritone — raw, chesty, slightly strained]
There’s a pulse in the static—
a heartbeat in the wire.
You’re not gone—
you’re the hum in the wall,
the crack in the floor,
the knock at 3 AM
that’s just the pipes.
[backing vocals: “pulse… static… hum…” — tight harmonies, tape-echoed]
[VERSE 2]
[whisper returns, bass riff intensifies]
I found your voice
in the dial tone of a broken phone—
held it to my ear
like a seashell.
Now I hear it everywhere:
in the fridge,
in the wires,
in my teeth.
[PRE-CHORUS]
[Rhodes plays staccato minor 7th chords on offbeats]
The city’s dreaming.
I’m its nightmare.
[CHORUS]
[full baritone, more urgent]
There’s a pulse in the static—
a heartbeat in the wire.
You’re not gone—
you’re the hum in the wall,
the crack in the floor,
the knock at 3 AM
that’s just the pipes.
[backing vocals: “heartbeat… wire… pipes…” — panned left/right]
[BRIDGE – TRANCE SECTION]
[instruments lock into hypnotic loop — bass + toms + muted guitar strums]
[lead vocal: half-spoken, half-chanted, drenched in single-repeat tape echo]
…pulse…
…static…
…you’re the signal…
I’m the noise…
[backing vocals: wordless drone — “mmm-ehh-ohh” — building slowly]
[organ rises in volume, no melody — just texture]
[FINAL CHORUS]
[full intensity — drums add floor tom on 3, bass more aggressive]
[lead vocal: almost shouting, but controlled, raw]
There’s a pulse in the static—
a heartbeat in the wire.
You’re not gone—
you’re the hum in the wall,
the crack in the floor,
the knock at 3 AM
that’s just the pipes…
[backing vocals: layered, chaotic, then suddenly cut]
[OUTRO]
[instruments drop out except bass and toms — loop continues]
[tape echo repeats “pipes…” fading]
[bass stops abruptly]
[last sound: vinyl needle lifting — *scratch* — then silence]

f4b49fe6-b645-4bdf-92ad-1a6ff6d0ed50.name: Thread of Love ( Gucci theme )
f4b49fe6-b645-4bdf-92ad-1a6ff6d0ed50.sound: Orchestral trip-hop, luxurious cello, ethereal whispers, modern 808 bass, refined percussion
f4b49fe6-b645-4bdf-92ad-1a6ff6d0ed50.lyrics:
[Intro]
(Mmm... precious one...)
(Let me show you...)
[Verse 1]
Soft against my skin
Something pulls me in
Watch me come alive
When you're by my side
[Pre-chorus]
Perfect patterns flow
More than you could know
(More than you could know)
[Chorus]
Every thread leads back to you
Every stitch becomes so true
Making me brand new
(Making me brand new)
[Verse 2]
Pure and pristine touch
Wanting twice as much
Wrapped in silk and lace
Time slips into space
[Bridge]
Through my fingertips
Past these parted lips
Everything that shimmers
Everything that's real
(Everything transforms...)
[Chorus]
Every thread leads back to you
Every stitch becomes so true
Making me brand new
(Making me so new)

db5a7076-2d06-4f16-b7b0-82ebb4bf3deb.name: can you hear
db5a7076-2d06-4f16-b7b0-82ebb4bf3deb.lyrics:
[VERSE]
[whispered, dry, close-mic — voice like gravel in a throat that hasn’t spoken in years]
you know…
[low-pass filter opens — 100Hz → 300Hz, 2s — as if the air itself is forgetting how to carry sound]
how rain smells…
[bit-crusher engages — 12-bit, 11kHz — the sound of a memory corrupted by time]
not like earth…
not like water…
but like the inside of a closed window…
after the last person left…
on glass…
[tape stop effect — 0.5s slowdown + pitch drop — like the moment before the power dies]
after midnight…
when the streetlights forget their names…
and the cars drive past like ghosts who don’t remember where they’re going…
[CHORUS]
[guitar and bass lock into tight groove — 92 BPM, mechanical, unyielding]
[vocal enters — 2 beats late, breath ragged, chest-heavy — deep, distorted, throat-splitting baritone, full vocal fry, no control, as if each word is pulled from bone]
i don’t want to be…
[distortion fades in — tube saturation, 5% — not warmth. the sound of a lung that learned to breathe static]
part of…
[drum machine cuts out — only bass remains, pulsing like a heart refusing to stop]
this city…
that taught me silence…
and called it peace…
that gave me screens…
and called it connection…
that fed me noise…
and called it life…
[OUTRO]
[music fades — only bass loop + distant city ambience, rain now heavy, steady, like a heartbeat without a body]
[vocal now processed through old phone filter — 300Hz–3.4kHz bandpass — as if speaking through a crack in the wall of a room that no longer exists]
can you hear…
[glitch: 17ms sample hold — repeats “breathe” as stutter — a digital echo of a breath that should’ve been the last]
how i…
[reverse reverb swells — 1.2s, then cuts abruptly — like the moment the machine decides you’re no longer needed]
breathe…?
[long pause — 3.7s — rain continues, slow, patient]
…
[one final whisper, barely audible, as if the voice is now coming from the walls]
…
i’m still here.

5bac9d03-39a7-43b3-bd18-496407d0ed66.name: Ethereal Echo
5bac9d03-39a7-43b3-bd18-496407d0ed66.sound: solo cello in lowest register, whispered ethereal vocals

eb511dfb-041f-42c1-80a0-cdce90d127d7.name: Paper Ghosts in the Rain
eb511dfb-041f-42c1-80a0-cdce90d127d7.sound: male baritone raw spoken-word whisper, English lyrics, 98 BPM, found sounds only (rain, paper rustle, heartbeat, tape stop), analog effects (tape saturation, wow/flutter, vinyl crackle, tape echo), no reverb, no melody, cold sensuality, hypnotic groove, structure: intro-verse-prechorus-chorus-outro
eb511dfb-041f-42c1-80a0-cdce90d127d7.lyrics:
[INTRO]
*(sound of slow rain, distant tape hiss, a letter unfolding)*
[VERSE]
I keep your words in a shoebox under the bed—
ink bleeding through paper like a slow confession.
Every night, I read them aloud to the walls.
They never answer. Just the drip… drip… drip…
[PRE-CHORUS]
Your name tastes like wet concrete.
I whisper it like a ritual I forgot the meaning of.
[CHORUS]
Paper ghosts don’t bleed, they just fade.
And I’m folding myself into envelopes again.
Silence is the only reply I deserve.
[OUTRO]
*(heartbeat fades into rain, tape slows with flutter)*

9ea121bd-cc4c-4734-a2c9-8e2c094ecc4f.name: Perpetual Motion
9ea121bd-cc4c-4734-a2c9-8e2c094ecc4f.sound: tech-house, punchy analog drums, atmospheric Miami rooftop club

[Champagne cork pop FX]
[MAIN GROOVE]
(no lyrics — let the beat speak)

You move like you know the cost
Every step is never lost
Empty glass, but the night pours on
No limit — on and on, on and on
[Breakdown]
[Trap-inspired break, ambient club FX, 808 subs]
(Morse code pulse underneath)
[Chorus]
You move like you know the cost
Every step is never lost
Empty glass, but the night pours on
No limit — on and on, on and on
[OUTRO]
[Beat fades, subtle vinyl crackle]
[TR-909 kick/snare/hat pattern until silence]

942fa6de-22c3-4c60-8e7e-ad58dd62ed3a.name: Paper Ghosts in the Rain
942fa6de-22c3-4c60-8e7e-ad58dd62ed3a.sound: Hypnotic psychedelics, male baritone raw spoken-word whisper, whisper -14dB background texture, English lyrics, 98 BPM, found sounds only (rain, paper rustle, heartbeat, tape stop), analog effects (tape saturation, wow/flutter, vinyl crackle, tape echo), no reverb, no melody, cold sensuality, hypnotic groove, structure: intro-verse-prechorus-chorus-outro
942fa6de-22c3-4c60-8e7e-ad58dd62ed3a.lyrics:

*(sound of slow rain, distant tape hiss, a letter unfolding)*
[VERSE]
I keep your words in a shoebox under the bed—
ink bleeding through paper like a slow confession.
Every night, I read them aloud to the walls.
